2857}
2858
2859inline void Sequence::accept(Visitor& v) { v.visit(*this); }
2860inline void PrioritizedChoice::accept(Visitor& v) { v.visit(*this); }
2861inline void ZeroOrMore::accept(Visitor& v) { v.visit(*this); }
2862inline void OneOrMore::accept(Visitor& v) { v.visit(*this); }
2863inline void Option::accept(Visitor& v) { v.visit(*this); }
2864inline void AndPredicate::accept(Visitor& v) { v.visit(*this); }
2865inline void NotPredicate::accept(Visitor& v) { v.visit(*this); }
2866inline void LiteralString::accept(Visitor& v) { v.visit(*this); }
2867inline void CharacterClass::accept(Visitor& v) { v.visit(*this); }
2868inline void Character::accept(Visitor& v) { v.visit(*this); }
2869inline void AnyCharacter::accept(Visitor& v) { v.visit(*this); }
2870inline void CaptureScope::accept(Visitor& v) { v.visit(*this); }
2871inline void Capture::accept(Visitor& v) { v.visit(*this); }
2872inline void TokenBoundary::accept(Visitor& v) { v.visit(*this); }
2873inline void Ignore::accept(Visitor& v) { v.visit(*this); }
2874inline void User::accept(Visitor& v) { v.visit(*this); }
2875inline void WeakHolder::accept(Visitor& v) { v.visit(*this); }
2876inline void Holder::accept(Visitor& v) { v.visit(*this); }
2877inline void Reference::accept(Visitor& v) { v.visit(*this); }
2878inline void Whitespace::accept(Visitor& v) { v.visit(*this); }
2879inline void BackReference::accept(Visitor& v) { v.visit(*this); }
2880
2881inline void AssignIDToDefinition::visit(Holder& ope) {
2882 auto p = static_cast<void*>(ope.outer_);
2883 if (ids.count(p)) {
2884 return;
2885 }
2886 auto id = ids.size();
2887 ids[p] = id;
2888 ope.outer_->id = id;
2889 ope.ope_->accept(*this);
2890}
2891
2892inline void AssignIDToDefinition::visit(Reference& ope) {
2893 if (ope.rule_) {
2894 for (auto arg: ope.args_) {
2895 arg->accept(*this);
2896 }
2897 ope.rule_->accept(*this);
2898 }
2899}
2900
2901inline void TokenChecker::visit(Reference& ope) {
2902 if (ope.is_macro_) {
2903 ope.rule_->accept(*this);
2904 for (auto arg: ope.args_) {
2905 arg->accept(*this);
2906 }
2907 } else {
2908 has_rule_ = true;
2909 }
2910}
2911
2912inline void DetectLeftRecursion::visit(Reference& ope) {
2913 if (ope.name_ == name_) {
2914 error_s = ope.s_;
2915 } else if (!refs_.count(ope.name_)) {
2916 refs_.insert(ope.name_);
2917 if (ope.rule_) {
2918 ope.rule_->accept(*this);
2919 if (done_ == false) {
2920 return;
2921 }
2922 }
2923 }
2924 done_ = true;
2925}
2926
2927inline void ReferenceChecker::visit(Reference& ope) {
2928 auto it = std::find(params_.begin(), params_.end(), ope.name_);
2929 if (it != params_.end()) {
2930 return;
2931 }
2932
2933 if (!grammar_.count(ope.name_)) {
2934 error_s[ope.name_] = ope.s_;
2935 error_message[ope.name_] = "'" + ope.name_ + "' is not defined.";
2936 } else {
2937 const auto& rule = grammar_.at(ope.name_);
2938 if (rule.is_macro) {
2939 if (!ope.is_macro_ || ope.args_.size() != rule.params.size()) {
2940 error_s[ope.name_] = ope.s_;
2941 error_message[ope.name_] = "incorrect number of arguments.";
2942 }
2943 } else if (ope.is_macro_) {
2944 error_s[ope.name_] = ope.s_;
2945 error_message[ope.name_] = "'" + ope.name_ + "' is not macro.";
2946 }
2947 }
2948}
2949
2950inline void LinkReferences::visit(Reference& ope) {
2951 if (grammar_.count(ope.name_)) {
2952 auto& rule = grammar_.at(ope.name_);
2953 ope.rule_ = &rule;
2954 } else {
2955 for (size_t i = 0; i < params_.size(); i++) {
2956 const auto& param = params_[i];
2957 if (param == ope.name_) {
2958 ope.iarg_ = i;
2959 break;
2960 }
2961 }
2962 }
2963 for (auto arg: ope.args_) {
2964 arg->accept(*this);
2965 }
2966}
2967
2968inline void FindReference::visit(Reference& ope) {
2969 for (size_t i = 0; i < args_.size(); i++) {
2970 const auto& name = params_[i];
2971 if (name == ope.name_) {
2972 found_ope = args_[i];
2973 return;
2974 }
2975 }
2976 found_ope = ope.shared_from_this();
2977}
2978
2979/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2980 * PEG parser generator
2981 *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2982
2983typedef std::unordered_map<std::string, std::shared_ptr<Ope>> Rules;
2984typedef std::function<void (size_t, size_t, const std::string&)> Log;
2985
2986class ParserGenerator
2987{
2988public:
2989 static std::shared_ptr<Grammar> parse(
2990 const char* s,
2991 size_t n,
2992 const Rules& rules,
2993 std::string& start,
2994 Log log)
2995 {
2996 return get_instance().perform_core(s, n, rules, start, log);
2997 }
2998
2999 static std::shared_ptr<Grammar> parse(
3000 const char* s,
3001 size_t n,
3002 std::string& start,
3003 Log log)
3004 {
3005 Rules dummy;
3006 return parse(s, n, dummy, start, log);
3007 }
3008
3009 // For debuging purpose
3010 static Grammar& grammar() {
3011 return get_instance().g;
3012 }
3013
3014private:
3015 static ParserGenerator& get_instance() {
3016 static ParserGenerator instance;
3017 return instance;
3018 }
3019
3020 ParserGenerator() {
3021 make_grammar();
3022 setup_actions();
3023 }
3024
3025 struct Data {
3026 std::shared_ptr<Grammar> grammar;
3027 std::string start;
3028 std::vector<std::pair<std::string, const char*>> duplicates;
3029
3030 Data(): grammar(std::make_shared<Grammar>()) {}
3031 };
3032
3033 void make_grammar() {
3034 // Setup PEG syntax parser
3035 g["Grammar"] <= seq(g["Spacing"], oom(g["Definition"]), g["EndOfFile"]);
3036 g["Definition"] <= cho(seq(g["Ignore"], g["IdentCont"], g["Parameters"], g["LEFTARROW"], g["Expression"]),
3037 seq(g["Ignore"], g["Identifier"], g["LEFTARROW"], g["Expression"]));
3038
3039 g["Expression"] <= seq(g["Sequence"], zom(seq(g["SLASH"], g["Sequence"])));
3040 g["Sequence"] <= zom(g["Prefix"]);
3041 g["Prefix"] <= seq(opt(cho(g["AND"], g["NOT"])), g["Suffix"]);
3042 g["Suffix"] <= seq(g["Primary"], opt(cho(g["QUESTION"], g["STAR"], g["PLUS"])));
3043 g["Primary"] <= cho(seq(g["Ignore"], g["IdentCont"], g["Arguments"], npd(g["LEFTARROW"])),
3044 seq(g["Ignore"], g["Identifier"], npd(seq(opt(g["Parameters"]), g["LEFTARROW"]))),
3045 seq(g["OPEN"], g["Expression"], g["CLOSE"]),
3046 seq(g["BeginTok"], g["Expression"], g["EndTok"]),
3047 seq(g["BeginCapScope"], g["Expression"], g["EndCapScope"]),
3048 seq(g["BeginCap"], g["Expression"], g["EndCap"]),
3049 g["BackRef"], g["LiteralI"], g["Literal"], g["Class"], g["DOT"]);
3050
3051 g["Identifier"] <= seq(g["IdentCont"], g["Spacing"]);
3052 g["IdentCont"] <= seq(g["IdentStart"], zom(g["IdentRest"]));
3053
3054 const static std::vector<std::pair<char32_t, char32_t>> range = {{ 0x0080, 0xFFFF }};
3055 g["IdentStart"] <= cho(cls("a-zA-Z_%"), cls(range));
3056
3057 g["IdentRest"] <= cho(g["IdentStart"], cls("0-9"));
3058
3059 g["LiteralI"] <= cho(seq(cls("'"), tok(zom(seq(npd(cls("'")), g["Char"]))), lit("'i"), g["Spacing"]),
3060 seq(cls("\""), tok(zom(seq(npd(cls("\"")), g["Char"]))), lit("\"i"), g["Spacing"]));
3061
3062 g["Literal"] <= cho(seq(cls("'"), tok(zom(seq(npd(cls("'")), g["Char"]))), cls("'"), g["Spacing"]),
3063 seq(cls("\""), tok(zom(seq(npd(cls("\"")), g["Char"]))), cls("\""), g["Spacing"]));
3064
3065 g["Class"] <= seq(chr('['), tok(zom(seq(npd(chr(']')), g["Range"]))), chr(']'), g["Spacing"]);
3066
3067 g["Range"] <= cho(seq(g["Char"], chr('-'), g["Char"]), g["Char"]);
3068 g["Char"] <= cho(seq(chr('\\'), cls("nrt'\"[]\\")),
3069 seq(chr('\\'), cls("0-3"), cls("0-7"), cls("0-7")),
3070 seq(chr('\\'), cls("0-7"), opt(cls("0-7"))),
3071 seq(lit("\\x"), cls("0-9a-fA-F"), opt(cls("0-9a-fA-F"))),
3072 seq(lit("\\u"), cls("0-9a-fA-F"), cls("0-9a-fA-F"), cls("0-9a-fA-F"), cls("0-9a-fA-F")),
3073 seq(npd(chr('\\')), dot()));
3074
3075#if defined(PEGLIB_NO_UNICODE_CHARS)
3076 g["LEFTARROW"] <= seq(lit("<-"), g["Spacing"]);
3077#else
3078 g["LEFTARROW"] <= seq(cho(lit("<-"), lit(u8"â")), g["Spacing"]);
3079#endif
3080 ~g["SLASH"] <= seq(chr('/'), g["Spacing"]);
3081 g["AND"] <= seq(chr('&'), g["Spacing"]);
3082 g["NOT"] <= seq(chr('!'), g["Spacing"]);
3083 g["QUESTION"] <= seq(chr('?'), g["Spacing"]);
3084 g["STAR"] <= seq(chr('*'), g["Spacing"]);
3085 g["PLUS"] <= seq(chr('+'), g["Spacing"]);
3086 ~g["OPEN"] <= seq(chr('('), g["Spacing"]);
3087 ~g["CLOSE"] <= seq(chr(')'), g["Spacing"]);
3088 g["DOT"] <= seq(chr('.'), g["Spacing"]);
3089
3090 ~g["Spacing"] <= zom(cho(g["Space"], g["Comment"]));
3091 g["Comment"] <= seq(chr('#'), zom(seq(npd(g["EndOfLine"]), dot())), g["EndOfLine"]);
3092 g["Space"] <= cho(chr(' '), chr('\t'), g["EndOfLine"]);
3093 g["EndOfLine"] <= cho(lit("\r\n"), chr('\n'), chr('\r'));
3094 g["EndOfFile"] <= npd(dot());
3095
3096 ~g["BeginTok"] <= seq(chr('<'), g["Spacing"]);
3097 ~g["EndTok"] <= seq(chr('>'), g["Spacing"]);
3098
3099 ~g["BeginCapScope"] <= seq(chr('$'), chr('('), g["Spacing"]);
3100 ~g["EndCapScope"] <= seq(chr(')'), g["Spacing"]);
3101
3102 g["BeginCap"] <= seq(chr('$'), tok(g["IdentCont"]), chr('<'), g["Spacing"]);
3103 ~g["EndCap"] <= seq(chr('>'), g["Spacing"]);
3104
3105 g["BackRef"] <= seq(chr('$'), tok(g["IdentCont"]), g["Spacing"]);
3106
3107 g["IGNORE"] <= chr('~');
3108
3109 g["Ignore"] <= opt(g["IGNORE"]);
3110 g["Parameters"] <= seq(g["OPEN"], g["Identifier"], zom(seq(g["COMMA"], g["Identifier"])), g["CLOSE"]);
3111 g["Arguments"] <= seq(g["OPEN"], g["Expression"], zom(seq(g["COMMA"], g["Expression"])), g["CLOSE"]);
3112 ~g["COMMA"] <= seq(chr(','), g["Spacing"]);
3113
3114
3115 // Set definition names
3116 for (auto& x: g) {
3117 x.second.name = x.first;
3118 }
3119 }
3120
3121 void setup_actions() {
3122 g["Definition"] = [&](const SemanticValues& sv, any& dt) {
3123 auto is_macro = sv.choice() == 0;
3124 auto ignore = sv[0].get<bool>();
3125 auto name = sv[1].get<std::string>();
3126
3127 std::vector<std::string> params;
3128 std::shared_ptr<Ope> ope;
3129 if (is_macro) {
3130 params = sv[2].get<std::vector<std::string>>();
3131 ope = sv[4].get<std::shared_ptr<Ope>>();
3132 } else {
3133 ope = sv[3].get<std::shared_ptr<Ope>>();
3134 }
3135
3136 Data& data = *dt.get<Data*>();
3137
3138 auto& grammar = *data.grammar;
3139 if (!grammar.count(name)) {
3140 auto& rule = grammar[name];
3141 rule <= ope;
3142 rule.name = name;
3143 rule.ignoreSemanticValue = ignore;
3144 rule.is_macro = is_macro;
3145 rule.params = params;
3146
3147 if (data.start.empty()) {
3148 data.start = name;
3149 }
3150 } else {
3151 data.duplicates.emplace_back(name, sv.c_str());
3152 }
3153 };
3154
3155 g["Expression"] = [&](const SemanticValues& sv) {
3156 if (sv.size() == 1) {
3157 return sv[0].get<std::shared_ptr<Ope>>();
3158 } else {
3159 std::vector<std::shared_ptr<Ope>> opes;
3160 for (auto i = 0u; i < sv.size(); i++) {
3161 opes.emplace_back(sv[i].get<std::shared_ptr<Ope>>());
3162 }
3163 const std::shared_ptr<Ope> ope = std::make_shared<PrioritizedChoice>(opes);
3164 return ope;
3165 }
3166 };
3167
3168 g["Sequence"] = [&](const SemanticValues& sv) {
3169 if (sv.size() == 1) {
3170 return sv[0].get<std::shared_ptr<Ope>>();
3171 } else {
3172 std::vector<std::shared_ptr<Ope>> opes;
3173 for (const auto& x: sv) {
3174 opes.emplace_back(x.get<std::shared_ptr<Ope>>());
3175 }
3176 const std::shared_ptr<Ope> ope = std::make_shared<Sequence>(opes);
3177 return ope;
3178 }
3179 };
3180
3181 g["Prefix"] = [&](const SemanticValues& sv) {
3182 std::shared_ptr<Ope> ope;
3183 if (sv.size() == 1) {
3184 ope = sv[0].get<std::shared_ptr<Ope>>();
3185 } else {
3186 assert(sv.size() == 2);
3187 auto tok = sv[0].get<char>();
3188 ope = sv[1].get<std::shared_ptr<Ope>>();
3189 if (tok == '&') {
3190 ope = apd(ope);
3191 } else { // '!'
3192 ope = npd(ope);
3193 }
3194 }
3195 return ope;
3196 };
3197
3198 g["Suffix"] = [&](const SemanticValues& sv) {
3199 auto ope = sv[0].get<std::shared_ptr<Ope>>();
3200 if (sv.size() == 1) {
3201 return ope;
3202 } else {
3203 assert(sv.size() == 2);
3204 auto tok = sv[1].get<char>();
3205 if (tok == '?') {
3206 return opt(ope);
3207 } else if (tok == '*') {
3208 return zom(ope);
3209 } else { // '+'
3210 return oom(ope);
3211 }
3212 }
3213 };
3214
3215 g["Primary"] = [&](const SemanticValues& sv, any& dt) -> std::shared_ptr<Ope> {
3216 Data& data = *dt.get<Data*>();
3217
3218 switch (sv.choice()) {
3219 case 0: // Macro Reference
3220 case 1: { // Reference
3221 auto is_macro = sv.choice() == 0;
3222 auto ignore = sv[0].get<bool>();
3223 const auto& ident = sv[1].get<std::string>();
3224
3225 std::vector<std::shared_ptr<Ope>> args;
3226 if (is_macro) {
3227 args = sv[2].get<std::vector<std::shared_ptr<Ope>>>();
3228 }
3229
3230 if (ignore) {
3231 return ign(ref(*data.grammar, ident, sv.c_str(), is_macro, args));
3232 } else {
3233 return ref(*data.grammar, ident, sv.c_str(), is_macro, args);
3234 }
3235 }
3236 case 2: { // (Expression)
3237 return sv[0].get<std::shared_ptr<Ope>>();
3238 }
3239 case 3: { // TokenBoundary
3240 return tok(sv[0].get<std::shared_ptr<Ope>>());
3241 }
3242 case 4: { // CaptureScope
3243 return csc(sv[0].get<std::shared_ptr<Ope>>());
3244 }
3245 case 5: { // Capture
3246 const auto& name = sv[0].get<std::string>();
3247 auto ope = sv[1].get<std::shared_ptr<Ope>>();
3248 return cap(ope, [name](const char* a_s, size_t a_n, Context& c) {
3249 c.capture_scope_stack.back()[name] = std::string(a_s, a_n);
3250 });
3251 }
3252 default: {
3253 return sv[0].get<std::shared_ptr<Ope>>();
3254 }
3255 }
3256 };
3257
3258 g["IdentCont"] = [](const SemanticValues& sv) {
3259 return std::string(sv.c_str(), sv.length());
3260 };
3261 g["IdentStart"] = [](const SemanticValues& /*sv*/) {
3262 return std::string();
3263 };
3264 g["IdentRest"] = [](const SemanticValues& /*sv*/) {
3265 return std::string();
3266 };
3267
3268 g["LiteralI"] = [](const SemanticValues& sv) {
3269 const auto& tok = sv.tokens.front();
3270 return liti(resolve_escape_sequence(tok.first, tok.second));
3271 };
3272 g["Literal"] = [](const SemanticValues& sv) {
3273 const auto& tok = sv.tokens.front();
3274 return lit(resolve_escape_sequence(tok.first, tok.second));
3275 };
3276
3277 g["Class"] = [](const SemanticValues& sv) {
3278 auto ranges = sv.transform<std::pair<char32_t, char32_t>>();
3279 return cls(ranges);
3280 };
3281 g["Range"] = [](const SemanticValues& sv) {
3282 switch (sv.choice()) {
3283 case 0: {
3284 auto s1 = sv[0].get<std::string>();
3285 auto s2 = sv[1].get<std::string>();
3286 auto cp1 = decode_codepoint(s1.c_str(), s1.length());
3287 auto cp2 = decode_codepoint(s2.c_str(), s2.length());
3288 return std::make_pair(cp1, cp2);
3289 }
3290 case 1: {
3291 auto s = sv[0].get<std::string>();
3292 auto cp = decode_codepoint(s.c_str(), s.length());
3293 return std::make_pair(cp, cp);
3294 }
3295 }
3296 return std::make_pair<char32_t, char32_t>(0, 0);
3297 };
3298 g["Char"] = [](const SemanticValues& sv) {
3299 return resolve_escape_sequence(sv.c_str(), sv.length());
3300 };
3301
3302 g["AND"] = [](const SemanticValues& sv) { return *sv.c_str(); };
3303 g["NOT"] = [](const SemanticValues& sv) { return *sv.c_str(); };
3304 g["QUESTION"] = [](const SemanticValues& sv) { return *sv.c_str(); };
3305 g["STAR"] = [](const SemanticValues& sv) { return *sv.c_str(); };
3306 g["PLUS"] = [](const SemanticValues& sv) { return *sv.c_str(); };
3307
3308 g["DOT"] = [](const SemanticValues& /*sv*/) { return dot(); };
3309
3310 g["BeginCap"] = [](const SemanticValues& sv) { return sv.token(); };
3311
3312 g["BackRef"] = [&](const SemanticValues& sv) {
3313 return bkr(sv.token());
3314 };
3315
3316 g["Ignore"] = [](const SemanticValues& sv) { return sv.size() > 0; };
3317
3318 g["Parameters"] = [](const SemanticValues& sv) {
3319 return sv.transform<std::string>();
3320 };
3321
3322 g["Arguments"] = [](const SemanticValues& sv) {
3323 return sv.transform<std::shared_ptr<Ope>>();
3324 };
3325 }
3326
3327 std::shared_ptr<Grammar> perform_core(
3328 const char* s,
3329 size_t n,
3330 const Rules& rules,
3331 std::string& start,
3332 Log log)
3333 {
3334 Data data;
3335 any dt = &data;
3336 auto r = g["Grammar"].parse(s, n, dt);
3337
3338 if (!r.ret) {
3339 if (log) {
3340 if (r.message_pos) {
3341 auto line = line_info(s, r.message_pos);
3342 log(line.first, line.second, r.message);
3343 } else {
3344 auto line = line_info(s, r.error_pos);
3345 log(line.first, line.second, "syntax error");
3346 }
3347 }
3348 return nullptr;
3349 }
3350
3351 auto& grammar = *data.grammar;
3352
3353 // User provided rules
3354 for (const auto& x: rules) {
3355 auto name = x.first;
3356 bool ignore = false;
3357 if (!name.empty() && name[0] == '~') {
3358 ignore = true;
3359 name.erase(0, 1);
3360 }
3361 if (!name.empty()) {
3362 auto& rule = grammar[name];
3363 rule <= x.second;
3364 rule.name = name;
3365 rule.ignoreSemanticValue = ignore;
3366 }
3367 }
3368
3369 // Check duplicated definitions
3370 bool ret = data.duplicates.empty();
3371
3372 for (const auto& x: data.duplicates) {
3373 if (log) {
3374 const auto& name = x.first;
3375 auto ptr = x.second;
3376 auto line = line_info(s, ptr);
3377 log(line.first, line.second, "'" + name + "' is already defined.");
3378 }
3379 }
3380
3381 // Check missing definitions
3382 for (auto& x: grammar) {
3383 auto& rule = x.second;
3384
3385 ReferenceChecker vis(*data.grammar, rule.params);
3386 rule.accept(vis);
3387 for (const auto& y: vis.error_s) {
3388 const auto& name = y.first;
3389 const auto ptr = y.second;
3390 if (log) {
3391 auto line = line_info(s, ptr);
3392 log(line.first, line.second, vis.error_message[name]);
3393 }
3394 ret = false;
3395 }
3396 }
3397
3398 if (!ret) {
3399 return nullptr;
3400 }
3401
3402 // Link references
3403 for (auto& x: grammar) {
3404 auto& rule = x.second;
3405 LinkReferences vis(*data.grammar, rule.params);
3406 rule.accept(vis);
3407 }
3408
3409 // Check left recursion
3410 ret = true;
3411
3412 for (auto& x: grammar) {
3413 const auto& name = x.first;
3414 auto& rule = x.second;
3415
3416 DetectLeftRecursion vis(name);
3417 rule.accept(vis);
3418 if (vis.error_s) {
3419 if (log) {
3420 auto line = line_info(s, vis.error_s);
3421 log(line.first, line.second, "'" + name + "' is left recursive.");
3422 }
3423 ret = false;;
3424 }
3425 }
3426
3427 if (!ret) {
3428 return nullptr;
3429 }
3430
3431 // Set root definition
3432 start = data.start;
3433
3434 // Automatic whitespace skipping
3435 if (grammar.count(WHITESPACE_DEFINITION_NAME)) {
3436 for (auto& x: grammar) {
3437 auto& rule = x.second;
3438 auto ope = rule.get_core_operator();
3439 if (IsLiteralToken::check(*ope)) {
3440 rule <= tok(ope);
3441 }
3442 }
3443
3444 auto& rule = (*data.grammar)[start];
3445 rule.whitespaceOpe = wsp((*data.grammar)[WHITESPACE_DEFINITION_NAME].get_core_operator());
3446 }
3447
3448 // Word expression
3449 if (grammar.count(WORD_DEFINITION_NAME)) {
3450 auto& rule = (*data.grammar)[start];
3451 rule.wordOpe = (*data.grammar)[WORD_DEFINITION_NAME].get_core_operator();
3452 }
3453
3454 return data.grammar;
3455 }
3456
3457 Grammar g;
3458};
3459
3460/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3461 * AST
3462 *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3463
3464template <typename Annotation>
3465struct AstBase : public Annotation
3466{
3467 AstBase(const char* a_path, size_t a_line, size_t a_column,
3468 const char* a_name, size_t a_position, size_t a_length,
3469 size_t a_choice_count, size_t a_choice,
3470 const std::vector<std::shared_ptr<AstBase>>& a_nodes)
3471 : path(a_path ? a_path : "")
3472 , line(a_line)
3473 , column(a_column)
3474 , name(a_name)
3475 , position(a_position)
3476 , length(a_length)
3477 , choice_count(a_choice_count)
3478 , choice(a_choice)
3479 , original_name(a_name)
3480 , original_choice_count(a_choice_count)
3481 , original_choice(a_choice)
3482#ifndef PEGLIB_NO_CONSTEXPR_SUPPORT
3483 , tag(str2tag(a_name))
3484 , original_tag(tag)
3485#endif
3486 , is_token(false)
3487 , nodes(a_nodes)
3488 {}
3489
3490 AstBase(const char* a_path, size_t a_line, size_t a_column,
3491 const char* a_name, size_t a_position, size_t a_length,
3492 size_t a_choice_count, size_t a_choice,
3493 const std::string& a_token)
3494 : path(a_path ? a_path : "")
3495 , line(a_line)
3496 , column(a_column)
3497 , name(a_name)
3498 , position(a_position)
3499 , length(a_length)
3500 , choice_count(a_choice_count)
3501 , choice(a_choice)
3502 , original_name(a_name)
3503 , original_choice_count(a_choice_count)
3504 , original_choice(a_choice)
3505#ifndef PEGLIB_NO_CONSTEXPR_SUPPORT
3506 , tag(str2tag(a_name))
3507 , original_tag(tag)
3508#endif
3509 , is_token(true)
3510 , token(a_token)
3511 {}
3512
3513 AstBase(const AstBase& ast, const char* a_original_name,
3514 size_t a_position, size_t a_length,
3515 size_t a_original_choice_count, size_t a_original_choise)
3516 : path(ast.path)
3517 , line(ast.line)
3518 , column(ast.column)
3519 , name(ast.name)
3520 , position(a_position)
3521 , length(a_length)
3522 , choice_count(ast.choice_count)
3523 , choice(ast.choice)
3524 , original_name(a_original_name)
3525 , original_choice_count(a_original_choice_count)
3526 , original_choice(a_original_choise)
3527#ifndef PEGLIB_NO_CONSTEXPR_SUPPORT
3528 , tag(ast.tag)
3529 , original_tag(str2tag(a_original_name))
3530#endif
3531 , is_token(ast.is_token)
3532 , token(ast.token)
3533 , nodes(ast.nodes)
3534 , parent(ast.parent)
3535 {}
3536
3537 const std::string path;
3538 const size_t line;
3539 const size_t column;
3540
3541 const std::string name;
3542 size_t position;
3543 size_t length;
3544 const size_t choice_count;
3545 const size_t choice;
3546 const std::string original_name;
3547 const size_t original_choice_count;
3548 const size_t original_choice;
3549#ifndef PEGLIB_NO_CONSTEXPR_SUPPORT
3550 const unsigned int tag;
3551 const unsigned int original_tag;
3552#endif
3553
3554 const bool is_token;
3555 const std::string token;
3556
3557 std::vector<std::shared_ptr<AstBase<Annotation>>> nodes;
3558 std::weak_ptr<AstBase<Annotation>> parent;
3559};
3560
3561template <typename T>
3562void ast_to_s_core(
3563 const std::shared_ptr<T>& ptr,
3564 std::string& s,
3565 int level,
3566 std::function<std::string (const T& ast, int level)> fn) {
3567
3568 const auto& ast = *ptr;
3569 for (auto i = 0; i < level; i++) {
3570 s += " ";
3571 }
3572 auto name = ast.original_name;
3573 if (ast.original_choice_count > 0) {
3574 name += "/" + std::to_string(ast.original_choice);
3575 }
3576 if (ast.name != ast.original_name) {
3577 name += "[" + ast.name + "]";
3578 }
3579 if (ast.is_token) {
3580 s += "- " + name + " (" + ast.token + ")\n";
3581 } else {
3582 s += "+ " + name + "\n";
3583 }
3584 if (fn) {
3585 s += fn(ast, level + 1);
3586 }
3587 for (auto node : ast.nodes) {
3588 ast_to_s_core(node, s, level + 1, fn);
3589 }
3590}
3591
3592template <typename T>
3593std::string ast_to_s(
3594 const std::shared_ptr<T>& ptr,
3595 std::function<std::string (const T& ast, int level)> fn = nullptr) {
3596
3597 std::string s;
3598 ast_to_s_core(ptr, s, 0, fn);
3599 return s;
3600}
3601
3602struct AstOptimizer
3603{
3604 AstOptimizer(bool optimize_nodes, const std::vector<std::string>& filters = {})
3605 : optimize_nodes_(optimize_nodes)
3606 , filters_(filters) {}
3607
3608 template <typename T>
3609 std::shared_ptr<T> optimize(std::shared_ptr<T> original, std::shared_ptr<T> parent = nullptr) {
3610
3611 auto found = std::find(filters_.begin(), filters_.end(), original->name) != filters_.end();
3612 bool opt = optimize_nodes_ ? !found : found;
3613
3614 if (opt && original->nodes.size() == 1) {
3615 auto child = optimize(original->nodes[0], parent);
3616 return std::make_shared<T>(
3617 *child, original->name.c_str(), original->choice_count,
3618 original->position, original->length, original->choice);
3619 }
3620
3621 auto ast = std::make_shared<T>(*original);
3622 ast->parent = parent;
3623 ast->nodes.clear();
3624 for (auto node : original->nodes) {
3625 auto child = optimize(node, ast);
3626 ast->nodes.push_back(child);
3627 }
3628 return ast;
3629 }
3630
3631private:
3632 const bool optimize_nodes_;
3633 const std::vector<std::string> filters_;
3634};
3635
3636struct EmptyType {};
3637typedef AstBase<EmptyType> Ast;
3638
3639/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3640 * parser
3641 *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3642
3643class parser
3644{
3645public:
3646 parser() = default;
3647
3648 parser(const char* s, size_t n, const Rules& rules) {
3649 load_grammar(s, n, rules);
3650 }
3651
3652 parser(const char* s, const Rules& rules)
3653 : parser(s, strlen(s), rules) {}
3654
3655 parser(const char* s, size_t n)
3656 : parser(s, n, Rules()) {}
3657
3658 parser(const char* s)
3659 : parser(s, strlen(s), Rules()) {}
3660
3661 operator bool() {
3662 return grammar_ != nullptr;
3663 }
3664
3665 bool load_grammar(const char* s, size_t n, const Rules& rules) {
3666 grammar_ = ParserGenerator::parse(s, n, rules, start_, log);
3667 return grammar_ != nullptr;
3668 }
3669
3670 bool load_grammar(const char* s, size_t n) {
3671 return load_grammar(s, n, Rules());
3672 }
3673
3674 bool load_grammar(const char* s, const Rules& rules) {
3675 auto n = strlen(s);
3676 return load_grammar(s, n, rules);
3677 }
3678
3679 bool load_grammar(const char* s) {
3680 auto n = strlen(s);
3681 return load_grammar(s, n);
3682 }
3683
3684 bool parse_n(const char* s, size_t n, const char* path = nullptr) const {
3685 if (grammar_ != nullptr) {
3686 const auto& rule = (*grammar_)[start_];
3687 auto r = rule.parse(s, n, path);
3688 output_log(s, n, r);
3689 return r.ret && r.len == n;
3690 }
3691 return false;
3692 }
3693
3694 bool parse(const char* s, const char* path = nullptr) const {
3695 auto n = strlen(s);
3696 return parse_n(s, n, path);
3697 }
3698
3699 bool parse_n(const char* s, size_t n, any& dt, const char* path = nullptr) const {
3700 if (grammar_ != nullptr) {
3701 const auto& rule = (*grammar_)[start_];
3702 auto r = rule.parse(s, n, dt, path);
3703 output_log(s, n, r);
3704 return r.ret && r.len == n;
3705 }
3706 return false;
3707 }
3708
3709 bool parse(const char* s, any& dt, const char* path = nullptr) const {
3710 auto n = strlen(s);
3711 return parse_n(s, n, dt, path);
3712 }
3713
3714 template <typename T>
3715 bool parse_n(const char* s, size_t n, T& val, const char* path = nullptr) const {
3716 if (grammar_ != nullptr) {
3717 const auto& rule = (*grammar_)[start_];
3718 auto r = rule.parse_and_get_value(s, n, val, path);
3719 output_log(s, n, r);
3720 return r.ret && r.len == n;
3721 }
3722 return false;
3723 }
3724
3725 template <typename T>
3726 bool parse(const char* s, T& val, const char* path = nullptr) const {
3727 auto n = strlen(s);
3728 return parse_n(s, n, val, path);
3729 }
3730
3731 template <typename T>
3732 bool parse_n(const char* s, size_t n, any& dt, T& val, const char* path = nullptr) const {
3733 if (grammar_ != nullptr) {
3734 const auto& rule = (*grammar_)[start_];
3735 auto r = rule.parse_and_get_value(s, n, dt, val, path);
3736 output_log(s, n, r);
3737 return r.ret && r.len == n;
3738 }
3739 return false;
3740 }
3741
3742 template <typename T>
3743 bool parse(const char* s, any& dt, T& val, const char* /*path*/ = nullptr) const {
3744 auto n = strlen(s);
3745 return parse_n(s, n, dt, val);
3746 }
3747
3748 bool search(const char* s, size_t n, size_t& mpos, size_t& mlen) const {
3749 const auto& rule = (*grammar_)[start_];
3750 if (grammar_ != nullptr) {
3751 size_t pos = 0;
3752 while (pos < n) {
3753 size_t len = n - pos;
3754 auto r = rule.parse(s + pos, len);
3755 if (r.ret) {
3756 mpos = pos;
3757 mlen = len;
3758 return true;
3759 }
3760 pos++;
3761 }
3762 }
3763 mpos = 0;
3764 mlen = 0;
3765 return false;
3766 }
3767
3768 bool search(const char* s, size_t& mpos, size_t& mlen) const {
3769 auto n = strlen(s);
3770 return search(s, n, mpos, mlen);
3771 }
3772
3773 Definition& operator[](const char* s) {
3774 return (*grammar_)[s];
3775 }
3776
3777 const Definition& operator[](const char* s) const {
3778 return (*grammar_)[s];
3779 }
3780
3781 std::vector<std::string> get_rule_names(){
3782 std::vector<std::string> rules;
3783 rules.reserve(grammar_->size());
3784 for (auto const& r : *grammar_) {
3785 rules.emplace_back(r.first);
3786 }
3787 return rules;
3788 }
3789
3790 void enable_packrat_parsing() {
3791 if (grammar_ != nullptr) {
3792 auto& rule = (*grammar_)[start_];
3793 rule.enablePackratParsing = true;
3794 }
3795 }
3796
3797 template <typename T = Ast>
3798 parser& enable_ast() {
3799 for (auto& x: *grammar_) {
3800 const auto& name = x.first;
3801 auto& rule = x.second;
3802
3803 if (!rule.action) {
3804 rule.action = [&](const SemanticValues& sv) {
3805 auto line = line_info(sv.ss, sv.c_str());
3806
3807 if (rule.is_token()) {
3808 return std::make_shared<T>(
3809 sv.path, line.first, line.second,
3810 name.c_str(), std::distance(sv.ss, sv.c_str()), sv.length(), sv.choice_count(), sv.choice(),
3811 sv.token());
3812 }
3813
3814 auto ast = std::make_shared<T>(
3815 sv.path, line.first, line.second,
3816 name.c_str(), std::distance(sv.ss, sv.c_str()), sv.length(), sv.choice_count(), sv.choice(),
3817 sv.transform<std::shared_ptr<T>>());
3818
3819 for (auto node: ast->nodes) {
3820 node->parent = ast;
3821 }
3822 return ast;
3823 };
3824 }
3825 }
3826 return *this;
3827 }
3828
3829 void enable_trace(Tracer tracer) {
3830 if (grammar_ != nullptr) {
3831 auto& rule = (*grammar_)[start_];
3832 rule.tracer = tracer;
3833 }
3834 }
3835
3836 Log log;
3837
3838private:
3839 void output_log(const char* s, size_t n, const Definition::Result& r) const {
3840 if (log) {
3841 if (!r.ret) {
3842 if (r.message_pos) {
3843 auto line = line_info(s, r.message_pos);
3844 log(line.first, line.second, r.message);
3845 } else {
3846 auto line = line_info(s, r.error_pos);
3847 log(line.first, line.second, "syntax error");
3848 }
3849 } else if (r.len != n) {
3850 auto line = line_info(s, s + r.len);
3851 log(line.first, line.second, "syntax error");
3852 }
3853 }
3854 }
3855
3856 std::shared_ptr<Grammar> grammar_;
3857 std::string start_;
3858};
3859
3860} // namespace peg
3861
3862#endif
3863
3864// vim: et ts=4 sw=4 cin cino={1s ff=unix
3865#ifndef ARGH
3866#define ARGH
3867//#pragma once
3868
3869#include <algorithm>
3870#include <sstream>
3871#include <string>
3872#include <vector>
3873#include <set>
3874#include <map>
3875#include <cassert>
3876
3877namespace argh
3878{
3879 // Terminology:
3880 // A command line is composed of 2 types of args:
3881 // 1. Positional args, i.e. free standing values
3882 // 2. Options: args beginning with '-'. We identify two kinds:
3883 // 2.1: Flags: boolean options => (exist ? true : false)
3884 // 2.2: Parameters: a name followed by a non-option value
3885
3886#if !defined(__GNUC__) || (__GNUC__ >= 5)
3887 using string_stream = std::istringstream;
3888#else
3889 // Until GCC 5, istringstream did not have a move constructor.
3890 // stringstream_proxy is used instead, as a workaround.
3891 class stringstream_proxy
3892 {
3893 public:
3894 stringstream_proxy() = default;
3895
3896 // Construct with a value.
3897 stringstream_proxy(std::string const& value) :
3898 stream_(value)
3899 {}
3900
3901 // Copy constructor.
3902 stringstream_proxy(const stringstream_proxy& other) :
3903 stream_(other.stream_.str())
3904 {
3905 stream_.setstate(other.stream_.rdstate());
3906 }
3907
3908 void setstate(std::ios_base::iostate state) { stream_.setstate(state); }
3909
3910 // Stream out the value of the parameter.
3911 // If the conversion was not possible, the stream will enter the fail state,
3912 // and operator bool will return false.
3913 template<typename T>
3914 stringstream_proxy& operator >> (T& thing)
3915 {
3916 stream_ >> thing;
3917 return *this;
3918 }
3919
3920
3921 // Get the string value.
3922 std::string str() const { return stream_.str(); }
3923
3924 std::stringbuf* rdbuf() const { return stream_.rdbuf(); }
3925
3926 // Check the state of the stream.
3927 // False when the most recent stream operation failed
3928 operator bool() const { return !!stream_; }
3929
3930 ~stringstream_proxy() = default;
3931 private:
3932 std::istringstream stream_;
3933 };
3934 using string_stream = stringstream_proxy;
3935#endif
3936
3937 class parser
3938 {
3939 public:
3940 enum Mode { PREFER_FLAG_FOR_UNREG_OPTION = 1 << 0,
3941 PREFER_PARAM_FOR_UNREG_OPTION = 1 << 1,
3942 NO_SPLIT_ON_EQUALSIGN = 1 << 2,
3943 SINGLE_DASH_IS_MULTIFLAG = 1 << 3,
3944 };
3945
3946 parser() = default;
3947
3948 parser(std::initializer_list<char const* const> pre_reg_names)
3949 { add_params(pre_reg_names); }
3950
3951 parser(const char* const argv[], int mode = PREFER_FLAG_FOR_UNREG_OPTION)
3952 { parse(argv, mode); }
3953
3954 parser(int argc, const char* const argv[], int mode = PREFER_FLAG_FOR_UNREG_OPTION)
3955 { parse(argc, argv, mode); }
3956
3957 void add_param(std::string const& name);
3958 void add_params(std::initializer_list<char const* const> init_list);
3959
3960 void parse(const char* const argv[], int mode = PREFER_FLAG_FOR_UNREG_OPTION);
3961 void parse(int argc, const char* const argv[], int mode = PREFER_FLAG_FOR_UNREG_OPTION);
3962
3963 std::multiset<std::string> const& flags() const { return flags_; }
3964 std::map<std::string, std::string> const& params() const { return params_; }
3965 std::vector<std::string> const& pos_args() const { return pos_args_; }
3966
3967 // begin() and end() for using range-for over positional args.
3968 std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator begin() const { return pos_args_.cbegin(); }
3969 std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator end() const { return pos_args_.cend(); }
3970 size_t size() const { return pos_args_.size(); }
3971
3973 // Accessors
3974
3975 // flag (boolean) accessors: return true if the flag appeared, otherwise false.
3976 bool operator[](std::string const& name) const;
3977
3978 // multiple flag (boolean) accessors: return true if at least one of the flag appeared, otherwise false.
3979 bool operator[](std::initializer_list<char const* const> init_list) const;
3980
3981 // returns positional arg string by order. Like argv[] but without the options
3982 std::string const& operator[](size_t ind) const;
3983
3984 // returns a std::istream that can be used to convert a positional arg to a typed value.
3985 string_stream operator()(size_t ind) const;
3986
3987 // same as above, but with a default value in case the arg is missing (index out of range).
3988 template<typename T>
3989 string_stream operator()(size_t ind, T&& def_val) const;
3990
3991 // parameter accessors, give a name get an std::istream that can be used to convert to a typed value.
3992 // call .str() on result to get as string
3993 string_stream operator()(std::string const& name) const;
3994
3995 // accessor for a parameter with multiple names, give a list of names, get an std::istream that can be used to convert to a typed value.
3996 // call .str() on result to get as string
3997 // returns the first value in the list to be found.
3998 string_stream operator()(std::initializer_list<char const* const> init_list) const;
3999
4000 // same as above, but with a default value in case the param was missing.
4001 // Non-string def_val types must have an operator<<() (output stream operator)
4002 // If T only has an input stream operator, pass the string version of the type as in "3" instead of 3.
4003 template<typename T>
4004 string_stream operator()(std::string const& name, T&& def_val) const;
4005
4006 // same as above but for a list of names. returns the first value to be found.
4007 template<typename T>
4008 string_stream operator()(std::initializer_list<char const* const> init_list, T&& def_val) const;
4009
4010 private:
4011 string_stream bad_stream() const;
4012 std::string trim_leading_dashes(std::string const& name) const;
4013 bool is_number(std::string const& arg) const;
4014 bool is_option(std::string const& arg) const;
4015 bool got_flag(std::string const& name) const;
4016 bool is_param(std::string const& name) const;
4017
4018 private:
4019 std::vector<std::string> args_;
4020 std::map<std::string, std::string> params_;
4021 std::vector<std::string> pos_args_;
4022 std::multiset<std::string> flags_;
4023 std::set<std::string> registeredParams_;
4024 std::string empty_;
4025 };
4026
4027
4029
4030 inline void parser::parse(const char * const argv[], int mode)
4031 {
4032 int argc = 0;
4033 for (auto argvp = argv; *argvp; ++argc, ++argvp);
4034 parse(argc, argv, mode);
4035 }
4036
4038
4039 inline void parser::parse(int argc, const char* const argv[], int mode /*= PREFER_FLAG_FOR_UNREG_OPTION*/)
4040 {
4041 // convert to strings
4042 args_.resize(argc);
4043 std::transform(argv, argv + argc, args_.begin(), [](const char* const arg) { return arg; });
4044
4045 // parse line
4046 for (auto i = 0u; i < args_.size(); ++i)
4047 {
4048 if (!is_option(args_[i]))
4049 {
4050 pos_args_.emplace_back(args_[i]);
4051 continue;
4052 }
4053
4054 auto name = trim_leading_dashes(args_[i]);
4055
4056 if (!(mode & NO_SPLIT_ON_EQUALSIGN))
4057 {
4058 auto equalPos = name.find('=');
4059 if (equalPos != std::string::npos)
4060 {
4061 params_.insert({ name.substr(0, equalPos), name.substr(equalPos + 1) });
4062 continue;
4063 }
4064 }
4065
4066 // if the option is unregistered and should be a multi-flag
4067 if (1 == (args_[i].size() - name.size()) && // single dash
4068 argh::parser::SINGLE_DASH_IS_MULTIFLAG & mode && // multi-flag mode
4069 !is_param(name)) // unregistered
4070 {
4071 std::string keep_param;
4072
4073 if (!name.empty() && is_param(std::string(1ul, name.back()))) // last char is param
4074 {
4075 keep_param += name.back();
4076 name.resize(name.size() - 1);
4077 }
4078
4079 for (auto const& c : name)
4080 {
4081 flags_.emplace(std::string{ c });
4082 }
4083
4084 if (!keep_param.empty())
4085 {
4086 name = keep_param;
4087 }
4088 else
4089 {
4090 continue; // do not consider other options for this arg
4091 }
4092 }
4093
4094 // any potential option will get as its value the next arg, unless that arg is an option too
4095 // in that case it will be determined a flag.
4096 if (i == args_.size() - 1 || is_option(args_[i + 1]))
4097 {
4098 flags_.emplace(name);
4099 continue;
4100 }
4101
4102 // if 'name' is a pre-registered option, then the next arg cannot be a free parameter to it is skipped
4103 // otherwise we have 2 modes:
4104 // PREFER_FLAG_FOR_UNREG_OPTION: a non-registered 'name' is determined a flag.
4105 // The following value (the next arg) will be a free parameter.
4106 //
4107 // PREFER_PARAM_FOR_UNREG_OPTION: a non-registered 'name' is determined a parameter, the next arg
4108 // will be the value of that option.
4109
4110 assert(!(mode & argh::parser::PREFER_FLAG_FOR_UNREG_OPTION)
4111 || !(mode & argh::parser::PREFER_PARAM_FOR_UNREG_OPTION));
4112
4113 bool preferParam = mode & argh::parser::PREFER_PARAM_FOR_UNREG_OPTION;
4114
4115 if (is_param(name) || preferParam)
4116 {
4117 params_.insert({ name, args_[i + 1] });
4118 ++i; // skip next value, it is not a free parameter
4119 continue;
4120 }
4121 else
4122 {
4123 flags_.emplace(name);
4124 }
4125 };
4126 }
4127
4129
4130 inline string_stream parser::bad_stream() const
4131 {
4132 string_stream bad;
4133 bad.setstate(std::ios_base::failbit);
4134 return bad;
4135 }
4136
4138
4139 inline bool parser::is_number(std::string const& arg) const
4140 {
4141 // inefficient but simple way to determine if a string is a number (which can start with a '-')
4142 std::istringstream istr(arg);
4143 double number;
4144 istr >> number;
4145 return !(istr.fail() || istr.bad());
4146 }
4147
4149
4150 inline bool parser::is_option(std::string const& arg) const
4151 {
4152 assert(0 != arg.size());
4153 if (is_number(arg))
4154 return false;
4155 return '-' == arg[0];
4156 }
4157
4159
4160 inline std::string parser::trim_leading_dashes(std::string const& name) const
4161 {
4162 auto pos = name.find_first_not_of('-');
4163 return std::string::npos != pos ? name.substr(pos) : name;
4164 }
4165
4167
4168 inline bool argh::parser::got_flag(std::string const& name) const
4169 {
4170 return flags_.end() != flags_.find(trim_leading_dashes(name));
4171 }
4172
4174
4175 inline bool argh::parser::is_param(std::string const& name) const
4176 {
4177 return registeredParams_.count(name);
4178 }
4179
4181
4182 inline bool parser::operator[](std::string const& name) const
4183 {
4184 return got_flag(name);
4185 }
4186
4188
4189 inline bool parser::operator[](std::initializer_list<char const* const> init_list) const
4190 {
4191 return std::any_of(init_list.begin(), init_list.end(), [&](char const* const name) { return got_flag(name); });
4192 }
4193
4195
4196 inline std::string const& parser::operator[](size_t ind) const
4197 {
4198 if (ind < pos_args_.size())
4199 return pos_args_[ind];
4200 return empty_;
4201 }
4202
4204
4205 inline string_stream parser::operator()(std::string const& name) const
4206 {
4207 auto optIt = params_.find(trim_leading_dashes(name));
4208 if (params_.end() != optIt)
4209 return string_stream(optIt->second);
4210 return bad_stream();
4211 }
4212
4214
4215 inline string_stream parser::operator()(std::initializer_list<char const* const> init_list) const
4216 {
4217 for (auto& name : init_list)
4218 {
4219 auto optIt = params_.find(trim_leading_dashes(name));
4220 if (params_.end() != optIt)
4221 return string_stream(optIt->second);
4222 }
4223 return bad_stream();
4224 }
4225
4227
4228 template<typename T>
4229 string_stream parser::operator()(std::string const& name, T&& def_val) const
4230 {
4231 auto optIt = params_.find(trim_leading_dashes(name));
4232 if (params_.end() != optIt)
4233 return string_stream(optIt->second);
4234
4235 std::ostringstream ostr;
4236 ostr << def_val;
4237 return string_stream(ostr.str()); // use default
4238 }
4239
4241
4242 // same as above but for a list of names. returns the first value to be found.
4243 template<typename T>
4244 string_stream parser::operator()(std::initializer_list<char const* const> init_list, T&& def_val) const
4245 {
4246 for (auto& name : init_list)
4247 {
4248 auto optIt = params_.find(trim_leading_dashes(name));
4249 if (params_.end() != optIt)
4250 return string_stream(optIt->second);
4251 }
4252 std::ostringstream ostr;
4253 ostr << def_val;
4254 return string_stream(ostr.str()); // use default
4255 }
4256
4258
4259 inline string_stream parser::operator()(size_t ind) const
4260 {
4261 if (pos_args_.size() <= ind)
4262 return bad_stream();
4263
4264 return string_stream(pos_args_[ind]);
4265 }
4266
4268
4269 template<typename T>
4270 string_stream parser::operator()(size_t ind, T&& def_val) const
4271 {
4272 if (pos_args_.size() <= ind)
4273 {
4274 std::ostringstream ostr;
4275 ostr << def_val;
4276 return string_stream(ostr.str());
4277 }
4278
4279 return string_stream(pos_args_[ind]);
4280 }
4281
4283
4284 inline void parser::add_param(std::string const& name)
4285 {
4286 registeredParams_.insert(trim_leading_dashes(name));
4287 }
4288
4290
4291 inline void parser::add_params(std::initializer_list<char const* const> init_list)
4292 {
4293 for (auto& name : init_list)
4294 registeredParams_.insert(trim_leading_dashes(name));
4295 }
4296}
4297
4298
4299#endif

4306#define VISITABLE_TYPE_TRAIT
4307#include <cstdint>
4308#include <string>
4309#include <utility>
4310
4311template<bool b>
4312struct visitorSelector {
4313 template<typename T, class Visitor>
4314 static void impl(uint32_t fieldIdentifier, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value, Visitor &visitor) {
4315 visitor.visit(fieldIdentifier, std::move(typeName), std::move(name), value);
4316 }
4317};
4318
4319template<>
4320struct visitorSelector<true> {
4321 template<typename T, class Visitor>
4322 static void impl(uint32_t fieldIdentifier, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value, Visitor &visitor) {
4323 visitor.visit(fieldIdentifier, std::move(typeName), std::move(name), value);
4324 }
4325};
4326
4327template<typename T>
4328struct isVisitable {
4329 static const bool value = false;
4330};
4331
4332template<typename T, class Visitor>
4333void doVisit(uint32_t fieldIdentifier, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value, Visitor &visitor) {
4334 visitorSelector<isVisitable<T>::value >::impl(fieldIdentifier, std::move(typeName), std::move(name), value, visitor);
4335}
4336#endif
4337
4338#ifndef TRIPLET_FORWARD_VISITABLE_TYPE_TRAIT
4339#define TRIPLET_FORWARD_VISITABLE_TYPE_TRAIT
4340#include <cstdint>
4341#include <string>
4342#include <utility>
4343
4344template<bool b>
4345struct tripletForwardVisitorSelector {
4346 template<typename T, class PreVisitor, class Visitor, class PostVisitor>
4347 static void impl(uint32_t fieldIdentifier, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value, PreVisitor &&preVisit, Visitor &&visit, PostVisitor &&postVisit) {
4348 (void)preVisit;
4349 (void)postVisit;
4350 std::forward<Visitor>(visit)(fieldIdentifier, std::move(typeName), std::move(name), value);
4351 }
4352};
4353
4354template<>
4355struct tripletForwardVisitorSelector<true> {
4356 template<typename T, class PreVisitor, class Visitor, class PostVisitor>
4357 static void impl(uint32_t fieldIdentifier, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value, PreVisitor &&preVisit, Visitor &&visit, PostVisitor &&postVisit) {
4358 (void)fieldIdentifier;
4359 (void)typeName;
4360 (void)name;
4361 // Apply preVisit, visit, and postVisit on value.
4362 value.accept(preVisit, visit, postVisit);
4363 }
4364};
4365
4366template<typename T>
4367struct isTripletForwardVisitable {
4368 static const bool value = false;
4369};
4370
4371template< typename T, class PreVisitor, class Visitor, class PostVisitor>
4372void doTripletForwardVisit(uint32_t fieldIdentifier, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value, PreVisitor &&preVisit, Visitor &&visit, PostVisitor &&postVisit) {
4373 tripletForwardVisitorSelector<isTripletForwardVisitable<T>::value >::impl(fieldIdentifier, std::move(typeName), std::move(name), value, std::move(preVisit), std::move(visit), std::move(postVisit)); // NOLINT
4374}
4375#endif

4381#ifdef WIN32
4382 // Export symbols if compile flags "LIB_SHARED" and "LIB_EXPORTS" are set on Windows.
4383 #ifdef LIB_SHARED
4384 #ifdef LIB_EXPORTS
4385 #define LIB_API __declspec(dllexport)
4386 #else

4388 #endif
4389 #else

4398#include <string>
4399#include <utility>
4400namespace cluon { namespace data {
4401using namespace std::string_literals; // NOLINT
4402class LIB_API TimeStamp {
4403 private:
4404 static constexpr const char* TheShortName = "TimeStamp";
4405 static constexpr const char* TheLongName = "cluon.data.TimeStamp";
4406
4407 public:
4408 inline static int32_t ID() {
4409 return 12;
4410 }
4411 inline static const std::string ShortName() {
4412 return TheShortName;
4413 }
4414 inline static const std::string LongName() {
4415 return TheLongName;
4416 }
4417
4418 public:
4419 TimeStamp() = default;
4420 TimeStamp(const TimeStamp&) = default;
4421 TimeStamp& operator=(const TimeStamp&) = default;
4422 TimeStamp(TimeStamp&&) = default;
4423 TimeStamp& operator=(TimeStamp&&) = default;
4424 ~TimeStamp() = default;
4425
4426 public:
4427
4428 inline TimeStamp& seconds(const int32_t &v) noexcept {
4429 m_seconds = v;
4430 return *this;
4431 }
4432 inline int32_t seconds() const noexcept {
4433 return m_seconds;
4434 }
4435
4436 inline TimeStamp& microseconds(const int32_t &v) noexcept {
4437 m_microseconds = v;
4438 return *this;
4439 }
4440 inline int32_t microseconds() const noexcept {
4441 return m_microseconds;
4442 }
4443
4444
4445 public:
4446 template<class Visitor>
4447 inline void accept(uint32_t fieldId, Visitor &visitor) {
4448 (void)fieldId;
4449 (void)visitor;
4450// visitor.preVisit(ID(), ShortName(), LongName());
4451
4452 if (1 == fieldId) {
4453 doVisit(1, std::move("int32_t"s), std::move("seconds"s), m_seconds, visitor);
4454 return;
4455 }
4456
4457 if (2 == fieldId) {
4458 doVisit(2, std::move("int32_t"s), std::move("microseconds"s), m_microseconds, visitor);
4459 return;
4460 }
4461
4462// visitor.postVisit();
4463 }
4464
4465 template<class Visitor>
4466 inline void accept(Visitor &visitor) {
4467 visitor.preVisit(ID(), ShortName(), LongName());
4468
4469 doVisit(1, std::move("int32_t"s), std::move("seconds"s), m_seconds, visitor);
4470
4471 doVisit(2, std::move("int32_t"s), std::move("microseconds"s), m_microseconds, visitor);
4472
4473 visitor.postVisit();
4474 }
4475
4476 template<class PreVisitor, class Visitor, class PostVisitor>
4477 inline void accept(PreVisitor &&preVisit, Visitor &&visit, PostVisitor &&postVisit) {
4478 (void)visit; // Prevent warnings from empty messages.
4479 std::forward<PreVisitor>(preVisit)(ID(), ShortName(), LongName());
4480
4481 doTripletForwardVisit(1, std::move("int32_t"s), std::move("seconds"s), m_seconds, preVisit, visit, postVisit);
4482
4483 doTripletForwardVisit(2, std::move("int32_t"s), std::move("microseconds"s), m_microseconds, preVisit, visit, postVisit);
4484
4485 std::forward<PostVisitor>(postVisit)();
4486 }
4487
4488 private:
4489
4490 int32_t m_seconds{ 0 }; // field identifier = 1.
4491
4492 int32_t m_microseconds{ 0 }; // field identifier = 2.
4493
4494};
4495}}

4605#include <string>
4606#include <utility>
4607namespace cluon { namespace data {
4608using namespace std::string_literals; // NOLINT
4609class LIB_API Envelope {
4610 private:
4611 static constexpr const char* TheShortName = "Envelope";
4612 static constexpr const char* TheLongName = "cluon.data.Envelope";
4613
4614 public:
4615 inline static int32_t ID() {
4616 return 1;
4617 }
4618 inline static const std::string ShortName() {
4619 return TheShortName;
4620 }
4621 inline static const std::string LongName() {
4622 return TheLongName;
4623 }
4624
4625 public:
4626 Envelope() = default;
4627 Envelope(const Envelope&) = default;
4628 Envelope& operator=(const Envelope&) = default;
4629 Envelope(Envelope&&) = default;
4630 Envelope& operator=(Envelope&&) = default;
4631 ~Envelope() = default;
4632
4633 public:
4634
4635 inline Envelope& dataType(const int32_t &v) noexcept {
4636 m_dataType = v;
4637 return *this;
4638 }
4639 inline int32_t dataType() const noexcept {
4640 return m_dataType;
4641 }
4642
4643 inline Envelope& serializedData(const std::string &v) noexcept {
4644 m_serializedData = v;
4645 return *this;
4646 }
4647 inline std::string serializedData() const noexcept {
4648 return m_serializedData;
4649 }
4650
4651 inline Envelope& sent(const cluon::data::TimeStamp &v) noexcept {
4652 m_sent = v;
4653 return *this;
4654 }
4655 inline cluon::data::TimeStamp sent() const noexcept {
4656 return m_sent;
4657 }
4658
4659 inline Envelope& received(const cluon::data::TimeStamp &v) noexcept {
4660 m_received = v;
4661 return *this;
4662 }
4663 inline cluon::data::TimeStamp received() const noexcept {
4664 return m_received;
4665 }
4666
4667 inline Envelope& sampleTimeStamp(const cluon::data::TimeStamp &v) noexcept {
4668 m_sampleTimeStamp = v;
4669 return *this;
4670 }
4671 inline cluon::data::TimeStamp sampleTimeStamp() const noexcept {
4672 return m_sampleTimeStamp;
4673 }
4674
4675 inline Envelope& senderStamp(const uint32_t &v) noexcept {
4676 m_senderStamp = v;
4677 return *this;
4678 }
4679 inline uint32_t senderStamp() const noexcept {
4680 return m_senderStamp;
4681 }
4682
4683
4684 public:
4685 template<class Visitor>
4686 inline void accept(uint32_t fieldId, Visitor &visitor) {
4687 (void)fieldId;
4688 (void)visitor;
4689// visitor.preVisit(ID(), ShortName(), LongName());
4690
4691 if (1 == fieldId) {
4692 doVisit(1, std::move("int32_t"s), std::move("dataType"s), m_dataType, visitor);
4693 return;
4694 }
4695
4696 if (2 == fieldId) {
4697 doVisit(2, std::move("std::string"s), std::move("serializedData"s), m_serializedData, visitor);
4698 return;
4699 }
4700
4701 if (3 == fieldId) {
4702 doVisit(3, std::move("cluon::data::TimeStamp"s), std::move("sent"s), m_sent, visitor);
4703 return;
4704 }
4705
4706 if (4 == fieldId) {
4707 doVisit(4, std::move("cluon::data::TimeStamp"s), std::move("received"s), m_received, visitor);
4708 return;
4709 }
4710
4711 if (5 == fieldId) {
4712 doVisit(5, std::move("cluon::data::TimeStamp"s), std::move("sampleTimeStamp"s), m_sampleTimeStamp, visitor);
4713 return;
4714 }
4715
4716 if (6 == fieldId) {
4717 doVisit(6, std::move("uint32_t"s), std::move("senderStamp"s), m_senderStamp, visitor);
4718 return;
4719 }
4720
4721// visitor.postVisit();
4722 }
4723
4724 template<class Visitor>
4725 inline void accept(Visitor &visitor) {
4726 visitor.preVisit(ID(), ShortName(), LongName());
4727
4728 doVisit(1, std::move("int32_t"s), std::move("dataType"s), m_dataType, visitor);
4729
4730 doVisit(2, std::move("std::string"s), std::move("serializedData"s), m_serializedData, visitor);
4731
4732 doVisit(3, std::move("cluon::data::TimeStamp"s), std::move("sent"s), m_sent, visitor);
4733
4734 doVisit(4, std::move("cluon::data::TimeStamp"s), std::move("received"s), m_received, visitor);
4735
4736 doVisit(5, std::move("cluon::data::TimeStamp"s), std::move("sampleTimeStamp"s), m_sampleTimeStamp, visitor);
4737
4738 doVisit(6, std::move("uint32_t"s), std::move("senderStamp"s), m_senderStamp, visitor);
4739
4740 visitor.postVisit();
4741 }
4742
4743 template<class PreVisitor, class Visitor, class PostVisitor>
4744 inline void accept(PreVisitor &&preVisit, Visitor &&visit, PostVisitor &&postVisit) {
4745 (void)visit; // Prevent warnings from empty messages.
4746 std::forward<PreVisitor>(preVisit)(ID(), ShortName(), LongName());
4747
4748 doTripletForwardVisit(1, std::move("int32_t"s), std::move("dataType"s), m_dataType, preVisit, visit, postVisit);
4749
4750 doTripletForwardVisit(2, std::move("std::string"s), std::move("serializedData"s), m_serializedData, preVisit, visit, postVisit);
4751
4752 doTripletForwardVisit(3, std::move("cluon::data::TimeStamp"s), std::move("sent"s), m_sent, preVisit, visit, postVisit);
4753
4754 doTripletForwardVisit(4, std::move("cluon::data::TimeStamp"s), std::move("received"s), m_received, preVisit, visit, postVisit);
4755
4756 doTripletForwardVisit(5, std::move("cluon::data::TimeStamp"s), std::move("sampleTimeStamp"s), m_sampleTimeStamp, preVisit, visit, postVisit);
4757
4758 doTripletForwardVisit(6, std::move("uint32_t"s), std::move("senderStamp"s), m_senderStamp, preVisit, visit, postVisit);
4759
4760 std::forward<PostVisitor>(postVisit)();
4761 }
4762
4763 private:
4764
4765 int32_t m_dataType{ 0 }; // field identifier = 1.
4766
4767 std::string m_serializedData{ ""s }; // field identifier = 2.
4768
4769 cluon::data::TimeStamp m_sent{ }; // field identifier = 3.
4770
4771 cluon::data::TimeStamp m_received{ }; // field identifier = 4.
4772
4773 cluon::data::TimeStamp m_sampleTimeStamp{ }; // field identifier = 5.
4774
4775 uint32_t m_senderStamp{ 0 }; // field identifier = 6.
4776
4777};
4778}}

4786 static const bool value = true;

4843
4844template<>
4845struct tripletForwardVisitorSelector<true> {
4846 template<typename T, class PreVisitor, class Visitor, class PostVisitor>
4847 static void impl(uint32_t fieldIdentifier, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value, PreVisitor &&preVisit, Visitor &&visit, PostVisitor &&postVisit) {
4848 (void)fieldIdentifier;
4849 (void)typeName;
4850 (void)name;
4851 // Apply preVisit, visit, and postVisit on value.
4852 value.accept(preVisit, visit, postVisit);
4853 }
4854};
4855
4856template<typename T>
4857struct isTripletForwardVisitable {
4858 static const bool value = false;
4859};
4860
4861template< typename T, class PreVisitor, class Visitor, class PostVisitor>
4862void doTripletForwardVisit(uint32_t fieldIdentifier, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value, PreVisitor &&preVisit, Visitor &&visit, PostVisitor &&postVisit) {
4863 tripletForwardVisitorSelector<isTripletForwardVisitable<T>::value >::impl(fieldIdentifier, std::move(typeName), std::move(name), value, std::move(preVisit), std::move(visit), std::move(postVisit)); // NOLINT
4864}
4865#endif

4868#ifndef CLUON_DATA_PLAYERCOMMAND_HPP
4869#define CLUON_DATA_PLAYERCOMMAND_HPP
4870
4871#ifdef WIN32
4872 // Export symbols if compile flags "LIB_SHARED" and "LIB_EXPORTS" are set on Windows.
4873 #ifdef LIB_SHARED
4874 #ifdef LIB_EXPORTS
4875 #define LIB_API __declspec(dllexport)
4876 #else
4877 #define LIB_API __declspec(dllimport)
4878 #endif
4879 #else

4888#include <string>
4889#include <utility>
4890namespace cluon { namespace data {
4891using namespace std::string_literals; // NOLINT
4892class LIB_API PlayerCommand {
4893 private:
4894 static constexpr const char* TheShortName = "PlayerCommand";
4895 static constexpr const char* TheLongName = "cluon.data.PlayerCommand";
4896
4897 public:
4898 inline static int32_t ID() {
4899 return 9;
4900 }
4901 inline static const std::string ShortName() {
4902 return TheShortName;
4903 }
4904 inline static const std::string LongName() {
4905 return TheLongName;
4906 }
4907
4908 public:
4909 PlayerCommand() = default;
4910 PlayerCommand(const PlayerCommand&) = default;
4911 PlayerCommand& operator=(const PlayerCommand&) = default;
4912 PlayerCommand(PlayerCommand&&) = default;
4913 PlayerCommand& operator=(PlayerCommand&&) = default;
4914 ~PlayerCommand() = default;
4915
4916 public:
4917
4918 inline PlayerCommand& command(const uint8_t &v) noexcept {
4919 m_command = v;
4920 return *this;
4921 }
4922 inline uint8_t command() const noexcept {
4923 return m_command;
4924 }
4925
4926 inline PlayerCommand& seekTo(const float &v) noexcept {
4927 m_seekTo = v;
4928 return *this;
4929 }
4930 inline float seekTo() const noexcept {
4931 return m_seekTo;
4932 }
4933
4934
4935 public:
4936 template<class Visitor>
4937 inline void accept(uint32_t fieldId, Visitor &visitor) {
4938 (void)fieldId;
4939 (void)visitor;
4940// visitor.preVisit(ID(), ShortName(), LongName());
4941
4942 if (1 == fieldId) {
4943 doVisit(1, std::move("uint8_t"s), std::move("command"s), m_command, visitor);
4944 return;
4945 }
4946
4947 if (2 == fieldId) {
4948 doVisit(2, std::move("float"s), std::move("seekTo"s), m_seekTo, visitor);
4949 return;
4950 }
4951
4952// visitor.postVisit();
4953 }
4954
4955 template<class Visitor>
4956 inline void accept(Visitor &visitor) {
4957 visitor.preVisit(ID(), ShortName(), LongName());
4958
4959 doVisit(1, std::move("uint8_t"s), std::move("command"s), m_command, visitor);
4960
4961 doVisit(2, std::move("float"s), std::move("seekTo"s), m_seekTo, visitor);
4962
4963 visitor.postVisit();
4964 }
4965
4966 template<class PreVisitor, class Visitor, class PostVisitor>
4967 inline void accept(PreVisitor &&preVisit, Visitor &&visit, PostVisitor &&postVisit) {
4968 (void)visit; // Prevent warnings from empty messages.
4969 std::forward<PreVisitor>(preVisit)(ID(), ShortName(), LongName());
4970
4971 doTripletForwardVisit(1, std::move("uint8_t"s), std::move("command"s), m_command, preVisit, visit, postVisit);
4972
4973 doTripletForwardVisit(2, std::move("float"s), std::move("seekTo"s), m_seekTo, preVisit, visit, postVisit);
4974
4975 std::forward<PostVisitor>(postVisit)();
4976 }
4977
4978 private:
4979
4980 uint8_t m_command{ 0 }; // field identifier = 1.
4981
4982 float m_seekTo{ 0.0f }; // field identifier = 2.
4983
4984};
4985}}

5008template<bool b>
5009struct visitorSelector {
5010 template<typename T, class Visitor>
5011 static void impl(uint32_t fieldIdentifier, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value, Visitor &visitor) {
5012 visitor.visit(fieldIdentifier, std::move(typeName), std::move(name), value);
5013 }
5014};

5017struct visitorSelector<true> {
5018 template<typename T, class Visitor>
5019 static void impl(uint32_t fieldIdentifier, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value, Visitor &visitor) {
5020 visitor.visit(fieldIdentifier, std::move(typeName), std::move(name), value);
5021 }
5022};

5025struct isVisitable {
5026 static const bool value = false;
5027};

5030void doVisit(uint32_t fieldIdentifier, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value, Visitor &visitor) {
5031 visitorSelector<isVisitable<T>::value >::impl(fieldIdentifier, std::move(typeName), std::move(name), value, visitor);

5046 (void)postVisit;

5121 ~PlayerStatus() = default;

5126 m_state = v;
5127 return *this;
5128 }
5129 inline uint8_t state() const noexcept {
5130 return m_state;
5131 }

5134 m_numberOfEntries = v;
5135 return *this;
5136 }
5137 inline uint32_t numberOfEntries() const noexcept {
5138 return m_numberOfEntries;
5139 }

5142 m_currentEntryForPlayback = v;
5143 return *this;
5144 }
5145 inline uint32_t currentEntryForPlayback() const noexcept {
5146 return m_currentEntryForPlayback;
5147 }

5153 (void)fieldId;

5155// visitor.preVisit(ID(), ShortName(), LongName());
5156
5157 if (1 == fieldId) {
5158 doVisit(1, std::move("uint8_t"s), std::move("state"s), m_state, visitor);
5159 return;
5160 }
5161
5162 if (2 == fieldId) {
5163 doVisit(2, std::move("uint32_t"s), std::move("numberOfEntries"s), m_numberOfEntries, visitor);
5164 return;
5165 }
5166
5167 if (3 == fieldId) {
5168 doVisit(3, std::move("uint32_t"s), std::move("currentEntryForPlayback"s), m_currentEntryForPlayback, visitor);
5169 return;
5170 }
5171
5172// visitor.postVisit();
5173 }

5176 inline void accept(Visitor &visitor) {
5177 visitor.preVisit(ID(), ShortName(), LongName());

5181 doVisit(2, std::move("uint32_t"s), std::move("numberOfEntries"s), m_numberOfEntries, visitor);
5182
5183 doVisit(3, std::move("uint32_t"s), std::move("currentEntryForPlayback"s), m_currentEntryForPlayback, visitor);
5184
5185 visitor.postVisit();
5186 }
5187

5189 inline void accept(PreVisitor &&preVisit, Visitor &&visit, PostVisitor &&postVisit) {
5190 (void)visit; // Prevent warnings from empty messages.
5191 std::forward<PreVisitor>(preVisit)(ID(), ShortName(), LongName());

5193 doTripletForwardVisit(1, std::move("uint8_t"s), std::move("state"s), m_state, preVisit, visit, postVisit);
5194
5195 doTripletForwardVisit(2, std::move("uint32_t"s), std::move("numberOfEntries"s), m_numberOfEntries, preVisit, visit, postVisit);
5196
5197 doTripletForwardVisit(3, std::move("uint32_t"s), std::move("currentEntryForPlayback"s), m_currentEntryForPlayback, preVisit, visit, postVisit);
5198
5199 std::forward<PostVisitor>(postVisit)();
5200 }

5321#include <string>
5322#include <utility>
5323namespace cluon { namespace data {
5324using namespace std::string_literals; // NOLINT
5325class LIB_API RecorderCommand {
5326 private:
5327 static constexpr const char* TheShortName = "RecorderCommand";
5328 static constexpr const char* TheLongName = "cluon.data.RecorderCommand";
5329
5330 public:
5331 inline static int32_t ID() {
5332 return 11;
5333 }
5334 inline static const std::string ShortName() {
5335 return TheShortName;
5336 }
5337 inline static const std::string LongName() {
5338 return TheLongName;
5339 }
5340
5341 public:
5342 RecorderCommand() = default;
5343 RecorderCommand(const RecorderCommand&) = default;
5344 RecorderCommand& operator=(const RecorderCommand&) = default;
5345 RecorderCommand(RecorderCommand&&) = default;
5346 RecorderCommand& operator=(RecorderCommand&&) = default;
5347 ~RecorderCommand() = default;
5348
5349 public:
5350
5351 inline RecorderCommand& command(const uint8_t &v) noexcept {
5352 m_command = v;
5353 return *this;
5354 }
5355 inline uint8_t command() const noexcept {
5356 return m_command;
5357 }
5358
5359
5360 public:
5361 template<class Visitor>
5362 inline void accept(uint32_t fieldId, Visitor &visitor) {
5363 (void)fieldId;
5364 (void)visitor;
5365// visitor.preVisit(ID(), ShortName(), LongName());
5366
5367 if (1 == fieldId) {
5368 doVisit(1, std::move("uint8_t"s), std::move("command"s), m_command, visitor);
5369 return;
5370 }
5371
5372// visitor.postVisit();
5373 }
5374
5375 template<class Visitor>
5376 inline void accept(Visitor &visitor) {
5377 visitor.preVisit(ID(), ShortName(), LongName());
5378
5379 doVisit(1, std::move("uint8_t"s), std::move("command"s), m_command, visitor);
5380
5381 visitor.postVisit();
5382 }
5383
5384 template<class PreVisitor, class Visitor, class PostVisitor>
5385 inline void accept(PreVisitor &&preVisit, Visitor &&visit, PostVisitor &&postVisit) {
5386 (void)visit; // Prevent warnings from empty messages.
5387 std::forward<PreVisitor>(preVisit)(ID(), ShortName(), LongName());
5388
5389 doTripletForwardVisit(1, std::move("uint8_t"s), std::move("command"s), m_command, preVisit, visit, postVisit);
5390
5391 std::forward<PostVisitor>(postVisit)();
5392 }
5393
5394 private:
5395
5396 uint8_t m_command{ 0 }; // field identifier = 1.
5397
5398};

5434
5435#ifndef STRINGTOOLBOX_HPP
5436#define STRINGTOOLBOX_HPP
5437
5438#include <algorithm>
5439#include <string>
5440#include <vector>
5441
5442namespace stringtoolbox {
5443
5447inline std::string &rtrim(std::string &str) noexcept {
5448 str.erase(str.find_last_not_of(" \t") + 1);
5449 return str;
5450}
5451
5455inline std::string &ltrim(std::string &str) noexcept {
5456 str.erase(0, str.find_first_not_of(" \t"));
5457 return str;
5458}
5459
5463inline std::string &trim(std::string &str) noexcept {
5464 return ltrim(rtrim(str));
5465}
5466
5470inline std::string replaceAll(const std::string &str,
5471 const char &FROM,
5472 const char &TO) noexcept {
5473 std::string retVal{str};
5474 std::replace(retVal.begin(), retVal.end(), FROM, TO);
5475 return retVal;
5476}
5477
5481inline std::vector<std::string> split(const std::string &str,
5482 const char &delimiter) noexcept {
5483 std::vector<std::string> retVal{};
5484 std::string::size_type prev{0};
5485 for (std::string::size_type i{str.find_first_of(delimiter, prev)};
5486 i != std::string::npos;
5487 prev = i + 1, i = str.find_first_of(delimiter, prev)) {
5488 if (i != prev) {
5489 retVal.emplace_back(str.substr(prev, i - prev));
5490 }
5491 else {
5492 retVal.emplace_back("");
5493 }
5494 }
5495 if ((prev > 0) && (prev < str.size())) {
5496 retVal.emplace_back(str.substr(prev, str.size() - prev));
5497 }
5498 else if (prev > 0) {
5499 retVal.emplace_back("");
5500 }
5501 return retVal;
5502}
5503
5504} // namespace stringtoolbox
5505
5506#endif
5507/*
5508 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
5509 *
5510 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
5511 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
5512 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
5513 */
5514
5515#ifndef CLUON_TIME_HPP
5516#define CLUON_TIME_HPP
5517
5518//#include "cluon/cluonDataStructures.hpp"
5519
5520#include <chrono>
5521
5522namespace cluon {
5523namespace time {
5524
5529inline cluon::data::TimeStamp fromMicroseconds(int64_t tp) noexcept {
5530 cluon::data::TimeStamp ts;
5531 ts.seconds(static_cast<int32_t>(tp / static_cast<int64_t>(1000 * 1000))).microseconds(static_cast<int32_t>(tp % static_cast<int64_t>(1000 * 1000)));
5532 return ts;
5533}
5534
5539inline int64_t toMicroseconds(const cluon::data::TimeStamp &tp) noexcept {
5540 return static_cast<int64_t>(tp.seconds()) * static_cast<int64_t>(1000 * 1000) + static_cast<int64_t>(tp.microseconds());
5541}
5542
5548inline int64_t deltaInMicroseconds(const cluon::data::TimeStamp &AFTER, const cluon::data::TimeStamp &BEFORE) noexcept {
5549 return toMicroseconds(AFTER) - toMicroseconds(BEFORE);
5550}
5551
5556inline cluon::data::TimeStamp convert(const std::chrono::system_clock::time_point &tp) noexcept {
5557 cluon::data::TimeStamp timeStamp;
5558
5559 // Transform chrono time representation to same behavior as gettimeofday.
5560 typedef std::chrono::duration<int32_t> seconds_type;
5561 typedef std::chrono::duration<int64_t, std::micro> microseconds_type;
5562
5563 auto duration = tp.time_since_epoch();
5564 seconds_type s = std::chrono::duration_cast<seconds_type>(duration);
5565 microseconds_type us = std::chrono::duration_cast<microseconds_type>(duration);
5566 microseconds_type partial_us = us - std::chrono::duration_cast<microseconds_type>(s);
5567
5568 timeStamp.seconds(s.count()).microseconds(static_cast<int32_t>(partial_us.count()));
5569
5570 return timeStamp;
5571}
5572
5576inline cluon::data::TimeStamp now() noexcept {
5577 return convert(std::chrono::system_clock::now());
5578}
5579
5580} // namespace time
5581} // namespace cluon
5582
5583#endif
5584// "License": Public Domain
5585// I, Mathias PanzenbÃ¶ck, place this file hereby into the public domain. Use it at your own risk for whatever you like.
5586// In case there are jurisdictions that don't support putting things in the public domain you can also consider it to
5587// be "dual licensed" under the BSD, MIT and Apache licenses, if you want to. This code is trivial anyway. Consider it
5588// an example on how to get the endian conversion functions on different platforms.
5589
5590// Updated for FreeBSD 10.1+, DragonFly 4.2+, NetBSD 6.1.5+, fixes for Win32,
5591// and support for emscripten; Christian Berger.
5592
5593#ifndef CLUON_PORTABLEENDIAN_HPP
5594#define CLUON_PORTABLEENDIAN_HPP
5595
5596// clang-format off
5597#if defined(__linux__) || defined(__CYGWIN__)
5598 #include <endian.h>
5599#elif defined(__APPLE__)
5600 #include <libkern/OSByteOrder.h>
5601 #define htobe16(x) OSSwapHostToBigInt16(x)
5602 #define htole16(x) OSSwapHostToLittleInt16(x)
5603 #define be16toh(x) OSSwapBigToHostInt16(x)
5604 #define le16toh(x) OSSwapLittleToHostInt16(x)
5605
5606 #define htobe32(x) OSSwapHostToBigInt32(x)
5607 #define htole32(x) OSSwapHostToLittleInt32(x)
5608 #define be32toh(x) OSSwapBigToHostInt32(x)
5609 #define le32toh(x) OSSwapLittleToHostInt32(x)
5610
5611 #define htobe64(x) OSSwapHostToBigInt64(x)
5612 #define htole64(x) OSSwapHostToLittleInt64(x)
5613 #define be64toh(x) OSSwapBigToHostInt64(x)
5614 #define le64toh(x) OSSwapLittleToHostInt64(x)
5615#elif defined(__OpenBSD__) || defined(__FreeBSD__) || defined(__NetBSD__) || defined(__DragonFly__)
5616 #include <sys/endian.h>
5617#elif (defined(_WIN16) || defined(_WIN32) || defined(_WIN64))
5618 #if BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN
5619 // Add missing definitions for MinGW.
5620 #ifndef htonll
5621 #define htonll(x) ((1==htonl(1)) ? (x) : (((uint64_t)htonl((x) & 0xFFFFFFFFUL)) << 32) | htonl((uint32_t)((x) >> 32)))
5622 #endif
5623 #ifndef ntohll
5624 #define ntohll(x) ((1==ntohl(1)) ? (x) : (((uint64_t)ntohl((x) & 0xFFFFFFFFUL)) << 32) | ntohl((uint32_t)((x) >> 32)))
5625 #endif
5626
5627 #define htobe16(x) htons(x)
5628 #define htole16(x) (x)
5629 #define be16toh(x) ntohs(x)
5630 #define le16toh(x) (x)
5631
5632 #define htobe32(x) htonl(x)
5633 #define htole32(x) (x)
5634 #define be32toh(x) ntohl(x)
5635 #define le32toh(x) (x)
5636
5637 #define htobe64(x) htonll(x)
5638 #define htole64(x) (x)
5639 #define be64toh(x) ntohll(x)
5640 #define le64toh(x) (x)
5641 #elif BYTE_ORDER == BIG_ENDIAN
5642 /* that would be xbox 360 */
5643 #define htobe16(x) (x)
5644 #define htole16(x) __builtin_bswap16(x)
5645 #define be16toh(x) (x)
5646 #define le16toh(x) __builtin_bswap16(x)
5647
5648 #define htobe32(x) (x)
5649 #define htole32(x) __builtin_bswap32(x)
5650 #define be32toh(x) (x)
5651 #define le32toh(x) __builtin_bswap32(x)
5652
5653 #define htobe64(x) (x)
5654 #define htole64(x) __builtin_bswap64(x)
5655 #define be64toh(x) (x)
5656 #define le64toh(x) __builtin_bswap64(x)
5657 #else
5658 #error byte order not supported
5659 #endif
5660#else
5661 #ifdef __EMSCRIPTEN__
5662 #include <endian.h>
5663 #else
5664 #warning platform not supported
5665 #endif
5666#endif
5667// clang-format on
5668#endif
5669/*
5670 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
5671 *
5672 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
5673 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
5674 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
5675 */
5676
5677#ifndef CLUON_CLUON_HPP
5678#define CLUON_CLUON_HPP
5679
5680// clang-format off
5681#ifdef WIN32
5682 #ifdef _WIN64
5683 #define ssize_t __int64
5684 #else
5685 #define ssize_t long
5686 #endif
5687
5688 // Disable warning "'<': signed/unsigned mismatch".
5689 #pragma warning(disable : 4018)
5690 // Disable warning "Unary minus operator applied to unsigned type, result still unsigned".
5691 #pragma warning(disable : 4146)
5692 // Disable warning "Possible loss of precision".
5693 #pragma warning(disable : 4244)
5694 // Disable warning "Conversion from 'size_t' to 'type', possible loss of data".
5695 #pragma warning(disable : 4267)
5696 // Disable warning "'static_cast': truncation of constant value".
5697 #pragma warning(disable : 4309)
5698 // Disable warning "'operator ""s': literal suffix identifiers that do not start with an underscore are reserved".
5699 #pragma warning(disable : 4455)
5700 // Disable deprecated API warnings.
5701 #pragma warning(disable : 4996)
5702
5703 // Link against ws2_32.lib for networking.
5704 #pragma comment(lib, "ws2_32.lib")
5705 // Link against iphlpapi.lib for address resolving.
5706 #pragma comment(lib, "iphlpapi.lib")
5707
5708 // Avoid include definitions from Winsock v1.
5709 #define WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN
5710
5711 // Export symbols.
5712 #ifdef LIBCLUON_SHARED
5713 #ifdef LIBCLUON_EXPORTS
5714 #define LIBCLUON_API __declspec(dllexport)
5715 #else
5716 #define LIBCLUON_API __declspec(dllimport)
5717 #endif
5718 #else
5719 // If linking statically:
5720 #define LIBCLUON_API
5721 #endif
5722#else
5723 // Undefine define for non-Win32 systems:
5724 #define LIBCLUON_API
5725#endif
5726// clang-format on
5727
5728//#include "cluon/PortableEndian.hpp"
5729
5730#include <map>
5731#include <string>
5732
5733namespace cluon {
5734
5738class UseUInt32ValueAsHashKey {
5739 public:
5740 inline std::size_t operator()(const uint32_t v) const noexcept {
5741 return static_cast<std::size_t>(v);
5742 }
5743};
5744
5748std::map<std::string, std::string> getCommandlineArguments(int32_t argc, char **argv) noexcept;
5749
5750} // namespace cluon

5752#endif

5761#ifndef CLUON_METAMESSAGE_HPP
5762#define CLUON_METAMESSAGE_HPP
5763
5764//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"

5766#include <cstdint>
5767#include <functional>
5768#include <string>
5769#include <vector>
5770
5771namespace cluon {
5777class LIBCLUON_API MetaMessage {
5778 public:
5783 class MetaField {
5784 public:
5785 enum MetaFieldDataTypes : uint16_t {
5786 BOOL_T = 0,
5787 UINT8_T = 2,
5788 INT8_T = 3,
5789 UINT16_T = 4,
5790 INT16_T = 5,
5791 UINT32_T = 6,
5792 INT32_T = 7,
5793 UINT64_T = 8,
5794 INT64_T = 9,
5795 CHAR_T = 11,
5796 FLOAT_T = 13,
5797 DOUBLE_T = 14,
5798 BYTES_T = 49,
5799 STRING_T = 51,
5800 MESSAGE_T = 53,
5801 UNDEFINED_T = 0xFFFF,
5802 };
5803
5804 private:
5805 MetaField &operator=(MetaField &&) = delete;
5806
5807 public:
5808 MetaField() = default;
5809 MetaField(const MetaField &) = default;
5810 MetaField(MetaField &&) = default;
5811 MetaField &operator=(const MetaField &) = default;
5812
5813 public:
5817 MetaFieldDataTypes fieldDataType() const noexcept;
5824 MetaField &fieldDataType(const MetaFieldDataTypes &v) noexcept;
5825
5829 std::string fieldDataTypeName() const noexcept;
5836 MetaField &fieldDataTypeName(const std::string &v) noexcept;
5837
5841 std::string fieldName() const noexcept;
5848 MetaField &fieldName(const std::string &v) noexcept;
5849
5853 uint32_t fieldIdentifier() const noexcept;
5860 MetaField &fieldIdentifier(uint32_t v) noexcept;
5861
5865 std::string defaultInitializationValue() const noexcept;
5872 MetaField &defaultInitializationValue(const std::string &v) noexcept;
5873
5874 private:
5875 MetaFieldDataTypes m_fieldDataType{UNDEFINED_T};
5876 std::string m_fieldDataTypeName{""};
5877 std::string m_fieldName{""};
5878 uint32_t m_fieldIdentifier{0};
5879 std::string m_defaultInitializationValue{""};
5880 };
5881
5882 public:
5883 MetaMessage() noexcept;
5884 MetaMessage(const MetaMessage &) = default;
5885 MetaMessage(MetaMessage &&) = default;
5886 MetaMessage &operator=(const MetaMessage &) = default;
5887 MetaMessage &operator=(MetaMessage &&) = default;
5888
5895 MetaMessage &add(MetaField &&mf) noexcept;
5896
5902 const std::vector<MetaField> &listOfMetaFields() const noexcept;
5903
5910 void accept(const std::function<void(const MetaMessage &)> &visit);
5911
5915 std::string packageName() const noexcept;
5922 MetaMessage &packageName(const std::string &v) noexcept;
5923
5927 std::string messageName() const noexcept;
5934 MetaMessage &messageName(const std::string &v) noexcept;
5935
5939 int32_t messageIdentifier() const noexcept;
5946 MetaMessage &messageIdentifier(int32_t v) noexcept;
5947
5948 private:
5949 std::string m_packageName{""};
5950 std::string m_messageName{""};
5951 int32_t m_messageIdentifier{0};
5952 std::vector<MetaField> m_listOfMetaFields{};
5953};
5954} // namespace cluon
5955
5956#endif

6045#ifndef CLUON_TERMINATEHANDLER_HPP

6054
6055class LIBCLUON_API TerminateHandler {
6056 private:

6058 TerminateHandler(TerminateHandler &&) = delete;
6059 TerminateHandler &operator=(const TerminateHandler &) = delete;
6060 TerminateHandler &operator=(TerminateHandler &&) = delete;
6061
6062 public:

6068 static TerminateHandler instance;
6069 return instance;
6070 }
6071
6072 ~TerminateHandler() = default;

6087/*
