6095#ifndef CLUON_NOTIFYINGPIPELINE_HPP
6096#define CLUON_NOTIFYINGPIPELINE_HPP
6097
6098//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
6099
6100#include <atomic>
6101#include <condition_variable>
6102#include <deque>
6103#include <functional>
6104#include <mutex>
6105#include <thread>
6106
6107namespace cluon {
6108
6109template <class T>
6110class LIBCLUON_API NotifyingPipeline {
6111 private:
6112 NotifyingPipeline(const NotifyingPipeline &) = delete;
6113 NotifyingPipeline(NotifyingPipeline &&) = delete;
6114 NotifyingPipeline &operator=(const NotifyingPipeline &) = delete;
6115 NotifyingPipeline &operator=(NotifyingPipeline &&) = delete;
6116
6117 public:
6118 NotifyingPipeline(std::function<void(T &&)> delegate)
6119 : m_delegate(delegate) {
6120 m_pipelineThread = std::thread(&NotifyingPipeline::processPipeline, this);
6121
6122 // Let the operating system spawn the thread.
6123 using namespace std::literals::chrono_literals; // NOLINT
6124 do { std::this_thread::sleep_for(1ms); } while (!m_pipelineThreadRunning.load());
6125 }
6126
6127 ~NotifyingPipeline() {
6128 m_pipelineThreadRunning.store(false);
6129
6130 // Wake any waiting threads.
6131 m_pipelineCondition.notify_all();
6132
6133 // Joining the thread could fail.
6134 try {
6135 if (m_pipelineThread.joinable()) {
6136 m_pipelineThread.join();
6137 }
6138 } catch (...) {} // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
6139 }
6140
6141 public:
6142 inline void add(T &&entry) noexcept {
6143 std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lck(m_pipelineMutex);
6144 m_pipeline.emplace_back(entry);
6145 }
6146
6147 inline void notifyAll() noexcept { m_pipelineCondition.notify_all(); }
6148
6149 inline bool isRunning() noexcept { return m_pipelineThreadRunning.load(); }
6150
6151 private:
6152 inline void processPipeline() noexcept {
6153 // Indicate to caller that we are ready.
6154 m_pipelineThreadRunning.store(true);
6155
6156 while (m_pipelineThreadRunning.load()) {
6157 std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lck(m_pipelineMutex);
6158 // Wait until the thread should stop or data is available.
6159 m_pipelineCondition.wait(lck, [this] { return (!this->m_pipelineThreadRunning.load() || !this->m_pipeline.empty()); });
6160
6161 // The condition will automatically lock the mutex after waking up.
6162 // As we are locking per entry, we need to unlock the mutex first.
6163 lck.unlock();
6164
6165 uint32_t entries{0};
6166 {
6167 lck.lock();
6168 entries = static_cast<uint32_t>(m_pipeline.size());
6169 lck.unlock();
6170 }
6171 for (uint32_t i{0}; i < entries; i++) {
6172 T entry;
6173 {
6174 lck.lock();
6175 entry = m_pipeline.front();
6176 lck.unlock();
6177 }
6178
6179 if (nullptr != m_delegate) {
6180 m_delegate(std::move(entry));
6181 }
6182
6183 {
6184 lck.lock();
6185 m_pipeline.pop_front();
6186 lck.unlock();
6187 }
6188 }
6189 }
6190 }
6191
6192 private:
6193 std::function<void(T &&)> m_delegate;
6194
6195 std::atomic<bool> m_pipelineThreadRunning{false};
6196 std::thread m_pipelineThread{};
6197 std::mutex m_pipelineMutex{};
6198 std::condition_variable m_pipelineCondition{};
6199
6200 std::deque<T> m_pipeline{};
6201};
6202} // namespace cluon
6203
6204#endif
6205/*
6206 * Copyright (C) 2019 Christian Berger
6207 *
6208 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
6209 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
6210 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
6211 */
6212
6213#ifndef CLUON_IPV4TOOLS_HPP
6214#define CLUON_IPV4TOOLS_HPP
6215
6216#include <string>
6217
6218namespace cluon {
6219
6223std::string getIPv4FromHostname(const std::string &hostname) noexcept;
6224
6225} // namespace cluon
6226
6227#endif
6228/*
6229 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
6230 *
6231 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
6232 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
6233 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
6234 */
6235
6236#ifndef CLUON_UDPPACKETSIZECONSTRAINTS_H
6237#define CLUON_UDPPACKETSIZECONSTRAINTS_H
6238
6239#include <cstdint>
6240
6241// clang-format off
6242namespace cluon {
6243 enum class UDPPacketSizeConstraints : uint16_t {
6244 SIZE_IPv4_HEADER = 20,
6245 SIZE_UDP_HEADER = 8,
6246 MAX_SIZE_UDP_PACKET = 0xFFFF, };
6247}
6248// clang-format on
6249
6250#endif

6252 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
6253 *

6255 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
6256 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.

6259#ifndef CLUON_UDPSENDER_HPP
6260#define CLUON_UDPSENDER_HPP
6261
6262//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
6263
6264// clang-format off
6265#ifdef WIN32
6266 #include <Winsock2.h> // for WSAStartUp
6267 #include <ws2tcpip.h> // for SOCKET
6268#else
6269 #include <netinet/in.h>
6270#endif

6274#include <mutex>
6275#include <string>
6276#include <utility>
6277
6278namespace cluon {
6306class LIBCLUON_API UDPSender {
6307 private:

6309 UDPSender(UDPSender &&) = delete;
6310 UDPSender &operator=(const UDPSender &) = delete;
6311 UDPSender &operator=(UDPSender &&) = delete;
6312
6313 public:

6322
6329 std::pair<ssize_t, int32_t> send(std::string &&data) const noexcept;
6330
6331 public:

6336
6337 private:
6338 mutable std::mutex m_socketMutex{};
6339 int32_t m_socket{-1};
6340 uint16_t m_portToSentFrom{0};
6341 struct sockaddr_in m_sendToAddress {};

6345#endif

6350 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this

6354#ifndef CLUON_UDPRECEIVER_HPP
6355#define CLUON_UDPRECEIVER_HPP
6356
6357//#include "cluon/NotifyingPipeline.hpp"
6358//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
6359
6360// clang-format off
6361#ifdef WIN32
6362 #include <Winsock2.h> // for WSAStartUp
6363 #include <ws2tcpip.h> // for SOCKET
6364#else
6365 #include <netinet/in.h>
6366#endif
6367// clang-format on
6368
6369#include <cstdint>
6370#include <atomic>
6371#include <condition_variable>
6372#include <deque>
6373#include <chrono>
6374#include <functional>
6375#include <memory>
6376#include <mutex>
6377#include <set>
6378#include <string>
6379#include <thread>
6380
6381namespace cluon {
6419class LIBCLUON_API UDPReceiver {
6420 private:
6421 UDPReceiver(const UDPReceiver &) = delete;
6422 UDPReceiver(UDPReceiver &&) = delete;
6423 UDPReceiver &operator=(const UDPReceiver &) = delete;
6424 UDPReceiver &operator=(UDPReceiver &&) = delete;
6425
6426 public:
6435 UDPReceiver(const std::string &receiveFromAddress,
6436 uint16_t receiveFromPort,
6437 std::function<void(std::string &&, std::string &&, std::chrono::system_clock::time_point &&)> delegate,
6438 uint16_t localSendFromPort = 0) noexcept;
6439 ~UDPReceiver() noexcept;
6440
6444 bool isRunning() const noexcept;
6445
6446 private:
6452 void closeSocket(int errorCode) noexcept;
6453
6454 void readFromSocket() noexcept;
6455
6456 private:
6457 int32_t m_socket{-1};
6458 bool m_isBlockingSocket{true};
6459 std::set<unsigned long> m_listOfLocalIPAddresses{};
6460 uint16_t m_localSendFromPort;
6461 struct sockaddr_in m_receiveFromAddress {};
6462 struct ip_mreq m_mreq {};
6463 bool m_isMulticast{false};
6464
6465 std::atomic<bool> m_readFromSocketThreadRunning{false};
6466 std::thread m_readFromSocketThread{};
6467
6468 private:
6469 std::function<void(std::string &&, std::string &&, std::chrono::system_clock::time_point)> m_delegate{};
6470
6471 private:
6472 class PipelineEntry {
6473 public:
6474 std::string m_data;
6475 std::string m_from;
6476 std::chrono::system_clock::time_point m_sampleTime;
6477 };
6478
6479 std::shared_ptr<cluon::NotifyingPipeline<PipelineEntry>> m_pipeline{};
6480};
6481} // namespace cluon
6482
6483#endif
6484/*
6485 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
6486 *
6487 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
6488 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
6489 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
6490 */
6491
6492#ifndef CLUON_TCPCONNECTION_HPP
6493#define CLUON_TCPCONNECTION_HPP
6494
6495//#include "cluon/NotifyingPipeline.hpp"
6496//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
6497
6498// clang-format off
6499#ifdef WIN32
6500 #include <Winsock2.h> // for WSAStartUp
6501 #include <ws2tcpip.h> // for SOCKET
6502#else
6503 #include <netinet/in.h>
6504#endif
6505// clang-format on
6506
6507#include <cstdint>
6508#include <atomic>
6509#include <chrono>
6510#include <functional>
6511#include <memory>
6512#include <mutex>
6513#include <string>
6514#include <thread>
6515
6516namespace cluon {
6567class LIBCLUON_API TCPConnection {
6568 private:
6569 friend class TCPServer;
6570
6576 TCPConnection(const int32_t &socket) noexcept;
6577
6578 private:
6579 TCPConnection(const TCPConnection &) = delete;
6580 TCPConnection(TCPConnection &&) = delete;
6581 TCPConnection &operator=(const TCPConnection &) = delete;
6582 TCPConnection &operator=(TCPConnection &&) = delete;
6583
6584 public:
6593 TCPConnection(const std::string &address,
6594 uint16_t port,
6595 std::function<void(std::string &&, std::chrono::system_clock::time_point &&)> newDataDelegate = nullptr,
6596 std::function<void()> connectionLostDelegate = nullptr) noexcept;
6597
6598 ~TCPConnection() noexcept;
6599
6600 public:
6601 void setOnNewData(std::function<void(std::string &&, std::chrono::system_clock::time_point &&)> newDataDelegate) noexcept;
6602 void setOnConnectionLost(std::function<void()> connectionLostDelegate) noexcept;
6603
6604 public:
6608 bool isRunning() const noexcept;
6609
6616 std::pair<ssize_t, int32_t> send(std::string &&data) const noexcept;
6617
6618 private:
6624 void closeSocket(int errorCode) noexcept;
6625 void startReadingFromSocket() noexcept;
6626 void readFromSocket() noexcept;
6627
6628 private:
6629 mutable std::mutex m_socketMutex{};
6630 int32_t m_socket{-1};
6631 struct sockaddr_in m_address {};
6632
6633 std::atomic<bool> m_readFromSocketThreadRunning{false};
6634 std::thread m_readFromSocketThread{};
6635
6636 std::mutex m_newDataDelegateMutex{};
6637 std::function<void(std::string &&, std::chrono::system_clock::time_point)> m_newDataDelegate{};
6638
6639 mutable std::mutex m_connectionLostDelegateMutex{};
6640 std::function<void()> m_connectionLostDelegate{};
6641
6642 private:
6643 class PipelineEntry {
6644 public:
6645 std::string m_data;
6646 std::chrono::system_clock::time_point m_sampleTime;
6647 };
6648
6649 std::shared_ptr<cluon::NotifyingPipeline<PipelineEntry>> m_pipeline{};
6650};
6651} // namespace cluon
6652
6653#endif
6654/*
6655 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
6656 *
6657 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
6658 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
6659 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
6660 */
6661
6662#ifndef CLUON_TCPSERVER_HPP
6663#define CLUON_TCPSERVER_HPP
6664
6665//#include "cluon/TCPConnection.hpp"
6666//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
6667
6668// clang-format off
6669#ifdef WIN32
6670 #include <Winsock2.h> // for WSAStartUp
6671 #include <ws2tcpip.h> // for SOCKET
6672#else
6673 #include <netinet/in.h>
6674#endif
6675// clang-format on
6676
6677#include <cstdint>
6678#include <atomic>
6679#include <functional>
6680#include <mutex>
6681#include <string>
6682#include <thread>
6683
6684namespace cluon {
6685
6686class LIBCLUON_API TCPServer {
6687 private:
6688 TCPServer(const TCPServer &) = delete;
6689 TCPServer(TCPServer &&) = delete;
6690 TCPServer &operator=(const TCPServer &) = delete;
6691 TCPServer &operator=(TCPServer &&) = delete;
6692
6693 public:
6700 TCPServer(uint16_t port, std::function<void(std::string &&from, std::shared_ptr<cluon::TCPConnection> connection)> newConnectionDelegate) noexcept;
6701
6702 ~TCPServer() noexcept;
6703
6707 bool isRunning() const noexcept;
6708
6709 private:
6715 void closeSocket(int errorCode) noexcept;
6716 void readFromSocket() noexcept;
6717
6718 private:
6719 mutable std::mutex m_socketMutex{};
6720 int32_t m_socket{-1};
6721
6722 std::atomic<bool> m_readFromSocketThreadRunning{false};
6723 std::thread m_readFromSocketThread{};
6724
6725 std::mutex m_newConnectionDelegateMutex{};
6726 std::function<void(std::string &&from, std::shared_ptr<cluon::TCPConnection> connection)> m_newConnectionDelegate{};
6727};
6728} // namespace cluon
6729
6730#endif
6731/*
6732 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
6733 *
6734 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
6735 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
6736 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
6737 */
6738
6739#ifndef CLUON_PROTOCONSTANTS_HPP
6740#define CLUON_PROTOCONSTANTS_HPP
6741
6742#include <cstdint>
6743
6744// clang-format off
6745namespace cluon {
6746 enum class ProtoConstants : uint8_t {
6747 VARINT = 0,
6748 EIGHT_BYTES = 1,
6749 LENGTH_DELIMITED = 2,
6750 FOUR_BYTES = 5, };
6751}
6752// clang-format on
6753
6754#endif
6755/*
6756 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
6757 *
6758 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
6759 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
6760 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
6761 */
6762
6763#ifndef CLUON_TOPROTOVISITOR_HPP
6764#define CLUON_TOPROTOVISITOR_HPP
6765
6766//#include "cluon/ProtoConstants.hpp"
6767//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
6768
6769#include <cstdint>
6770#include <sstream>
6771#include <string>
6772
6773namespace cluon {
6777class LIBCLUON_API ToProtoVisitor {
6778 private:
6779 ToProtoVisitor(const ToProtoVisitor &) = delete;
6780 ToProtoVisitor(ToProtoVisitor &&) = delete;
6781 ToProtoVisitor &operator=(const ToProtoVisitor &) = delete;
6782 ToProtoVisitor &operator=(ToProtoVisitor &&) = delete;
6783
6784 public:
6785 ToProtoVisitor() = default;
6786 ~ToProtoVisitor() = default;
6787
6791 std::string encodedData() const noexcept;
6792
6793 public:
6794 // The following methods are provided to allow an instance of this class to
6795 // be used as visitor for an instance with the method signature void accept<T>(T&);
6796
6797 void preVisit(int32_t id, const std::string &shortName, const std::string &longName) noexcept;
6798 void postVisit() noexcept;
6799
6800 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, bool &v) noexcept;
6801 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, char &v) noexcept;
6802 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int8_t &v) noexcept;
6803 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint8_t &v) noexcept;
6804 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int16_t &v) noexcept;
6805 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint16_t &v) noexcept;
6806 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int32_t &v) noexcept;
6807 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint32_t &v) noexcept;
6808 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int64_t &v) noexcept;
6809 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint64_t &v) noexcept;
6810 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, float &v) noexcept;
6811 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, double &v) noexcept;
6812 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, std::string &v) noexcept;
6813
6814 template <typename T>
6815 void visit(uint32_t &id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value) noexcept {
6816 (void)typeName;
6817 (void)name;
6818
6819 toVarInt(m_buffer, std::move(encodeKey(id, static_cast<uint8_t>(ProtoConstants::LENGTH_DELIMITED))));
6820 cluon::ToProtoVisitor nestedProtoEncoder;
6821 value.accept(nestedProtoEncoder);
6822 encode(m_buffer, std::move(nestedProtoEncoder.encodedData()));
6823 }
6824
6825 private:
6826 std::size_t encode(std::ostream &o, bool &v) noexcept;
6827 std::size_t encode(std::ostream &o, int8_t &v) noexcept;
6828 std::size_t encode(std::ostream &o, uint8_t &v) noexcept;
6829 std::size_t encode(std::ostream &o, int16_t &v) noexcept;
6830 std::size_t encode(std::ostream &o, uint16_t &v) noexcept;
6831 std::size_t encode(std::ostream &o, int32_t &v) noexcept;
6832 std::size_t encode(std::ostream &o, uint32_t &v) noexcept;
6833 std::size_t encode(std::ostream &o, int64_t &v) noexcept;
6834 std::size_t encode(std::ostream &o, uint64_t &v) noexcept;
6835 std::size_t encode(std::ostream &o, float &v) noexcept;
6836 std::size_t encode(std::ostream &o, double &v) noexcept;
6837 std::size_t encode(std::ostream &o, const std::string &v) noexcept;
6838
6839 private:
6840 uint8_t toZigZag8(int8_t v) noexcept;
6841 uint16_t toZigZag16(int16_t v) noexcept;
6842 uint32_t toZigZag32(int32_t v) noexcept;
6843 uint64_t toZigZag64(int64_t v) noexcept;
6844
6852 std::size_t toVarInt(std::ostream &out, uint64_t v) noexcept;
6853
6861 template <typename T>
6862 std::size_t toKeyValue(uint32_t fieldIdentifier, T &v) noexcept {
6863 std::size_t size{0};
6864 uint64_t key = encodeKey(fieldIdentifier, static_cast<uint8_t>(ProtoConstants::VARINT));
6865 size += toVarInt(m_buffer, key);
6866 size += encode(m_buffer, v);
6867 return size;
6868 }
6869
6877 uint64_t encodeKey(uint32_t fieldIdentifier, uint8_t protoType) noexcept;
6878
6879 private:
6880 std::stringstream m_buffer{""};
6881};
6882} // namespace cluon
6883
6884#endif
6885/*
6886 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
6887 *
6888 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
6889 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
6890 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
6891 */
6892
6893#ifndef CLUON_FROMPROTOVISITOR_HPP
6894#define CLUON_FROMPROTOVISITOR_HPP
6895
6896//#include "cluon/ProtoConstants.hpp"
6897//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
6898//#include "cluon/any/any.hpp"
6899
6900#include <cstdint>
6901#include <cstddef>
6902#include <array>
6903#include <sstream>
6904#include <string>
6905#include <unordered_map>
6906#include <vector>
6907
6908namespace cluon {
6912class LIBCLUON_API FromProtoVisitor {
6913 private:
6914 FromProtoVisitor(const FromProtoVisitor &) = delete;
6915 FromProtoVisitor(FromProtoVisitor &&) = delete;
6916 FromProtoVisitor &operator=(FromProtoVisitor &&) = delete;
6917
6918 public:
6919 FromProtoVisitor() = default;
6920 ~FromProtoVisitor() = default;
6921
6922 public:
6923 FromProtoVisitor &operator=(const FromProtoVisitor &other) noexcept;
6924
6930 void decodeFrom(std::istream &in) noexcept;
6931
6932 public:
6933 // The following methods are provided to allow an instance of this class to
6934 // be used as visitor for an instance with the method signature void accept<T>(T&);
6935
6936 void preVisit(int32_t id, const std::string &shortName, const std::string &longName) noexcept;
6937 void postVisit() noexcept;
6938
6939 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, bool &v) noexcept;
6940 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, char &v) noexcept;
6941 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int8_t &v) noexcept;
6942 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint8_t &v) noexcept;
6943 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int16_t &v) noexcept;
6944 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint16_t &v) noexcept;
6945 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int32_t &v) noexcept;
6946 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint32_t &v) noexcept;
6947 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int64_t &v) noexcept;
6948 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint64_t &v) noexcept;
6949 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, float &v) noexcept;
6950 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, double &v) noexcept;
6951 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, std::string &v) noexcept;
6952
6953 template <typename T>
6954 void visit(uint32_t &id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &v) noexcept {
6955 (void)typeName;
6956 (void)name;
6957
6958 if (m_callToDecodeFromWithDirectVisit) {
6959 std::stringstream sstr{std::move(std::string(m_stringValue.data(), static_cast<std::size_t>(m_value)))};
6960 cluon::FromProtoVisitor nestedProtoDecoder;
6961 nestedProtoDecoder.decodeFrom(sstr, v);
6962 }
6963 else if (0 < m_mapOfKeyValues.count(id)) {
6964 try {
6965 std::stringstream sstr{linb::any_cast<std::string>(m_mapOfKeyValues[id])};
6966 cluon::FromProtoVisitor nestedProtoDecoder;
6967 nestedProtoDecoder.decodeFrom(sstr);
6968 v.accept(nestedProtoDecoder);
6969 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
6970 }
6971 }
6972 }
6973
6974 public:
6981 template<typename T>
6982 void decodeFrom(std::istream &in, T &v) noexcept {
6983 m_callToDecodeFromWithDirectVisit = true;
6984 while (in.good()) {
6985 // First stage: Read keyFieldType (encoded as VarInt).
6986 if (0 < fromVarInt(in, m_keyFieldType)) {
6987 // Succeeded to read keyFieldType entry; extract information.
6988 m_protoType = static_cast<ProtoConstants>(m_keyFieldType & 0x7);
6989 m_fieldId = static_cast<uint32_t>(m_keyFieldType >> 3);
6990 switch (m_protoType) {
6991 case ProtoConstants::VARINT:
6992 {
6993 // Directly decode VarInt value.
6994 fromVarInt(in, m_value);
6995 v.accept(m_fieldId, *this);
6996 }
6997 break;
6998 case ProtoConstants::EIGHT_BYTES:
6999 {
7000 readBytesFromStream(in, sizeof(double), m_doubleValue.buffer.data());
7001 m_doubleValue.uint64Value = le64toh(m_doubleValue.uint64Value);
7002 v.accept(m_fieldId, *this);
7003 }
7004 break;
7005 case ProtoConstants::FOUR_BYTES:
7006 {
7007 readBytesFromStream(in, sizeof(float), m_floatValue.buffer.data());
7008 m_floatValue.uint32Value = le32toh(m_floatValue.uint32Value);
7009 v.accept(m_fieldId, *this);
7010 }
7011 break;
7012 case ProtoConstants::LENGTH_DELIMITED:
7013 {
7014 fromVarInt(in, m_value);
7015 const std::size_t BYTES_TO_READ_FROM_STREAM{static_cast<std::size_t>(m_value)};
7016 if (m_stringValue.capacity() < BYTES_TO_READ_FROM_STREAM) {
7017 m_stringValue.reserve(BYTES_TO_READ_FROM_STREAM);
7018 }
7019 readBytesFromStream(in, BYTES_TO_READ_FROM_STREAM, m_stringValue.data());
7020 v.accept(m_fieldId, *this);
7021 }
7022 break;
7023 }
7024 }
7025 }
7026 m_callToDecodeFromWithDirectVisit = false;
7027 }
7028
7029 private:
7030 int8_t fromZigZag8(uint8_t v) noexcept;
7031 int16_t fromZigZag16(uint16_t v) noexcept;
7032 int32_t fromZigZag32(uint32_t v) noexcept;
7033 int64_t fromZigZag64(uint64_t v) noexcept;
7034
7035 std::size_t fromVarInt(std::istream &in, uint64_t &value) noexcept;
7036
7037 void readBytesFromStream(std::istream &in, std::size_t bytesToReadFromStream, char *buffer) noexcept;
7038
7039 private:
7040 // This Boolean flag indicates whether we consecutively decode from istream
7041 // and inject the decoded values directly into the receiving data structure.
7042 bool m_callToDecodeFromWithDirectVisit{false};
7043 std::unordered_map<uint32_t, linb::any, UseUInt32ValueAsHashKey> m_mapOfKeyValues{};
7044
7045 private:
7046 // Fields necessary to decode from an istream.
7047 uint64_t m_value{0};
7048
7049 // Union buffer for double values.
7050 union DoubleValue {
7051 std::array<char, sizeof(double)> buffer;
7052 uint64_t uint64Value;
7053 double doubleValue{0};
7054 } m_doubleValue;
7055
7056 // Union buffer for float values.
7057 union FloatValue {
7058 std::array<char, sizeof(float)> buffer;
7059 uint32_t uint32Value;
7060 float floatValue{0};
7061 } m_floatValue;
7062
7063 // Buffer for strings.
7064 std::vector<char> m_stringValue;
7065
7066 uint64_t m_keyFieldType{0};
7067 ProtoConstants m_protoType{ProtoConstants::VARINT};
7068 uint32_t m_fieldId{0};
7069};
7070} // namespace cluon
7071
7072#endif
7073/*
7074 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
7075 *
7076 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
7077 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
7078 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
7079 */
7080
7081#ifndef CLUON_FROMLCMVISITOR_HPP
7082#define CLUON_FROMLCMVISITOR_HPP
7083
7084//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
7085
7086#include <cstdint>
7087#include <istream>
7088#include <sstream>
7089#include <string>
7090#include <vector>
7091
7092namespace cluon {
7096class LIBCLUON_API FromLCMVisitor {
7097 private:
7098 FromLCMVisitor(std::stringstream &in) noexcept;
7099 FromLCMVisitor(const FromLCMVisitor &) = delete;
7100 FromLCMVisitor(FromLCMVisitor &&) = delete;
7101 FromLCMVisitor &operator=(const FromLCMVisitor &) = delete;
7102 FromLCMVisitor &operator=(FromLCMVisitor &&) = delete;
7103
7104 public:
7105 FromLCMVisitor() noexcept;
7106 ~FromLCMVisitor() = default;
7107
7108 public:
7114 void decodeFrom(std::istream &in) noexcept;
7115
7116 public:
7117 // The following methods are provided to allow an instance of this class to
7118 // be used as visitor for an instance with the method signature void accept<T>(T&);
7119
7120 void preVisit(int32_t id, const std::string &shortName, const std::string &longName) noexcept;
7121 void postVisit() noexcept;
7122
7123 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, bool &v) noexcept;
7124 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, char &v) noexcept;
7125 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int8_t &v) noexcept;
7126 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint8_t &v) noexcept;
7127 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int16_t &v) noexcept;
7128 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint16_t &v) noexcept;
7129 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int32_t &v) noexcept;
7130 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint32_t &v) noexcept;
7131 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int64_t &v) noexcept;
7132 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint64_t &v) noexcept;
7133 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, float &v) noexcept;
7134 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, double &v) noexcept;
7135 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, std::string &v) noexcept;
7136
7137 template <typename T>
7138 void visit(uint32_t &id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value) noexcept {
7139 (void)id;
7140 (void)typeName;
7141 // No hash for the type but for name and dimension.
7142 calculateHash(name);
7143 calculateHash(0);
7144
7145 cluon::FromLCMVisitor nestedLCMDecoder(m_buffer);
7146 value.accept(nestedLCMDecoder);
7147
7148 m_hashes.push_back(nestedLCMDecoder.hash());
7149 }
7150
7151 private:
7152 int64_t hash() const noexcept;
7153 void calculateHash(char c) noexcept;
7154 void calculateHash(const std::string &s) noexcept;
7155
7156 private:
7157 int64_t m_calculatedHash{0x12345678};
7158 int64_t m_expectedHash{0};
7159 std::stringstream m_internalBuffer{""};
7160 std::stringstream &m_buffer;
7161 std::vector<int64_t> m_hashes{};
7162};
7163} // namespace cluon
7164
7165#endif
7166/*
7167 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
7168 *
7169 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
7170 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
7171 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
7172 */
7173
7174#ifndef CLUON_MSGPACKCONSTANTS_HPP
7175#define CLUON_MSGPACKCONSTANTS_HPP
7176
7177#include <cstdint>
7178
7179// clang-format off
7180namespace cluon {
7181 enum class MsgPackConstants : uint16_t {
7182 IS_FALSE = 0xC2,
7183 IS_TRUE = 0xC3,
7184 FLOAT = 0xCA,
7185 DOUBLE = 0xCB,
7186 UINT8 = 0xCC,
7187 UINT16 = 0xCD,
7188 UINT32 = 0xCE,
7189 UINT64 = 0xCF,
7190 NEGFIXINT = 0xE0,
7191 INT8 = 0xD0,
7192 INT16 = 0xD1,
7193 INT32 = 0xD2,
7194 INT64 = 0xD3,
7195 FIXSTR = 0xA0,
7196 FIXSTR_END = 0xBF,
7197 STR8 = 0xD9,
7198 STR16 = 0xDA,
7199 STR32 = 0xDB,
7200 FIXMAP = 0x80,
7201 FIXMAP_END = 0x8F,
7202 MAP16 = 0xDE,
7203 MAP32 = 0xDF,
7204 UNKNOWN_FORMAT = 0xFF00,
7205 BOOL_FORMAT = 0xFF01,
7206 UINT_FORMAT = 0xFF02,
7207 INT_FORMAT = 0xFF03,
7208 FLOAT_FORMAT = 0xFF04,
7209 STR_FORMAT = 0xFF05,
7210 MAP_FORMAT = 0xFF06, // Indicating also nested types.
7211 };
7212}
7213// clang-format on
7214
7215#endif
7216/*
7217 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
7218 *
7219 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
7220 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
7221 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
7222 */
7223
7224#ifndef CLUON_FROMMSGPACKVISITOR_HPP
7225#define CLUON_FROMMSGPACKVISITOR_HPP
7226
7227//#include "cluon/MsgPackConstants.hpp"
7228//#include "cluon/any/any.hpp"
7229//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
7230
7231#include <cstdint>
7232#include <istream>
7233#include <map>
7234#include <string>
7235
7236namespace cluon {
7240class LIBCLUON_API FromMsgPackVisitor {
7244 class MsgPackKeyValue {
7245 private:
7246 MsgPackKeyValue &operator=(MsgPackKeyValue &&) = delete;
7247
7248 public:
7249 MsgPackKeyValue() = default;
7250 MsgPackKeyValue(const MsgPackKeyValue &) = default;
7251 MsgPackKeyValue(MsgPackKeyValue &&) = default;
7252 MsgPackKeyValue &operator=(const MsgPackKeyValue &) = default;
7253 ~MsgPackKeyValue() = default;
7254
7255 public:
7256 std::string m_key{""};
7257 MsgPackConstants m_formatFamily{MsgPackConstants::BOOL_FORMAT};
7258 linb::any m_value;
7259 };
7260
7261 private:
7262 FromMsgPackVisitor(const FromMsgPackVisitor &) = delete;
7263 FromMsgPackVisitor(FromMsgPackVisitor &&) = delete;
7264 FromMsgPackVisitor &operator=(FromMsgPackVisitor &&) = delete;
7265 FromMsgPackVisitor &operator=(const FromMsgPackVisitor &other) = delete;
7266
7272 FromMsgPackVisitor(std::map<std::string, FromMsgPackVisitor::MsgPackKeyValue> &preset) noexcept;
7273
7274 public:
7275 FromMsgPackVisitor() noexcept;
7276 ~FromMsgPackVisitor() = default;
7277
7278 public:
7284 void decodeFrom(std::istream &in) noexcept;
7285
7286 public:
7287 // The following methods are provided to allow an instance of this class to
7288 // be used as visitor for an instance with the method signature void accept<T>(T&);
7289
7290 void preVisit(int32_t id, const std::string &shortName, const std::string &longName) noexcept;
7291 void postVisit() noexcept;
7292
7293 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, bool &v) noexcept;
7294 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, char &v) noexcept;
7295 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int8_t &v) noexcept;
7296 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint8_t &v) noexcept;
7297 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int16_t &v) noexcept;
7298 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint16_t &v) noexcept;
7299 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int32_t &v) noexcept;
7300 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint32_t &v) noexcept;
7301 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int64_t &v) noexcept;
7302 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint64_t &v) noexcept;
7303 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, float &v) noexcept;
7304 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, double &v) noexcept;
7305 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, std::string &v) noexcept;
7306
7307 template <typename T>
7308 void visit(uint32_t &id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value) noexcept {
7309 (void)id;
7310 (void)typeName;
7311
7312 if (0 < m_keyValues.count(name)) {
7313 try {
7314 std::map<std::string, FromMsgPackVisitor::MsgPackKeyValue> v
7315 = linb::any_cast<std::map<std::string, FromMsgPackVisitor::MsgPackKeyValue>>(m_keyValues[name].m_value);
7316 cluon::FromMsgPackVisitor nestedMsgPackDecoder(v);
7317 value.accept(nestedMsgPackDecoder);
7318 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
7319 }
7320 }
7321 }
7322
7323 private:
7324 MsgPackConstants getFormatFamily(uint8_t T) noexcept;
7325 std::map<std::string, FromMsgPackVisitor::MsgPackKeyValue> readKeyValues(std::istream &in) noexcept;
7326 uint64_t readUint(std::istream &in) noexcept;
7327 int64_t readInt(std::istream &in) noexcept;
7328 std::string readString(std::istream &in) noexcept;
7329
7330 private:
7331 std::map<std::string, FromMsgPackVisitor::MsgPackKeyValue> m_data{};
7332 std::map<std::string, FromMsgPackVisitor::MsgPackKeyValue> &m_keyValues;
7333};
7334} // namespace cluon
7335
7336#endif
7337/*
7338 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
7339 *
7340 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
7341 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
7342 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
7343 */
7344
7345#ifndef CLUON_JSONCONSTANTS_HPP
7346#define CLUON_JSONCONSTANTS_HPP
7347
7348#include <cstdint>
7349
7350// clang-format off
7351namespace cluon {
7352 enum class JSONConstants : uint16_t {
7353 IS_FALSE = 0,
7354 IS_TRUE = 1,
7355 NUMBER = 2,
7356 STRING = 3,
7357 OBJECT = 4, // Indicating nested types.
7358 UNDEFINED = 99,
7359 };
7360}
7361// clang-format on
7362
7363#endif
7364/*
7365 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
7366 *
7367 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
7368 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
7369 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
7370 */
7371
7372#ifndef CLUON_FROMJSONVISITOR_HPP
7373#define CLUON_FROMJSONVISITOR_HPP
7374
7375//#include "cluon/JSONConstants.hpp"
7376//#include "cluon/any/any.hpp"
7377//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
7378
7379#include <cstdint>
7380#include <istream>
7381#include <map>
7382#include <string>
7383
7384namespace cluon {
7388class LIBCLUON_API FromJSONVisitor {
7392 class JSONKeyValue {
7393 private:
7394 JSONKeyValue &operator=(JSONKeyValue &&) = delete;
7395
7396 public:
7397 JSONKeyValue() = default;
7398 JSONKeyValue(const JSONKeyValue &) = default;
7399 JSONKeyValue(JSONKeyValue &&) = default;
7400 JSONKeyValue &operator=(const JSONKeyValue &) = default;
7401 ~JSONKeyValue() = default;
7402
7403 public:
7404 std::string m_key{""};
7405 JSONConstants m_type{JSONConstants::UNDEFINED};
7406 linb::any m_value;
7407 };
7408
7409 private:
7410 FromJSONVisitor(const FromJSONVisitor &) = delete;
7411 FromJSONVisitor(FromJSONVisitor &&) = delete;
7412 FromJSONVisitor &operator=(FromJSONVisitor &&) = delete;
7413 FromJSONVisitor &operator=(const FromJSONVisitor &other) = delete;
7414
7420 FromJSONVisitor(std::map<std::string, FromJSONVisitor::JSONKeyValue> &preset) noexcept;
7421
7422 public:
7423 FromJSONVisitor() noexcept;
7424 ~FromJSONVisitor() = default;
7425
7426 public:
7432 void decodeFrom(std::istream &in) noexcept;
7433
7434 public:
7435 // The following methods are provided to allow an instance of this class to
7436 // be used as visitor for an instance with the method signature void accept<T>(T&);
7437
7438 void preVisit(int32_t id, const std::string &shortName, const std::string &longName) noexcept;
7439 void postVisit() noexcept;
7440
7441 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, bool &v) noexcept;
7442 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, char &v) noexcept;
7443 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int8_t &v) noexcept;
7444 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint8_t &v) noexcept;
7445 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int16_t &v) noexcept;
7446 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint16_t &v) noexcept;
7447 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int32_t &v) noexcept;
7448 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint32_t &v) noexcept;
7449 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int64_t &v) noexcept;
7450 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint64_t &v) noexcept;
7451 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, float &v) noexcept;
7452 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, double &v) noexcept;
7453 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, std::string &v) noexcept;
7454
7455 template <typename T>
7456 void visit(uint32_t &id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value) noexcept {
7457 (void)id;
7458 (void)typeName;
7459
7460 if (0 < m_keyValues.count(name)) {
7461 try {
7462 std::map<std::string, FromJSONVisitor::JSONKeyValue> v
7463 = linb::any_cast<std::map<std::string, FromJSONVisitor::JSONKeyValue>>(m_keyValues[name].m_value);
7464 cluon::FromJSONVisitor nestedJSONDecoder(v);
7465 value.accept(nestedJSONDecoder);
7466 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
7467 }
7468 }
7469 }
7470
7471 public:
7478 static std::string decodeBase64(const std::string &input) noexcept;
7479
7480 private:
7481 std::map<std::string, FromJSONVisitor::JSONKeyValue> readKeyValues(std::string &input) noexcept;
7482
7483 private:
7484 std::map<std::string, FromJSONVisitor::JSONKeyValue> m_data{};
7485 std::map<std::string, FromJSONVisitor::JSONKeyValue> &m_keyValues;
7486};
7487} // namespace cluon
7488
7489#endif
7490/*
7491 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
7492 *
7493 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
7494 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
7495 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
7496 */
7497
7498#ifndef CLUON_TOJSONVISITOR_HPP
7499#define CLUON_TOJSONVISITOR_HPP
7500
7501//#include "cluon/any/any.hpp"
7502//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
7503
7504#include <cstdint>
7505#include <map>
7506#include <sstream>
7507#include <string>
7508
7509namespace cluon {
7523class LIBCLUON_API ToJSONVisitor {
7524 private:
7525 ToJSONVisitor(const ToJSONVisitor &) = delete;
7526 ToJSONVisitor(ToJSONVisitor &&) = delete;
7527 ToJSONVisitor &operator=(const ToJSONVisitor &) = delete;
7528 ToJSONVisitor &operator=(ToJSONVisitor &&) = delete;
7529
7530 public:
7539 ToJSONVisitor(bool withOuterCurlyBraces = true, const std::map<uint32_t, bool> &mask = {}) noexcept;
7540
7544 std::string json() const noexcept;
7545
7546 public:
7547 // The following methods are provided to allow an instance of this class to
7548 // be used as visitor for an instance with the method signature void accept<T>(T&);
7549
7550 void preVisit(int32_t id, const std::string &shortName, const std::string &longName) noexcept;
7551 void postVisit() noexcept;
7552
7553 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, bool &v) noexcept;
7554 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, char &v) noexcept;
7555 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int8_t &v) noexcept;
7556 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint8_t &v) noexcept;
7557 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int16_t &v) noexcept;
7558 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint16_t &v) noexcept;
7559 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int32_t &v) noexcept;
7560 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint32_t &v) noexcept;
7561 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int64_t &v) noexcept;
7562 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint64_t &v) noexcept;
7563 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, float &v) noexcept;
7564 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, double &v) noexcept;
7565 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, std::string &v) noexcept;
7566
7567 template <typename T>
7568 void visit(uint32_t &id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value) noexcept {
7569 (void)typeName;
7570 if ((0 == m_mask.count(id)) || m_mask[id]) {
7571 try {
7572 ToJSONVisitor jsonVisitor;
7573 value.accept(jsonVisitor);
7574 m_buffer << '\"' << name << '\"' << ':' << jsonVisitor.json() << ',' << '\n';
7575 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
7576 }
7577 }
7578 }
7579
7580 public:
7587 static std::string encodeBase64(const std::string &input) noexcept;
7588
7589 private:
7590 bool m_withOuterCurlyBraces{true};
7591 std::map<uint32_t, bool> m_mask;
7592 std::stringstream m_buffer{};
7593};
7594
7595} // namespace cluon
7596#endif
7597/*
7598 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
7599 *
7600 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
7601 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
7602 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
7603 */
7604
7605#ifndef CLUON_TOCSVVISITOR_HPP
7606#define CLUON_TOCSVVISITOR_HPP
7607
7608//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
7609
7610#include <cstdint>
7611#include <map>
7612#include <sstream>
7613#include <string>
7614
7615namespace cluon {
7634class LIBCLUON_API ToCSVVisitor {
7635 private:
7636 ToCSVVisitor(const ToCSVVisitor &) = delete;
7637 ToCSVVisitor(ToCSVVisitor &&) = delete;
7638 ToCSVVisitor &operator=(const ToCSVVisitor &) = delete;
7639 ToCSVVisitor &operator=(ToCSVVisitor &&) = delete;
7640
7641 public:
7652 ToCSVVisitor(char delimiter = ';', bool withHeader = true, const std::map<uint32_t, bool> &mask = {}) noexcept;
7653
7654 protected:
7664 ToCSVVisitor(const std::string &prefix, char delimiter, bool withHeader, bool isNested) noexcept;
7665
7666 public:
7670 std::string csv() const noexcept;
7671
7675 void clear() noexcept;
7676
7677 public:
7678 // The following methods are provided to allow an instance of this class to
7679 // be used as visitor for an instance with the method signature void accept<T>(T&);
7680
7681 void preVisit(int32_t id, const std::string &shortName, const std::string &longName) noexcept;
7682 void postVisit() noexcept;
7683
7684 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, bool &v) noexcept;
7685 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, char &v) noexcept;
7686 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int8_t &v) noexcept;
7687 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint8_t &v) noexcept;
7688 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int16_t &v) noexcept;
7689 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint16_t &v) noexcept;
7690 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int32_t &v) noexcept;
7691 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint32_t &v) noexcept;
7692 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int64_t &v) noexcept;
7693 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint64_t &v) noexcept;
7694 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, float &v) noexcept;
7695 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, double &v) noexcept;
7696 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, std::string &v) noexcept;
7697
7698 template <typename T>
7699 void visit(uint32_t &id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value) noexcept {
7700 (void)id;
7701 (void)typeName;
7702 constexpr bool IS_NESTED{true};
7703 ToCSVVisitor csvVisitor(name, m_delimiter, m_withHeader, IS_NESTED);
7704 value.accept(csvVisitor);
7705
7706 if (m_fillHeader) {
7707 m_bufferHeader << csvVisitor.m_bufferHeader.str();
7708 }
7709 m_bufferValues << csvVisitor.m_bufferValues.str();
7710 }
7711
7712 private:
7713 std::map<uint32_t, bool> m_mask{};
7714 std::string m_prefix{};
7715 char m_delimiter{';'};
7716 bool m_withHeader{true};
7717 bool m_isNested{false};
7718 bool m_fillHeader{true};
7719 std::stringstream m_bufferHeader{};
7720 std::stringstream m_bufferValues{};
7721};
7722
7723} // namespace cluon
7724#endif
7725/*
7726 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
7727 *
7728 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
7729 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
7730 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
7731 */
7732
7733#ifndef CLUON_TOLCMVISITOR_HPP
7734#define CLUON_TOLCMVISITOR_HPP
7735
7736//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
7737
7738#include <cstdint>
7739#include <sstream>
7740#include <string>
7741#include <vector>
7742
7743namespace cluon {
7747class LIBCLUON_API ToLCMVisitor {
7748 private:
7749 ToLCMVisitor(const ToLCMVisitor &) = delete;
7750 ToLCMVisitor(ToLCMVisitor &&) = delete;
7751 ToLCMVisitor &operator=(const ToLCMVisitor &) = delete;
7752 ToLCMVisitor &operator=(ToLCMVisitor &&) = delete;
7753
7754 public:
7755 ToLCMVisitor() = default;
7756 ~ToLCMVisitor() = default;
7757
7762 std::string encodedData(bool withHash = true) const noexcept;
7763
7764 public:
7765 // The following methods are provided to allow an instance of this class to
7766 // be used as visitor for an instance with the method signature void accept<T>(T&);
7767
7768 void preVisit(int32_t id, const std::string &shortName, const std::string &longName) noexcept;
7769 void postVisit() noexcept;
7770
7771 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, bool &v) noexcept;
7772 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, char &v) noexcept;
7773 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int8_t &v) noexcept;
7774 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint8_t &v) noexcept;
7775 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int16_t &v) noexcept;
7776 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint16_t &v) noexcept;
7777 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int32_t &v) noexcept;
7778 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint32_t &v) noexcept;
7779 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int64_t &v) noexcept;
7780 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint64_t &v) noexcept;
7781 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, float &v) noexcept;
7782 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, double &v) noexcept;
7783 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, std::string &v) noexcept;
7784
7785 template <typename T>
7786 void visit(uint32_t &id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value) noexcept {
7787 (void)id;
7788 (void)typeName;
7789 calculateHash(name);
7790 calculateHash(0);
7791
7792 // No hash for the type but for name and dimension.
7793 cluon::ToLCMVisitor nestedLCMEncoder;
7794 value.accept(nestedLCMEncoder);
7795
7796 constexpr bool WITH_HASH{false};
7797 const std::string s = nestedLCMEncoder.encodedData(WITH_HASH);
7798 m_buffer.write(s.c_str(), static_cast<std::streamsize>(s.size()));
7799
7800 // Save this complex field's hash for later to compute final hash.
7801 m_hashes.push_back(nestedLCMEncoder.hash());
7802 }
7803
7804 private:
7805 int64_t hash() const noexcept;
7806 void calculateHash(char c) noexcept;
7807 void calculateHash(const std::string &s) noexcept;
7808
7809 private:
7810 int64_t m_hash{0x12345678};
7811 std::stringstream m_buffer{""};
7812 std::vector<int64_t> m_hashes{};
7813};
7814} // namespace cluon
7815
7816#endif
7817/*
7818 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
7819 *
7820 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
7821 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
7822 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
7823 */
7824
7825#ifndef CLUON_TOODVDVISITOR_HPP
7826#define CLUON_TOODVDVISITOR_HPP
7827
7828//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
7829
7830#include <cstdint>
7831#include <regex>
7832#include <sstream>
7833#include <string>
7834#include <vector>
7835
7836namespace cluon {
7856class LIBCLUON_API ToODVDVisitor {
7857 private:
7858 ToODVDVisitor(const ToODVDVisitor &) = delete;
7859 ToODVDVisitor(ToODVDVisitor &&) = delete;
7860 ToODVDVisitor &operator=(const ToODVDVisitor &) = delete;
7861 ToODVDVisitor &operator=(ToODVDVisitor &&) = delete;
7862
7863 public:
7864 ToODVDVisitor() = default;
7865
7869 std::string messageSpecification() const noexcept;
7870
7871 public:
7872 // The following methods are provided to allow an instance of this class to
7873 // be used as visitor for an instance with the method signature void accept<T>(T&);
7874
7875 void preVisit(int32_t id, const std::string &shortName, const std::string &longName) noexcept;
7876 void postVisit() noexcept;
7877
7878 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, bool &v) noexcept;
7879 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, char &v) noexcept;
7880 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int8_t &v) noexcept;
7881 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint8_t &v) noexcept;
7882 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int16_t &v) noexcept;
7883 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint16_t &v) noexcept;
7884 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int32_t &v) noexcept;
7885 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint32_t &v) noexcept;
7886 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int64_t &v) noexcept;
7887 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint64_t &v) noexcept;
7888 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, float &v) noexcept;
7889 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, double &v) noexcept;
7890 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, std::string &v) noexcept;
7891
7892 template <typename T>
7893 void visit(uint32_t &id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value) noexcept {
7894 try {
7895 std::string tmp{std::regex_replace(typeName, std::regex("::"), ".")}; // NOLINT
7896
7897 ToODVDVisitor odvdVisitor;
7898 value.accept(odvdVisitor);
7899 m_forwardDeclarations.emplace(m_forwardDeclarations.begin(), odvdVisitor.messageSpecification());
7900
7901 m_buffer << " " << tmp << ' ' << name << " [ id = " << id << " ];" << '\n';
7902 } catch (std::regex_error &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
7903 }
7904 }
7905
7906 private:
7907 std::vector<std::string> m_forwardDeclarations{};
7908 std::stringstream m_buffer{};
7909};
7910
7911} // namespace cluon
7912#endif
7913/*
7914 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
7915 *
7916 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
7917 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
7918 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
7919 */
7920
7921#ifndef CLUON_TOMSGPACKVISITOR_HPP
7922#define CLUON_TOMSGPACKVISITOR_HPP
7923
7924//#include "cluon/MsgPackConstants.hpp"
7925//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
7926
7927#include <cstdint>
7928#include <sstream>
7929#include <string>
7930
7931namespace cluon {
7935class LIBCLUON_API ToMsgPackVisitor {
7936 private:
7937 ToMsgPackVisitor(const ToMsgPackVisitor &) = delete;
7938 ToMsgPackVisitor(ToMsgPackVisitor &&) = delete;
7939 ToMsgPackVisitor &operator=(const ToMsgPackVisitor &) = delete;
7940 ToMsgPackVisitor &operator=(ToMsgPackVisitor &&) = delete;
7941
7942 public:
7943 ToMsgPackVisitor() = default;
7944 ~ToMsgPackVisitor() = default;
7945
7949 std::string encodedData() const noexcept;
7950
7951 public:
7952 // The following methods are provided to allow an instance of this class to
7953 // be used as visitor for an instance with the method signature void accept<T>(T&);
7954
7955 void preVisit(int32_t id, const std::string &shortName, const std::string &longName) noexcept;
7956 void postVisit() noexcept;
7957
7958 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, bool &v) noexcept;
7959 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, char &v) noexcept;
7960 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int8_t &v) noexcept;
7961 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint8_t &v) noexcept;
7962 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int16_t &v) noexcept;
7963 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint16_t &v) noexcept;
7964 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int32_t &v) noexcept;
7965 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint32_t &v) noexcept;
7966 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int64_t &v) noexcept;
7967 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint64_t &v) noexcept;
7968 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, float &v) noexcept;
7969 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, double &v) noexcept;
7970 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, std::string &v) noexcept;
7971
7972 template <typename T>
7973 void visit(uint32_t &id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value) noexcept {
7974 (void)id;
7975 (void)typeName;
7976
7977 encode(m_buffer, name);
7978 {
7979 cluon::ToMsgPackVisitor nestedMsgPackEncoder;
7980 value.accept(nestedMsgPackEncoder);
7981 const std::string tmp{nestedMsgPackEncoder.encodedData()};
7982 const uint32_t LENGTH{static_cast<uint32_t>(tmp.size())};
7983 m_buffer.write(tmp.c_str(), static_cast<std::streamsize>(LENGTH));
7984 }
7985 m_numberOfFields++;
7986 }
7987
7988 private:
7989 void encode(std::ostream &o, const std::string &s);
7990 void encodeUint(std::ostream &o, uint64_t v);
7991 void encodeInt(std::ostream &o, int64_t v);
7992
7993 private:
7994 uint32_t m_numberOfFields{0};
7995 std::stringstream m_buffer{""};
7996};
7997} // namespace cluon
7998
7999#endif
8000/*
8001 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
8002 *
8003 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
8004 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
8005 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
8006 */
8007
8008#ifndef CLUON_ENVELOPE_HPP
8009#define CLUON_ENVELOPE_HPP
8010
8011//#include "cluon/FromProtoVisitor.hpp"
8012//#include "cluon/ToProtoVisitor.hpp"
8013//#include "cluon/cluonDataStructures.hpp"
8014
8015#include <cstring>
8016#include <istream>
8017#include <sstream>
8018#include <string>
8019#include <utility>
8020#include <vector>
8021
8022namespace cluon {
8023
8031inline std::string serializeEnvelope(cluon::data::Envelope &&envelope) noexcept {
8032 std::string dataToSend;
8033 {
8034 std::stringstream sstr;
8035
8036 cluon::ToProtoVisitor protoEncoder;
8037 envelope.accept(protoEncoder);
8038
8039 const std::string tmp{protoEncoder.encodedData()};
8040 uint32_t length{static_cast<uint32_t>(tmp.size())};
8041 length <<= 8;
8042 length = htole32(length);
8043
8044 // Add OD4 header.
8045 constexpr unsigned char OD4_HEADER_BYTE0 = 0x0D;
8046 constexpr unsigned char OD4_HEADER_BYTE1 = 0xA4;
8047 sstr.put(static_cast<char>(OD4_HEADER_BYTE0));
8048 auto posByte1 = sstr.tellp();
8049 sstr.write(reinterpret_cast<char *>(&length), static_cast<std::streamsize>(sizeof(uint32_t)));
8050 auto posByte5 = sstr.tellp();
8051 sstr.seekp(posByte1);
8052 sstr.put(static_cast<char>(OD4_HEADER_BYTE1));
8053 sstr.seekp(posByte5);
8054
8055 // Write payload.
8056 sstr.write(tmp.data(), static_cast<std::streamsize>(tmp.size()));
8057
8058 dataToSend = sstr.str();
8059 }
8060 return dataToSend;
8061}
8062
8074inline std::pair<bool, cluon::data::Envelope> extractEnvelope(std::istream &in) noexcept {
8075 bool retVal{false};
8076 cluon::data::Envelope env;
8077 if (in.good()) {
8078 constexpr uint8_t OD4_HEADER_SIZE{5};
8079 std::vector<char> buffer;
8080 buffer.reserve(OD4_HEADER_SIZE);
8081#ifdef WIN32 // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8082 buffer.clear(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8083 retVal = true; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8084 for (uint8_t i{0}; i < OD4_HEADER_SIZE; i++) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8085 char c; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8086 in.get(c); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8087 retVal &= in.good(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8088 buffer.push_back(c); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8089 }
8090 if (retVal) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8091#else // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8092 in.read(&buffer[0], OD4_HEADER_SIZE);
8093 if (OD4_HEADER_SIZE == in.gcount()) {
8094#endif
8095 if ((0x0D == static_cast<uint8_t>(buffer[0])) && (0xA4 == static_cast<uint8_t>(buffer[1]))) {
8096 const uint32_t LENGTH{le32toh(*reinterpret_cast<uint32_t *>(&buffer[1])) >> 8};
8097 buffer.reserve(LENGTH);
8098#ifdef WIN32 // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8099 buffer.clear(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8100 for (uint32_t i{0}; i < LENGTH; i++) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8101 char c; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8102 in.get(c); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8103 retVal &= in.good(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8104 buffer.push_back(c); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8105 }
8106#else // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8107 in.read(&buffer[0], static_cast<std::streamsize>(LENGTH));
8108 retVal = static_cast<int32_t>(LENGTH) == in.gcount();
8109#endif
8110 if (retVal) {
8111 std::stringstream sstr(std::string(buffer.begin(), buffer.begin() + static_cast<std::streamsize>(LENGTH)));
8112 cluon::FromProtoVisitor protoDecoder;
8113 protoDecoder.decodeFrom(sstr, env);
8114 }
8115 }
8116 }
8117 }
8118 return std::make_pair(retVal, env);
8119}
8120
8124template <typename T>
8125inline T extractMessage(cluon::data::Envelope &&envelope) noexcept {
8126 cluon::FromProtoVisitor decoder;
8127
8128 std::stringstream sstr(envelope.serializedData());
8129 decoder.decodeFrom(sstr);
8130
8131 T msg;
8132 msg.accept(decoder);
8133
8134 return msg;
8135}
8136
8137} // namespace cluon
8138
8139#endif

8144 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
8145 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
8146 */

8149#define CLUON_ENVELOPECONVERTER_HPP

8164class LIBCLUON_API EnvelopeConverter {
8165 private:
8166 EnvelopeConverter(const EnvelopeConverter &) = delete;
8167 EnvelopeConverter(EnvelopeConverter &&) = delete;
8168 EnvelopeConverter &operator=(const EnvelopeConverter &) = delete;
8169 EnvelopeConverter &operator=(EnvelopeConverter &&) = delete;
8170
8171 public:
8172 EnvelopeConverter() = default;
8173
8182 int32_t setMessageSpecification(const std::string &ms) noexcept;
8183
8192 std::string getJSONFromProtoEncodedEnvelope(const std::string &protoEncodedEnvelope) noexcept;
8193
8200 std::string getJSONFromEnvelope(cluon::data::Envelope &envelope) noexcept;
8201
8212 std::string getProtoEncodedEnvelopeFromJSONWithoutTimeStamps(const std::string &json, int32_t messageIdentifier, uint32_t senderStamp) noexcept;
8213
8224 std::string getProtoEncodedEnvelopeFromJSON(const std::string &json, int32_t messageIdentifier, uint32_t senderStamp) noexcept;
8225
8226 private:
8227// clang-format off
8228 std::string getProtoEncodedEnvelopeFromJSON(const std::string &json, int32_t messageIdentifier, uint32_t senderStamp, cluon::data::TimeStamp sampleTimeStamp) noexcept;
8229// clang-format on
8230
8231 private:
8232 std::vector<cluon::MetaMessage> m_listOfMetaMessages{};
8233 std::map<int32_t, cluon::MetaMessage> m_scopeOfMetaMessages{};
8234};
8235} // namespace cluon
8236#endif
