8245#ifndef CLUON_GENERICMESSAGE_HPP
8246#define CLUON_GENERICMESSAGE_HPP
8247
8248//#include "cluon/FromProtoVisitor.hpp"
8249//#include "cluon/MetaMessage.hpp"
8250//#include "cluon/any/any.hpp"
8251//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
8252//#include "cluon/cluonDataStructures.hpp"
8253
8254#include <cstdint>
8255#include <string>
8256#include <unordered_map>
8257#include <vector>
8258
8259namespace cluon {
8406class LIBCLUON_API GenericMessage {
8407 private:
8408 class GenericMessageVisitor {
8409 private:
8410 GenericMessageVisitor(const GenericMessageVisitor &) = delete;
8411 GenericMessageVisitor(GenericMessageVisitor &&) = delete;
8412 GenericMessageVisitor &operator=(const GenericMessageVisitor &) = delete;
8413 GenericMessageVisitor &operator=(GenericMessageVisitor &&) = delete;
8414
8415 public:
8416 GenericMessageVisitor() = default;
8417
8418 public:
8419 // The following methods are provided to allow an instance of this class to
8420 // be used as visitor for an instance with the method signature void accept<T>(T&);
8421 void preVisit(int32_t id, const std::string &shortName, const std::string &longName) noexcept;
8422 void postVisit() noexcept;
8423
8424 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, bool &v) noexcept;
8425 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, char &v) noexcept;
8426 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int8_t &v) noexcept;
8427 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint8_t &v) noexcept;
8428 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int16_t &v) noexcept;
8429 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint16_t &v) noexcept;
8430 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int32_t &v) noexcept;
8431 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint32_t &v) noexcept;
8432 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int64_t &v) noexcept;
8433 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint64_t &v) noexcept;
8434 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, float &v) noexcept;
8435 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, double &v) noexcept;
8436 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, std::string &v) noexcept;
8437
8438 template <typename T>
8439 void visit(uint32_t &id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value) noexcept {
8440 cluon::MetaMessage::MetaField mf;
8441 mf.fieldIdentifier(id).fieldDataType(cluon::MetaMessage::MetaField::MESSAGE_T).fieldDataTypeName(typeName).fieldName(name);
8442
8443 GenericMessage gm;
8444 gm.createFrom<T>(value);
8445
8446 m_intermediateDataRepresentation[mf.fieldIdentifier()] = linb::any{gm};
8447 m_metaMessage.add(std::move(mf));
8448 }
8449
8450 public:
8454 MetaMessage metaMessage() const noexcept;
8455
8459 std::unordered_map<uint32_t, linb::any, UseUInt32ValueAsHashKey> intermediateDataRepresentation() const noexcept;
8460
8461 private:
8462 MetaMessage m_metaMessage{};
8463 std::unordered_map<uint32_t, linb::any, UseUInt32ValueAsHashKey> m_intermediateDataRepresentation;
8464 };
8465
8466 private:
8467 GenericMessage &operator=(GenericMessage &&) = delete;
8468
8469 public:
8470 GenericMessage() = default;
8471 GenericMessage(GenericMessage &&) = default;
8472 GenericMessage(const GenericMessage &) = default;
8473 GenericMessage &operator=(const GenericMessage &) = default;
8474
8475 public:
8476 int32_t ID();
8477 const std::string ShortName();
8478 const std::string LongName();
8479
8480 public:
8486 template <typename T>
8487 void createFrom(T &msg) {
8488 GenericMessageVisitor gmv;
8489 msg.accept(gmv);
8490
8491 m_metaMessage = gmv.metaMessage();
8492 m_intermediateDataRepresentation.clear();
8493 m_intermediateDataRepresentation = gmv.intermediateDataRepresentation();
8494 }
8495
8503 void createFrom(const MetaMessage &mm, const std::vector<MetaMessage> &mms) noexcept;
8504
8505 public:
8506 // The following methods are provided to allow an instance of this class to
8507 // be used as visitor for an instance with the method signature void accept<T>(T&);
8508 void preVisit(int32_t id, const std::string &shortName, const std::string &longName) noexcept;
8509 void postVisit() noexcept;
8510
8511 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, bool &v) noexcept;
8512 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, char &v) noexcept;
8513 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int8_t &v) noexcept;
8514 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint8_t &v) noexcept;
8515 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int16_t &v) noexcept;
8516 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint16_t &v) noexcept;
8517 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int32_t &v) noexcept;
8518 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint32_t &v) noexcept;
8519 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, int64_t &v) noexcept;
8520 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, uint64_t &v) noexcept;
8521 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, float &v) noexcept;
8522 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, double &v) noexcept;
8523 void visit(uint32_t id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, std::string &v) noexcept;
8524
8525 template <typename T>
8526 void visit(uint32_t &id, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value) noexcept {
8527 (void)typeName;
8528 (void)name;
8529 if (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(id)) {
8530 try {
8531 auto &v = linb::any_cast<cluon::GenericMessage &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[id]);
8532 value.accept(v);
8533 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8534 }
8535 }
8536 }
8537
8538 public:
8546 template<class Visitor>
8547 inline void accept(uint32_t fieldId, Visitor &visitor) {
8548 const bool VISIT_ALL{false};
8549 accept<Visitor>(fieldId, visitor, VISIT_ALL);
8550 }
8551
8558 template <class Visitor>
8559 void accept(Visitor &visitor) {
8560 const uint32_t FIELD_ID{0};
8561 const bool VISIT_ALL{true};
8562 accept<Visitor>(FIELD_ID, visitor, VISIT_ALL);
8563 }
8564
8573 template <class PreVisitor, class Visitor, class PostVisitor>
8574 void accept(PreVisitor &&_preVisit, Visitor &&_visit, PostVisitor &&_postVisit) {
8575 std::forward<PreVisitor>(_preVisit)(m_metaMessage.messageIdentifier(), m_metaMessage.messageName(), m_longName);
8576
8577 for (const auto &f : m_metaMessage.listOfMetaFields()) {
8578 if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::BOOL_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8579 try {
8580 auto &v = linb::any_cast<bool &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8581 doTripletForwardVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, _preVisit, _visit, _postVisit);
8582 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8583 }
8584 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::CHAR_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8585 try {
8586 auto &v = linb::any_cast<char &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8587 doTripletForwardVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, _preVisit, _visit, _postVisit);
8588 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8589 }
8590 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT8_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8591 try {
8592 auto &v = linb::any_cast<uint8_t &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8593 doTripletForwardVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, _preVisit, _visit, _postVisit);
8594 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8595 }
8596 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::INT8_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8597 try {
8598 auto &v = linb::any_cast<int8_t &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8599 doTripletForwardVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, _preVisit, _visit, _postVisit);
8600 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8601 }
8602 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT16_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8603 try {
8604 auto &v = linb::any_cast<uint16_t &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8605 doTripletForwardVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, _preVisit, _visit, _postVisit);
8606 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8607 }
8608 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::INT16_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8609 try {
8610 auto &v = linb::any_cast<int16_t &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8611 doTripletForwardVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, _preVisit, _visit, _postVisit);
8612 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8613 }
8614 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT32_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8615 try {
8616 auto &v = linb::any_cast<uint32_t &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8617 doTripletForwardVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, _preVisit, _visit, _postVisit);
8618 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8619 }
8620 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::INT32_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8621 try {
8622 auto &v = linb::any_cast<int32_t &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8623 doTripletForwardVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, _preVisit, _visit, _postVisit);
8624 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8625 }
8626 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT64_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8627 try {
8628 auto &v = linb::any_cast<uint64_t &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8629 doTripletForwardVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, _preVisit, _visit, _postVisit);
8630 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8631 }
8632 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::INT64_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8633 try {
8634 auto &v = linb::any_cast<int64_t &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8635 doTripletForwardVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, _preVisit, _visit, _postVisit);
8636 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8637 }
8638 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::FLOAT_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8639 try {
8640 auto &v = linb::any_cast<float &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8641 doTripletForwardVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, _preVisit, _visit, _postVisit);
8642 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8643 }
8644 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::DOUBLE_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8645 try {
8646 auto &v = linb::any_cast<double &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8647 doTripletForwardVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, _preVisit, _visit, _postVisit);
8648 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8649 }
8650 } else if (((f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::STRING_T) || (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::BYTES_T))
8651 && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8652 try {
8653 auto &v = linb::any_cast<std::string &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8654 doTripletForwardVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, _preVisit, _visit, _postVisit);
8655 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8656 }
8657 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::MESSAGE_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8658 try {
8659 auto &v = linb::any_cast<cluon::GenericMessage &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8660 doTripletForwardVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, _preVisit, _visit, _postVisit);
8661 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8662 }
8663 }
8664 }
8665
8666 std::forward<PostVisitor>(_postVisit)();
8667 }
8668
8669 private:
8670 template<class Visitor>
8671 inline void accept(uint32_t fieldId, Visitor &visitor, bool visitAll) {
8672 visitor.preVisit(ID(), ShortName(), LongName());
8673
8674 for (const auto &f : m_metaMessage.listOfMetaFields()) {
8675 if (visitAll || (fieldId == f.fieldIdentifier())) {
8676 if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::BOOL_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8677 try {
8678 auto &v = linb::any_cast<bool &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8679 doVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, visitor);
8680 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8681 }
8682 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::CHAR_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8683 try {
8684 auto &v = linb::any_cast<char &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8685 doVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, visitor);
8686 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8687 }
8688 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT8_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8689 try {
8690 auto &v = linb::any_cast<uint8_t &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8691 doVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, visitor);
8692 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8693 }
8694 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::INT8_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8695 try {
8696 auto &v = linb::any_cast<int8_t &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8697 doVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, visitor);
8698 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8699 }
8700 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT16_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8701 try {
8702 auto &v = linb::any_cast<uint16_t &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8703 doVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, visitor);
8704 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8705 }
8706 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::INT16_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8707 try {
8708 auto &v = linb::any_cast<int16_t &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8709 doVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, visitor);
8710 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8711 }
8712 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT32_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8713 try {
8714 auto &v = linb::any_cast<uint32_t &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8715 doVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, visitor);
8716 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8717 }
8718 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::INT32_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8719 try {
8720 auto &v = linb::any_cast<int32_t &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8721 doVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, visitor);
8722 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8723 }
8724 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT64_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8725 try {
8726 auto &v = linb::any_cast<uint64_t &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8727 doVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, visitor);
8728 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8729 }
8730 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::INT64_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8731 try {
8732 auto &v = linb::any_cast<int64_t &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8733 doVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, visitor);
8734 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8735 }
8736 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::FLOAT_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8737 try {
8738 auto &v = linb::any_cast<float &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8739 doVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, visitor);
8740 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8741 }
8742 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::DOUBLE_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8743 try {
8744 auto &v = linb::any_cast<double &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8745 doVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, visitor);
8746 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8747 }
8748 } else if (((f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::STRING_T) || (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::BYTES_T))
8749 && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8750 try {
8751 auto &v = linb::any_cast<std::string &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8752 doVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, visitor);
8753 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8754 }
8755 } else if (f.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::MESSAGE_T && (0 < m_intermediateDataRepresentation.count(f.fieldIdentifier()))) {
8756 try {
8757 auto &v = linb::any_cast<cluon::GenericMessage &>(m_intermediateDataRepresentation[f.fieldIdentifier()]);
8758 doVisit(f.fieldIdentifier(), std::move(f.fieldDataTypeName()), std::move(f.fieldName()), v, visitor);
8759 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8760 }
8761 }
8762 // End processing in case of visiting specific fields.
8763 if (!visitAll && (fieldId == f.fieldIdentifier())) {
8764 break;
8765 }
8766 }
8767 }
8768
8769 visitor.postVisit();
8770 }
8771
8772 private:
8773 MetaMessage m_metaMessage{};
8774 std::vector<MetaMessage> m_scopeOfMetaMessages{};
8775 std::unordered_map<std::string, MetaMessage> m_mapForScopeOfMetaMessages{};
8776 std::string m_longName{""};
8777 std::unordered_map<uint32_t, linb::any, UseUInt32ValueAsHashKey> m_intermediateDataRepresentation;
8778};
8779} // namespace cluon
8780
8781template <>
8782struct isVisitable<cluon::GenericMessage> {
8783 static const bool value = true;
8784};
8785template <>
8786struct isTripletForwardVisitable<cluon::GenericMessage> {
8787 static const bool value = true;
8788};
8789#endif

8799#define CLUON_LCMTOGENERICMESSAGE_HPP
8800
8801//#include "cluon/GenericMessage.hpp"
8802//#include "cluon/MetaMessage.hpp"
8803//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
8804
8805#include <cstdint>
8806#include <map>
8807#include <string>
8808#include <vector>
8809

8814class LIBCLUON_API LCMToGenericMessage {
8815 private:

8817 LCMToGenericMessage(LCMToGenericMessage &&) = delete;
8818 LCMToGenericMessage &operator=(const LCMToGenericMessage &) = delete;
8819 LCMToGenericMessage &operator=(LCMToGenericMessage &&) = delete;
8820
8821 public:
8822 LCMToGenericMessage() = default;
8823
8832 int32_t setMessageSpecification(const std::string &ms) noexcept;
8833
8840 cluon::GenericMessage getGenericMessage(const std::string &data) noexcept;
8841
8842 private:
8843 std::vector<cluon::MetaMessage> m_listOfMetaMessages{};
8844 std::map<std::string, cluon::MetaMessage> m_scopeOfMetaMessages{};
8845};
8846} // namespace cluon
8847#endif

8856#ifndef CLUON_OD4SESSION_HPP
8857#define CLUON_OD4SESSION_HPP
8858
8859//#include "cluon/Time.hpp"
8860//#include "cluon/ToProtoVisitor.hpp"
8861//#include "cluon/UDPReceiver.hpp"
8862//#include "cluon/UDPSender.hpp"
8863//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
8864//#include "cluon/cluonDataStructures.hpp"
8865
8866#include <chrono>
8867#include <cstdint>
8868#include <functional>
8869#include <memory>
8870#include <mutex>
8871#include <string>
8872#include <unordered_map>
8873#include <utility>
8874
8875namespace cluon {
8923class LIBCLUON_API OD4Session {
8924 private:
8925 OD4Session(const OD4Session &) = delete;
8926 OD4Session(OD4Session &&) = delete;
8927 OD4Session &operator=(const OD4Session &) = delete;
8928 OD4Session &operator=(OD4Session &&) = delete;
8929
8930 public:
8940 OD4Session(uint16_t CID, std::function<void(cluon::data::Envelope &&envelope)> delegate = nullptr) noexcept;
8941
8947 void send(cluon::data::Envelope &&envelope) noexcept;
8948
8957 bool dataTrigger(int32_t messageIdentifier, std::function<void(cluon::data::Envelope &&envelope)> delegate) noexcept;
8958
8969 void timeTrigger(float freq, std::function<bool()> delegate) noexcept;
8970
8978 template <typename T>
8979 void send(T &message, const cluon::data::TimeStamp &sampleTimeStamp = cluon::data::TimeStamp(), uint32_t senderStamp = 0) noexcept {
8980 try {
8981 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(m_senderMutex);
8982 cluon::ToProtoVisitor protoEncoder;
8983
8984 cluon::data::Envelope envelope;
8985 {
8986 envelope.dataType(static_cast<int32_t>(message.ID()));
8987 message.accept(protoEncoder);
8988 envelope.serializedData(protoEncoder.encodedData());
8989 envelope.sent(cluon::time::now());
8990 envelope.sampleTimeStamp((0 == (sampleTimeStamp.seconds() + sampleTimeStamp.microseconds())) ? envelope.sent() : sampleTimeStamp);
8991 envelope.senderStamp(senderStamp);
8992 }
8993
8994 send(std::move(envelope));
8995 } catch (...) {} // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8996 }
8997
8998 public:
8999 bool isRunning() noexcept;
9000
9001 private:
9002 void callback(std::string &&data, std::string &&from, std::chrono::system_clock::time_point &&timepoint) noexcept;
9003 void sendInternal(std::string &&dataToSend) noexcept;
9004
9005 private:
9006 std::unique_ptr<cluon::UDPReceiver> m_receiver;
9007 cluon::UDPSender m_sender;
9008
9009 std::mutex m_senderMutex{};
9010
9011 std::function<void(cluon::data::Envelope &&envelope)> m_delegate{nullptr};
9012
9013 std::mutex m_mapOfDataTriggeredDelegatesMutex{};
9014 std::unordered_map<int32_t, std::function<void(cluon::data::Envelope &&envelope)>, UseUInt32ValueAsHashKey> m_mapOfDataTriggeredDelegates{};
9015};
9016
9017} // namespace cluon
9018#endif

9020 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
9021 *
9022 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
9023 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
9024 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
9025 */

9027#ifndef CLUON_PLAYER_HPP
9028#define CLUON_PLAYER_HPP
9029
9030//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
9031//#include "cluon/cluonDataStructures.hpp"
9032
9033#include <cstdint>
9034#include <deque>
9035#include <fstream>
9036#include <functional>
9037#include <map>
9038#include <memory>
9039#include <mutex>
9040#include <string>

9042#include <utility>

9044namespace cluon {
9045
9046class LIBCLUON_API IndexEntry {
9047 public:
9048 IndexEntry() = default;
9049 IndexEntry(const int64_t &sampleTimeStamp, const uint64_t &filePosition) noexcept;
9050
9051 public:
9052 int64_t m_sampleTimeStamp{0};
9053 uint64_t m_filePosition{0};
9054 bool m_available{0};
9055};
9056
9057class LIBCLUON_API Player {
9058 private:
9059 enum {
9060 ONE_MILLISECOND_IN_MICROSECONDS = 1000,
9061 ONE_SECOND_IN_MICROSECONDS = 1000 * ONE_MILLISECOND_IN_MICROSECONDS,
9062 MAX_DELAY_IN_MICROSECONDS = 1 * ONE_SECOND_IN_MICROSECONDS,
9063 LOOK_AHEAD_IN_S = 30,
9064 MIN_ENTRIES_FOR_LOOK_AHEAD = 5000,
9065 };
9066
9067 private:
9068 Player(const Player &) = delete;
9069 Player(Player &&) = delete;
9070 Player &operator=(Player &&) = delete;
9071 Player &operator=(const Player &other) = delete;
9072
9073 public:
9081 Player(const std::string &file, const bool &autoRewind, const bool &threading) noexcept;
9082 ~Player();
9083
9088 std::pair<bool, cluon::data::Envelope> getNextEnvelopeToBeReplayed() noexcept;
9089
9093 uint32_t delay() const noexcept;
9094
9098 bool hasMoreData() const noexcept;
9099
9103 void rewind() noexcept;
9104
9105 void seekTo(float ratio) noexcept;
9106
9110 uint32_t totalNumberOfEnvelopesInRecFile() const noexcept;
9111
9112 private:
9113 // Internal methods without Lock.
9114 bool hasMoreDataFromRecFile() const noexcept;
9115
9121 void initializeIndex() noexcept;
9122
9127 void computeInitialCacheLevelAndFillCache() noexcept;
9128
9132 void resetCaches() noexcept;
9133
9137 inline void resetIterators() noexcept;
9138
9146 uint32_t fillEnvelopeCache(const uint32_t &maxNumberOfEntriesToReadFromFile) noexcept;
9147
9152 inline void checkAvailabilityOfNextEnvelopeToBeReplayed() noexcept;
9153
9154 private: // Data for the Player.
9155 bool m_threading;
9156
9157 std::string m_file;
9158
9159 // Handle to .rec file.
9160 std::fstream m_recFile;
9161 bool m_recFileValid;
9162
9163 private: // Player states.
9164 bool m_autoRewind;
9165
9166 private: // Index and cache management.
9167 // Global index: Mapping SampleTimeStamp --> cache entry (holding the actual content from .rec file).
9168 mutable std::mutex m_indexMutex;
9169 std::multimap<int64_t, IndexEntry> m_index;
9170
9171 // Pointers to the current envelope to be replayed and the
9172 // envelope that has be replayed from the global index.
9173 std::multimap<int64_t, IndexEntry>::iterator m_previousPreviousEnvelopeAlreadyReplayed;
9174 std::multimap<int64_t, IndexEntry>::iterator m_previousEnvelopeAlreadyReplayed;
9175 std::multimap<int64_t, IndexEntry>::iterator m_currentEnvelopeToReplay;
9176
9177 // Information about the index.
9178 std::multimap<int64_t, IndexEntry>::iterator m_nextEntryToReadFromRecFile;
9179
9180 uint32_t m_desiredInitialLevel;
9181
9182 // Fields to compute replay throughput for cache management.
9183 cluon::data::TimeStamp m_firstTimePointReturningAEnvelope;
9184 uint64_t m_numberOfReturnedEnvelopesInTotal;
9185
9186 uint32_t m_delay;
9187
9188 private:
9194 void setEnvelopeCacheFillingRunning(const bool &running) noexcept;
9195 bool isEnvelopeCacheFillingRunning() const noexcept;
9196
9200 void manageCache() noexcept;
9201
9209 float checkRefillingCache(const uint32_t &numberOfEntries, float refillMultiplicator) noexcept;
9210
9211 private:
9212 mutable std::mutex m_envelopeCacheFillingThreadIsRunningMutex;
9213 bool m_envelopeCacheFillingThreadIsRunning;
9214 std::thread m_envelopeCacheFillingThread;
9215
9216 // Mapping of pos_type (within .rec file) --> cluon::data::Envelope (read from .rec file).
9217 std::map<uint64_t, cluon::data::Envelope> m_envelopeCache;
9218
9219 public:
9220 void setPlayerListener(std::function<void(cluon::data::PlayerStatus playerStatus)> playerListener) noexcept;
9221
9222 private:
9223 std::mutex m_playerListenerMutex;
9224 std::function<void(cluon::data::PlayerStatus playerStatus)> m_playerListener{nullptr};
9225};
9226
9227} // namespace cluon
9228
9229#endif

9232 *

9234 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
9235 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.

9238#ifndef CLUON_SHAREDMEMORY_HPP
9239#define CLUON_SHAREDMEMORY_HPP
9240
9241//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
9242//#include "cluon/cluonDataStructures.hpp"
9243
9244// clang-format off
9245#ifdef WIN32
9246 #include <Windows.h>
9247#else
9248 #include <pthread.h>
9249 #include <sys/ipc.h>
9250#endif
9251// clang-format on
9252
9253#include <cstddef>
9254#include <cstdint>
9255#include <atomic>
9256#include <string>
9257#include <utility>
9258
9259namespace cluon {
9260
9261class LIBCLUON_API SharedMemory {
9262 private:
9263 SharedMemory(const SharedMemory &) = delete;
9264 SharedMemory(SharedMemory &&) = delete;
9265 SharedMemory &operator=(const SharedMemory &) = delete;
9266 SharedMemory &operator=(SharedMemory &&) = delete;
9267
9268 public:
9277 SharedMemory(const std::string &name, uint32_t size = 0) noexcept;
9278 ~SharedMemory() noexcept;
9279
9283 bool isLocked() const noexcept;
9284
9288 void lock() noexcept;
9289
9293 void unlock() noexcept;
9294
9298 void wait() noexcept;
9299
9303 void notifyAll() noexcept;
9304
9315 bool setTimeStamp(const cluon::data::TimeStamp &ts) noexcept;
9316
9324 std::pair<bool, cluon::data::TimeStamp> getTimeStamp() noexcept;
9325
9326 public:
9330 bool valid() noexcept;
9331
9335 char *data() noexcept;
9336
9340 uint32_t size() const noexcept;
9341
9345 const std::string name() const noexcept;
9346
9347#ifdef WIN32
9348 private:
9349 void initWIN32() noexcept;
9350 void deinitWIN32() noexcept;
9351 void lockWIN32() noexcept;
9352 void unlockWIN32() noexcept;
9353 void waitWIN32() noexcept;
9354 void notifyAllWIN32() noexcept;
9355#else
9356 private:
9357 void initPOSIX() noexcept;
9358 void deinitPOSIX() noexcept;
9359 void lockPOSIX() noexcept;
9360 void unlockPOSIX() noexcept;
9361 void waitPOSIX() noexcept;
9362 void notifyAllPOSIX() noexcept;
9363 bool validPOSIX() noexcept;
9364
9365 void initSysV() noexcept;
9366 void deinitSysV() noexcept;
9367 void lockSysV() noexcept;
9368 void unlockSysV() noexcept;
9369 void waitSysV() noexcept;
9370 void notifyAllSysV() noexcept;
9371 bool validSysV() noexcept;
9372#endif
9373
9374 private:
9375 std::string m_name{""};
9376 std::string m_nameForTimeStamping{""};
9377 uint32_t m_size{0};
9378 char *m_sharedMemory{nullptr};
9379 char *m_userAccessibleSharedMemory{nullptr};
9380 bool m_hasOnlyAttachedToSharedMemory{false};
9381
9382 std::atomic<bool> m_broken{false};
9383 std::atomic<bool> m_isLocked{false};
9384
9385#ifdef WIN32
9386 HANDLE __conditionEvent{nullptr};
9387 HANDLE __mutex{nullptr};
9388 HANDLE __sharedMemory{nullptr};
9389#else
9390 int32_t m_fdForTimeStamping{-1};
9391
9392 bool m_usePOSIX{true};
9393
9394 // Member fields for POSIX-based shared memory.
9395#if !defined(__NetBSD__) && !defined(__OpenBSD__)
9396 int32_t m_fd{-1};
9397 struct SharedMemoryHeader {
9398 uint32_t __size;
9399 pthread_mutex_t __mutex;
9400 pthread_cond_t __condition;
9401 };
9402 SharedMemoryHeader *m_sharedMemoryHeader{nullptr};
9403#endif
9404
9405 // Member fields for SysV-based shared memory.
9406 key_t m_shmKeySysV{0};
9407 key_t m_mutexKeySysV{0};
9408 key_t m_conditionKeySysV{0};
9409
9410 int m_sharedMemoryIDSysV{-1};
9411 int m_mutexIDSysV{-1};
9412 int m_conditionIDSysV{-1};
9413#endif
9414};
9415} // namespace cluon
9416
9417#endif
9418#ifndef BEGIN_HEADER_ONLY_IMPLEMENTATION
9419#define BEGIN_HEADER_ONLY_IMPLEMENTATION
9420/*
9421 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
9422 *
9423 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
9424 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
9425 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
9426 */
9427
9428//#include "argh/argh.h"
9429
9430//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
9431
9432namespace cluon {
9433
9434inline std::map<std::string, std::string> getCommandlineArguments(int32_t argc, char **argv) noexcept {
9435 argh::parser commandline{argc, argv};
9436 std::map<std::string, std::string> retVal;
9437
9438 for (auto &positionalArgument : commandline.pos_args()) { retVal[positionalArgument] = ""; }
9439
9440 for (auto &flag : commandline.flags()) { retVal[flag] = "1"; }
9441
9442 for (auto &parameter : commandline.params()) { retVal[parameter.first] = parameter.second; }
9443
9444 return retVal;
9445}
9446
9447} // namespace cluon
9448/*
9449 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
9450 *
9451 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
9452 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
9453 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
9454 */
9455
9456//#include "cluon/MetaMessage.hpp"
9457
9458namespace cluon {
9459
9460inline MetaMessage::MetaField::MetaFieldDataTypes MetaMessage::MetaField::fieldDataType() const noexcept {
9461 return m_fieldDataType;
9462}
9463
9464inline MetaMessage::MetaField &MetaMessage::MetaField::fieldDataType(const MetaMessage::MetaField::MetaFieldDataTypes &v) noexcept {
9465 m_fieldDataType = v;
9466 return *this;
9467}
9468
9469inline std::string MetaMessage::MetaField::fieldDataTypeName() const noexcept {
9470 return m_fieldDataTypeName;
9471}
9472
9473inline MetaMessage::MetaField &MetaMessage::MetaField::fieldDataTypeName(const std::string &v) noexcept {
9474 m_fieldDataTypeName = v;
9475 return *this;
9476}
9477
9478inline std::string MetaMessage::MetaField::fieldName() const noexcept {
9479 return m_fieldName;
9480}
9481
9482inline MetaMessage::MetaField &MetaMessage::MetaField::fieldName(const std::string &v) noexcept {
9483 m_fieldName = v;
9484 return *this;
9485}
9486
9487inline uint32_t MetaMessage::MetaField::fieldIdentifier() const noexcept {
9488 return m_fieldIdentifier;
9489}
9490
9491inline MetaMessage::MetaField &MetaMessage::MetaField::fieldIdentifier(uint32_t v) noexcept {
9492 m_fieldIdentifier = v;
9493 return *this;
9494}
9495
9496inline std::string MetaMessage::MetaField::defaultInitializationValue() const noexcept {
9497 return m_defaultInitializationValue;
9498}
9499
9500inline MetaMessage::MetaField &MetaMessage::MetaField::defaultInitializationValue(const std::string &v) noexcept {
9501 m_defaultInitializationValue = v;
9502 return *this;
9503}
9504
9506
9507inline MetaMessage::MetaMessage() noexcept {}
9508
9509inline std::string MetaMessage::packageName() const noexcept {
9510 return m_packageName;
9511}
9512
9513inline std::string MetaMessage::messageName() const noexcept {
9514 return m_messageName;
9515}
9516
9517inline MetaMessage &MetaMessage::packageName(const std::string &v) noexcept {
9518 m_packageName = v;
9519 return *this;
9520}
9521
9522inline MetaMessage &MetaMessage::messageName(const std::string &v) noexcept {
9523 m_messageName = v;
9524 return *this;
9525}
9526
9527inline int32_t MetaMessage::messageIdentifier() const noexcept {
9528 return m_messageIdentifier;
9529}
9530
9531inline MetaMessage &MetaMessage::messageIdentifier(int32_t v) noexcept {
9532 m_messageIdentifier = v;
9533 return *this;
9534}
9535
9536inline MetaMessage &MetaMessage::add(MetaMessage::MetaField &&mf) noexcept {
9537 m_listOfMetaFields.emplace_back(std::move(mf));
9538 return *this;
9539}
9540
9541inline const std::vector<MetaMessage::MetaField> &MetaMessage::listOfMetaFields() const noexcept {
9542 return m_listOfMetaFields;
9543}
9544
9545inline void MetaMessage::accept(const std::function<void(const MetaMessage &)> &visit) {
9546 visit(*this);
9547}
9548} // namespace cluon
9549/*
9550 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
9551 *
9552 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
9553 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
9554 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
9555 */
9556
9557//#include "cluon/MessageParser.hpp"
9558//#include "cluon/stringtoolbox.hpp"
9559
9560//#include "cpp-peglib/peglib.h"
9561
9562#include <algorithm>
9563#include <functional>
9564#include <iostream>
9565#include <memory>
9566#include <regex>
9567#include <string>
9568#include <vector>
9569
9570namespace cluon {
9571
9572inline std::pair<std::vector<MetaMessage>, MessageParser::MessageParserErrorCodes> MessageParser::parse(const std::string &input) {
9573 const char *grammarMessageSpecificationLanguage = R"(
9574 MESSAGES_SPECIFICATION <- PACKAGE_DECLARATION? MESSAGE_DECLARATION*
9575 PACKAGE_DECLARATION <- 'package' PACKAGE_IDENTIFIER ';'
9576 PACKAGE_IDENTIFIER <- < IDENTIFIER ('.' IDENTIFIER)* >
9577
9578 MESSAGE_DECLARATION <- 'message' MESSAGE_IDENTIFIER MESSAGE_OPTIONS '{' FIELD* '}'
9579 MESSAGE_IDENTIFIER <- < IDENTIFIER ('.' IDENTIFIER)* >
9580 MESSAGE_OPTIONS <- '[' 'id' '=' NATURAL_NUMBER ','? ']'
9581
9582 FIELD <- PRIMITIVE_FIELD
9583
9584 PRIMITIVE_FIELD <- PRIMITIVE_TYPE IDENTIFIER ('[' PRIMITIVE_FIELD_OPTIONS ']')? ';'
9585 PRIMITIVE_FIELD_OPTIONS <- PRIMITIVE_FIELD_DEFAULT? ','? NUMERICAL_FIELD_IDENTIFIER?
9586 NUMERICAL_FIELD_IDENTIFIER <- 'id' '=' NATURAL_NUMBER
9587 PRIMITIVE_FIELD_DEFAULT <- 'default' '=' (FLOAT_NUMBER / BOOL / CHARACTER / STRING)
9588 PRIMITIVE_TYPE <- < 'bool' / 'float' / 'double' /
9589 'char' /
9590 'bytes' / 'string' /
9591 'int8' / 'uint8' /
9592 'int16' / 'uint16' /
9593 'int32' / 'uint32' /
9594 'int64' / 'uint64' /
9595 MESSAGE_TYPE >
9596
9597 MESSAGE_TYPE <- < IDENTIFIER ('.' IDENTIFIER)* >
9598
9599 IDENTIFIER <- < [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]* >
9600 DIGIT <- < [0-9] >
9601 NATURAL_NUMBER <- < [1-9] DIGIT* >
9602 FLOAT_NUMBER <- < ('+' / '-')? DIGIT DIGIT* (('.') DIGIT*)? >
9603 BOOL <- < 'true' > / < 'false' >
9604 STRING <- '"' < (!'"'.)* > '"'
9605 CHARACTER <- '\'' < (!'\'' .) > '\''
9606
9607 %whitespace <- [ \t\r\n]*
9608 )";
9609
9611
9612 // Function to check for unique field names.
9613 std::function<bool(const peg::Ast &, std::string &, std::vector<std::string> &, std::vector<std::string> &, std::vector<int32_t> &, std::vector<int32_t> &)>
9614 check4UniqueFieldNames = [&checkForUniqueFieldNames = check4UniqueFieldNames](const peg::Ast &ast,
9615 std::string &prefix,
9616 std::vector<std::string> &messageNames,
9617 std::vector<std::string> &fieldNames,
9618 std::vector<int32_t> &numericalMessageIdentifiers,
9619 std::vector<int32_t> &numericalFieldIdentifiers) {
9620 bool retVal = true;
9621 // First, we need to visit the children of AST node MESSAGES_SPECIFICATION.
9622 if ("MESSAGES_SPECIFICATION" == ast.name) {
9623 for (const auto &node : ast.nodes) {
9624 retVal &= checkForUniqueFieldNames(*node, prefix, messageNames, fieldNames, numericalMessageIdentifiers, numericalFieldIdentifiers);
9625 }
9626 // Try finding duplicated message identifiers.
9627 if (retVal) {
9628 std::sort(std::begin(numericalMessageIdentifiers), std::end(numericalMessageIdentifiers));
9629 int32_t duplicatedMessageIdentifier{-1};
9630 for (auto it{std::begin(numericalMessageIdentifiers)}; it != std::end(numericalMessageIdentifiers); it++) {
9631 if (it + 1 != std::end(numericalMessageIdentifiers)) {
9632 if (std::find(it + 1, std::end(numericalMessageIdentifiers), *it) != std::end(numericalMessageIdentifiers)) {
9633 duplicatedMessageIdentifier = *it;
9634 }
9635 }
9636 }
9637 retVal &= (-1 == duplicatedMessageIdentifier);
9638 if (!retVal) {
9639 std::cerr << "[cluon::MessageParser] Found duplicated numerical message identifier: " << duplicatedMessageIdentifier << '\n';
9640 }
9641 }
9642 // Try finding duplicated message names.
9643 if (retVal) {
9644 std::sort(std::begin(messageNames), std::end(messageNames));
9645 std::string duplicatedMessageName;
9646 for (auto it{std::begin(messageNames)}; it != std::end(messageNames); it++) {
9647 if (it + 1 != std::end(messageNames)) {
9648 if (std::find(it + 1, std::end(messageNames), *it) != std::end(messageNames)) {
9649 duplicatedMessageName = *it;
9650 }
9651 }
9652 }
9653 retVal &= (duplicatedMessageName.empty());
9654 if (!retVal) {
9655 std::cerr << "[cluon::MessageParser] Found duplicated message name '" << duplicatedMessageName << "'" << '\n';
9656 }
9657 }
9658 }
9659 // Second, we need to visit the children of AST node MESSAGE_DECLARATION.
9660 if ("MESSAGE_DECLARATION" == ast.name) {
9661 fieldNames.clear();
9662 numericalFieldIdentifiers.clear();
9663 prefix = "";
9664 retVal = true;
9665
9666 for (const auto &node : ast.nodes) {
9667 if ("MESSAGE_IDENTIFIER" == node->name) {
9668 prefix = node->token;
9669 messageNames.push_back(::stringtoolbox::trim(prefix));
9670 } else if ("NATURAL_NUMBER" == node->name) {
9671 numericalMessageIdentifiers.push_back(std::stoi(node->token));
9672 } else if ("PRIMITIVE_FIELD" == node->name) {
9673 retVal &= checkForUniqueFieldNames(*node, prefix, messageNames, fieldNames, numericalMessageIdentifiers, numericalFieldIdentifiers);
9674 }
9675 }
9676
9677 // Try finding duplicated numerical field identifiers.
9678 if (retVal) {
9679 std::sort(std::begin(numericalFieldIdentifiers), std::end(numericalFieldIdentifiers));
9680 int32_t duplicatedFieldIdentifier{-1};
9681 for (auto it{std::begin(numericalFieldIdentifiers)}; it != std::end(numericalFieldIdentifiers); it++) {
9682 if (it + 1 != std::end(numericalFieldIdentifiers)) {
9683 if (std::find(it + 1, std::end(numericalFieldIdentifiers), *it) != std::end(numericalFieldIdentifiers)) {
9684 duplicatedFieldIdentifier = *it;
9685 }
9686 }
9687 }
9688 retVal &= (-1 == duplicatedFieldIdentifier);
9689 if (!retVal) {
9690 std::cerr << "[cluon::MessageParser] Found duplicated numerical field identifier in message "
9691 << "'" << ::stringtoolbox::trim(prefix) << "': " << duplicatedFieldIdentifier << '\n';
9692 }
9693 }
9694 // Try finding duplicated field names.
9695 if (retVal) {
9696 std::sort(std::begin(fieldNames), std::end(fieldNames));
9697 std::string duplicatedFieldName;
9698 for (auto it{std::begin(fieldNames)}; it != std::end(fieldNames); it++) {
9699 if (it + 1 != std::end(fieldNames)) {
9700 if (std::find(it + 1, std::end(fieldNames), *it) != std::end(fieldNames)) {
9701 duplicatedFieldName = *it;
9702 }
9703 }
9704 }
9705 retVal &= (duplicatedFieldName.empty());
9706 if (!retVal) {
9707 std::cerr << "[cluon::MessageParser] Found duplicated field name in message '" << ::stringtoolbox::trim(prefix) << "': '"
9708 << duplicatedFieldName << "'" << '\n';
9709 }
9710 }
9711 }
9712 // Within AST node MESSAGE_DECLARATION, we have PRIMITIVE_FIELD from
9713 // which we need to extract the field "token".
9714 if (ast.name == "PRIMITIVE_FIELD") {
9715 // Extract the value of entry "IDENTIFIER".
9716 auto nodeIdentifier = std::find_if(std::begin(ast.nodes), std::end(ast.nodes), [](auto a) { return (a->name == "IDENTIFIER"); });
9717 if (nodeIdentifier != std::end(ast.nodes)) {
9718 fieldNames.push_back((*nodeIdentifier)->token);
9719 }
9720
9721 // Visit this node's children to check for duplicated numerical identifiers.
9722 for (const auto &node : ast.nodes) {
9723 retVal &= checkForUniqueFieldNames(*node, prefix, messageNames, fieldNames, numericalMessageIdentifiers, numericalFieldIdentifiers);
9724 }
9725 }
9726 // Within AST node PRIMITIVE_FIELD, we have PRIMITIVE_FIELD_OPTIONS from
9727 // which we need to extract the field "token".
9728 if (ast.name == "PRIMITIVE_FIELD_OPTIONS") {
9729 // Extract the value of entry "IDENTIFIER".
9730 auto nodeNumericalFieldIdentifier
9731 = std::find_if(std::begin(ast.nodes), std::end(ast.nodes), [](auto a) { return (a->name == "NATURAL_NUMBER"); });
9732 if (nodeNumericalFieldIdentifier != std::end(ast.nodes)) {
9733 numericalFieldIdentifiers.push_back(std::stoi((*nodeNumericalFieldIdentifier)->token));
9734 }
9735 }
9736
9737 return retVal;
9738 };
9739
9741
9742 // Function to transform AST into list of MetaMessages.
9743 std::function<void(const peg::Ast &, std::vector<MetaMessage> &)> transform2MetaMessages
9744 = [](const peg::Ast &ast, std::vector<MetaMessage> &listOfMetaMessages) {
9745 // "Inner"-lambda to handle various types of message declarations.
9746 auto createMetaMessage = [](const peg::Ast &_node, std::string _packageName) -> MetaMessage {
9747 MetaMessage mm;
9748 mm.packageName(::stringtoolbox::trim(_packageName));
9749 uint32_t fieldIdentifierCounter{0};
9750 for (const auto &e : _node.nodes) {
9751 if ("MESSAGE_IDENTIFIER" == e->name) {
9752 std::string _messageName = e->token;
9753 mm.messageName(::stringtoolbox::trim(_messageName));
9754 } else if ("NATURAL_NUMBER" == e->name) {
9755 mm.messageIdentifier(std::stoi(e->token));
9756 } else if ("PRIMITIVE_FIELD" == e->name) {
9757 std::string _fieldName;
9758 auto fieldName = std::find_if(std::begin(e->nodes), std::end(e->nodes), [](auto a) { return (a->name == "IDENTIFIER"); });
9759 if (fieldName != std::end(e->nodes)) {
9760 _fieldName = (*fieldName)->token;
9761 }
9762
9763 std::string _fieldDataType;
9764 auto fieldDataType = std::find_if(std::begin(e->nodes), std::end(e->nodes), [](auto a) { return (a->name == "PRIMITIVE_TYPE"); });
9765 if (fieldDataType != std::end(e->nodes)) {
9766 _fieldDataType = (*fieldDataType)->token;
9767 }
9768
9769 fieldIdentifierCounter++; // Automatically count expected field identifiers in case of missing
9770 // field options.
9771 std::string _fieldIdentifier;
9772 auto fieldIdentifier = std::find_if(std::begin(e->nodes), std::end(e->nodes), [](auto a) { return (a->name == "NATURAL_NUMBER"); });
9773 if (fieldIdentifier != std::end(e->nodes)) {
9774 _fieldIdentifier = (*fieldIdentifier)->token;
9775 }
9776
9777 std::string _fieldDefaultInitializerValue;
9778 auto primitiveFieldOptions
9779 = std::find_if(std::begin(e->nodes), std::end(e->nodes), [](auto a) { return (a->name == "PRIMITIVE_FIELD_OPTIONS"); });
9780 if (primitiveFieldOptions != std::end(e->nodes)) {
9781 for (const auto &f : (*primitiveFieldOptions)->nodes) {
9782 if ("NATURAL_NUMBER" != f->name) {
9783 if ("STRING" == f->name) {
9784 _fieldDefaultInitializerValue = "\"" + f->token + "\""; // NOLINT
9785 } else if ("CHARACTER" == f->name) {
9786 _fieldDefaultInitializerValue = "'" + f->token + "'";
9787 } else {
9788 _fieldDefaultInitializerValue = f->token;
9789 }
9790 }
9791 }
9792 }
9793
9794 std::map<std::string, MetaMessage::MetaField::MetaFieldDataTypes> STRING_TO_DATATYPE_MAP = {
9795 {"bool", MetaMessage::MetaField::BOOL_T},
9796 {"char", MetaMessage::MetaField::CHAR_T},
9797 {"uint8", MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT8_T},
9798 {"int8", MetaMessage::MetaField::INT8_T},
9799 {"uint16", MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT16_T},
9800 {"int16", MetaMessage::MetaField::INT16_T},
9801 {"uint32", MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT32_T},
9802 {"int32", MetaMessage::MetaField::INT32_T},
9803 {"uint64", MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT64_T},
9804 {"int64", MetaMessage::MetaField::INT64_T},
9805 {"float", MetaMessage::MetaField::FLOAT_T},
9806 {"double", MetaMessage::MetaField::DOUBLE_T},
9807 {"string", MetaMessage::MetaField::STRING_T},
9808 {"bytes", MetaMessage::MetaField::BYTES_T},
9809 };
9810
9811 MetaMessage::MetaField mf;
9812 if (0 < STRING_TO_DATATYPE_MAP.count(_fieldDataType)) {
9813 mf.fieldDataType(STRING_TO_DATATYPE_MAP[_fieldDataType]);
9814 } else {
9815 mf.fieldDataType(MetaMessage::MetaField::MESSAGE_T);
9816 }
9817 mf.fieldDataTypeName(::stringtoolbox::trim(_fieldDataType));
9818 mf.fieldName(::stringtoolbox::trim(_fieldName));
9819 mf.fieldIdentifier(
9820 (!_fieldIdentifier.empty() ? static_cast<uint32_t>(std::stoi(::stringtoolbox::trim(_fieldIdentifier))) : fieldIdentifierCounter));
9821 mf.defaultInitializationValue(_fieldDefaultInitializerValue);
9822 mm.add(std::move(mf));
9823 }
9824 }
9825 return mm;
9826 };
9827
9829
9830 // Case: "package XYZ" present.
9831 if ("MESSAGES_SPECIFICATION" == ast.name) {
9832 // Extract the value of entry "PACKAGE_IDENTIFIER".
9833 auto nodeIdentifier = std::find_if(std::begin(ast.nodes), std::end(ast.nodes), [](auto a) { return (a->name == "PACKAGE_IDENTIFIER"); });
9834 std::string packageName;
9835 if (nodeIdentifier != std::end(ast.nodes)) {
9836 packageName = (*nodeIdentifier)->token;
9837 }
9838
9839 // Extract the value of entry "MESSAGE_DECLARATION".
9840 for (const auto &node : ast.nodes) {
9841 if (node->name == "MESSAGE_DECLARATION") {
9842 listOfMetaMessages.emplace_back(createMetaMessage(*node, packageName));
9843 }
9844 }
9845 } else {
9846 // In case we only have one single message and no package.
9847 listOfMetaMessages.emplace_back(createMetaMessage(ast, ""));
9848 }
9849 };
9850
9852
9853 peg::parser p(grammarMessageSpecificationLanguage);
9854 p.enable_ast();
9855 p.log = [](size_t row, size_t col, const std::string &msg) {
9856 std::cerr << "[cluon::MessageParser] Parsing error:" << row << ":" << col << ": " << msg << '\n';
9857 };
9858
9859 std::pair<std::vector<MetaMessage>, MessageParserErrorCodes> retVal{};
9860 std::string inputWithoutComments{input};
9861 try {
9862 const std::string MATCH_COMMENTS_REGEX = R"(/\*([\s\S]*?)\*/|//.*)";
9863 inputWithoutComments = std::regex_replace(input, std::regex(MATCH_COMMENTS_REGEX), ""); // NOLINT
9864 } catch (std::regex_error &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
9865 } catch (std::bad_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
9866 }
9867 try {
9868 std::vector<MetaMessage> listOfMetaMessages{};
9869 std::shared_ptr<peg::Ast> ast{};
9870 if (p.parse(inputWithoutComments.c_str(), ast)) {
9871 ast = peg::AstOptimizer(true).optimize(ast);
9872 {
9873 std::string tmpPrefix;
9874 std::vector<std::string> tmpMessageNames{};
9875 std::vector<std::string> tmpFieldNames{};
9876 std::vector<int32_t> tmpNumericalMessageIdentifiers{};
9877 std::vector<int32_t> tmpNumericalFieldIdentifiers{};
9878 if (check4UniqueFieldNames(*ast, tmpPrefix, tmpMessageNames, tmpFieldNames, tmpNumericalMessageIdentifiers, tmpNumericalFieldIdentifiers)) {
9879 transform2MetaMessages(*ast, listOfMetaMessages);
9880 retVal = {listOfMetaMessages, MessageParserErrorCodes::NO_MESSAGEPARSER_ERROR};
9881 } else {
9882 retVal = {listOfMetaMessages, MessageParserErrorCodes::DUPLICATE_IDENTIFIERS};
9883 }
9884 }
9885 } else {
9886 retVal = {listOfMetaMessages, MessageParserErrorCodes::SYNTAX_ERROR};
9887 }
9888 } catch (std::bad_cast &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
9889 }
9890 return retVal;
9891}
9892} // namespace cluon
9893/*
9894 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
9895 *
9896 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
9897 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
9898 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
9899 */
9900
9901//#include "cluon/TerminateHandler.hpp"
9902
9903#include <cstdlib>
9904#include <cstring>
9905#include <iostream>
9906
9907namespace cluon {
9908
9909inline void cluon_handleExit() {
9910 TerminateHandler::instance().isTerminated.store(true);
9911}
9912
9913inline void cluon_handleSignal(int32_t /*signal*/) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
9914 TerminateHandler::instance().isTerminated.store(true); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
9915}
9916
9917inline TerminateHandler::TerminateHandler() noexcept {
9918 if (0 != std::atexit(cluon_handleExit)) {
9919 std::cerr << "[cluon::TerminateHandler] Failed to register cluon_exitHandler()." << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
9920 }
9921
9922#ifdef WIN32
9923 if (SIG_ERR == ::signal(SIGINT, &cluon_handleSignal)) {
9924 std::cerr << "[cluon::TerminateHandler] Failed to register signal SIGINT." << std::endl;
9925 }
9926 if (SIG_ERR == ::signal(SIGTERM, &cluon_handleSignal)) {
9927 std::cerr << "[cluon::TerminateHandler] Failed to register signal SIGTERM." << std::endl;
9928 }
9929#else
9930 std::memset(&m_signalHandler, 0, sizeof(m_signalHandler));
9931 m_signalHandler.sa_handler = &cluon_handleSignal;
9932
9933 if (::sigaction(SIGINT, &m_signalHandler, NULL) < 0) {
9934 std::cerr << "[cluon::TerminateHandler] Failed to register signal SIGINT." << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
9935 }
9936 if (::sigaction(SIGTERM, &m_signalHandler, NULL) < 0) {
9937 std::cerr << "[cluon::TerminateHandler] Failed to register signal SIGTERM." << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
9938 }
9939#endif
9940}
9941
9942} // namespace cluon
9943/*
9944 * Copyright (C) 2019 Christian Berger
9945 *
9946 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
9947 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
9948 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
9949 */
9950
9951//#include "cluon/IPv4Tools.hpp"
9952
9953// clang-format off
9954#ifdef WIN32
9955 #include <Winsock2.h> // for WSAStartUp
9956 #include <ws2tcpip.h>
9957 #include <iostream>
9958#else
9959 #include <arpa/inet.h>
9960 #include <netdb.h>
9961
9962 #if defined(BSD)
9963 #include <netinet/in.h>
9964 #include <sys/socket.h>
9965 #endif
9966#endif
9967// clang-format on
9968
9969#include <cstring>
9970
9971namespace cluon {
9972
9973inline std::string getIPv4FromHostname(const std::string &hostname) noexcept {
9974#ifdef WIN32
9975 // Load Winsock 2.2 DLL.
9976 WSADATA wsaData;
9977 if (WSAStartup(MAKEWORD(2, 2), &wsaData) != 0) {
9978 std::cerr << "[cluon::getIPv4FromHostname] Error while calling WSAStartUp: " << WSAGetLastError() << std::endl;
9979 }
9980#endif
9981 std::string result{""};
9982 if (!hostname.empty()) {
9983 struct addrinfo hint;
9984 {
9985 std::memset(&hint, 1, sizeof(struct addrinfo));
9986 hint.ai_flags = AI_CANONNAME;
9987 hint.ai_family = AF_INET;
9988 hint.ai_socktype = 0;
9989 hint.ai_protocol = 0;
9990 hint.ai_addrlen = 0;
9991 hint.ai_canonname = nullptr;
9992 hint.ai_addr = nullptr;
9993 hint.ai_next = nullptr;
9994 }
9995
9996 struct addrinfo *listOfHosts{nullptr};
9997 if (0 == getaddrinfo(hostname.c_str(), nullptr, &hint, &listOfHosts)) {
9998 for(struct addrinfo *e = listOfHosts; nullptr != listOfHosts; listOfHosts = listOfHosts->ai_next) {
9999 if (nullptr != e) {
10000 if (AF_INET == e->ai_family) {
10001 struct sockaddr_in *sinp = reinterpret_cast<struct sockaddr_in*>(e->ai_addr);
10002 char buf[INET_ADDRSTRLEN];
10003 const char *addr = inet_ntop(AF_INET, &sinp->sin_addr, buf, INET_ADDRSTRLEN);
10004 if ( (nullptr != addr) && (result.empty()) ) {
10005 result = std::string(addr);
10006 break;
10007 }
10008 }
10009 }
10010 }
10011 }
10012
10013 if (nullptr != listOfHosts) {
10014 freeaddrinfo(listOfHosts);
10015 }
10016 }
10017#ifdef WIN32
10018 WSACleanup();
10019#endif
10020 return result;
10021}
10022
10023} // namespace cluon
10024/*
10025 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
10026 *
10027 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
10028 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
10029 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
10030 */
10031
10032//#include "cluon/UDPSender.hpp"
10033//#include "cluon/IPv4Tools.hpp"
10034//#include "cluon/UDPPacketSizeConstraints.hpp"
10035
10036// clang-format off
10037#ifdef WIN32
10038 #include <iostream>
10039#else
10040 #include <arpa/inet.h>
10041 #include <sys/socket.h>
10042 #include <sys/types.h>
10043 #include <unistd.h>
10044#endif
10045// clang-format on
10046
10047#include <cerrno>
10048#include <cstring>
10049#include <algorithm>
10050#include <iterator>
10051#include <sstream>
10052#include <vector>
10053
10054namespace cluon {
10055
10056inline UDPSender::UDPSender(const std::string &sendToAddress, uint16_t sendToPort) noexcept
10057 : m_socketMutex()
10058 , m_sendToAddress() {
10059 // Decompose given address into tokens to check validity with numerical IPv4 address.
10060 std::string tmp{cluon::getIPv4FromHostname(sendToAddress)};
10061 std::replace(tmp.begin(), tmp.end(), '.', ' ');
10062 std::istringstream sstr{tmp};
10063 std::vector<int> sendToAddressTokens{std::istream_iterator<int>(sstr), std::istream_iterator<int>()};
10064
10065 if (!sendToAddress.empty() && (4 == sendToAddressTokens.size())
10066 && !(std::end(sendToAddressTokens) != std::find_if(sendToAddressTokens.begin(), sendToAddressTokens.end(), [](int a) { return (a < 0) || (a > 255); }))
10067 && (0 < sendToPort)) {
10068 ::memset(&m_sendToAddress, 0, sizeof(m_sendToAddress));
10069 m_sendToAddress.sin_addr.s_addr = ::inet_addr(sendToAddress.c_str());
10070 m_sendToAddress.sin_family = AF_INET;
10071 m_sendToAddress.sin_port = htons(sendToPort);
10072
10073#ifdef WIN32
10074 // Load Winsock 2.2 DLL.
10075 WSADATA wsaData;
10076 if (WSAStartup(MAKEWORD(2, 2), &wsaData) != 0) {
10077 std::cerr << "[cluon::UDPSender] Error while calling WSAStartUp: " << WSAGetLastError() << std::endl;
10078 }
10079#endif
10080
10081 m_socket = ::socket(PF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP);
10082
10083 // Bind to random address/port but store sender port.
10084 if (!(m_socket < 0)) {
10085 struct sockaddr_in sendFromAddress;
10086 std::memset(&sendFromAddress, 0, sizeof(sendFromAddress));
10087 sendFromAddress.sin_family = AF_INET;
10088 sendFromAddress.sin_port = 0; // Randomly choose a port to bind.
10089 if (0 == ::bind(m_socket, reinterpret_cast<struct sockaddr *>(&sendFromAddress), sizeof(sendFromAddress))) { // NOLINT
10090 struct sockaddr tmpAddr;
10091 socklen_t length = sizeof(tmpAddr);
10092 if (0 == ::getsockname(m_socket, &tmpAddr, &length)) {
10093 struct sockaddr_in tmpAddrIn;
10094 std::memcpy(&tmpAddrIn, &tmpAddr, sizeof(tmpAddrIn)); /* Flawfinder: ignore */ // NOLINT
10095 m_portToSentFrom = ntohs(tmpAddrIn.sin_port);
10096 }
10097 }
10098 }
10099
10100#ifdef WIN32
10101 if (m_socket < 0) {
10102 std::cerr << "[cluon::UDPSender] Error while creating socket: " << WSAGetLastError() << std::endl;
10103 WSACleanup();
10104 }
10105#endif
10106 }
10107}
10108
10109inline UDPSender::~UDPSender() noexcept {
10110 if (!(m_socket < 0)) {
10111#ifdef WIN32
10112 ::shutdown(m_socket, SD_BOTH);
10113 ::closesocket(m_socket);
10114 WSACleanup();
10115#else
10116 ::shutdown(m_socket, SHUT_RDWR); // Disallow further read/write operations.
10117 ::close(m_socket);
10118#endif
10119 }
10120 m_socket = -1;
10121}
10122
10123inline uint16_t UDPSender::getSendFromPort() const noexcept {
10124 return m_portToSentFrom;
10125}
10126
10127inline std::pair<ssize_t, int32_t> UDPSender::send(std::string &&data) const noexcept {
10128 if (-1 == m_socket) {
10129 return {-1, EBADF};
10130 }
10131
10132 if (data.empty()) {
10133 return {0, 0};
10134 }
10135
10136 constexpr uint16_t MAX_LENGTH = static_cast<uint16_t>(UDPPacketSizeConstraints::MAX_SIZE_UDP_PACKET)
10137 - static_cast<uint16_t>(UDPPacketSizeConstraints::SIZE_IPv4_HEADER)
10138 - static_cast<uint16_t>(UDPPacketSizeConstraints::SIZE_UDP_HEADER);
10139 if (MAX_LENGTH < data.size()) {
10140 return {-1, E2BIG};
10141 }
10142
10143 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(m_socketMutex);
10144 ssize_t bytesSent = ::sendto(m_socket,
10145 data.c_str(),
10146 data.length(),
10147 0,
10148 reinterpret_cast<const struct sockaddr *>(&m_sendToAddress), // NOLINT
10149 sizeof(m_sendToAddress));
10150
10151 return {bytesSent, (0 > bytesSent ? errno : 0)};
10152}
10153} // namespace cluon
10154/*
10155 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
10156 *
10157 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
10158 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
10159 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
10160 */
10161
10162//#include "cluon/UDPReceiver.hpp"
10163//#include "cluon/IPv4Tools.hpp"
10164//#include "cluon/TerminateHandler.hpp"
10165//#include "cluon/UDPPacketSizeConstraints.hpp"
10166
10167// clang-format off
10168#ifdef WIN32
10169 #include <cstdio>
10170 #include <cerrno>
10171
10172 #include <winsock2.h>
10173 #include <iphlpapi.h>
10174 #include <ws2tcpip.h>
10175
10176 #include <iostream>
10177#else
10178 #ifdef __linux__
10179 #include <linux/sockios.h>
10180 #endif
10181
10182 #include <arpa/inet.h>
10183 #include <sys/ioctl.h>
10184 #include <sys/socket.h>
10185 #include <sys/types.h>
10186 #include <fcntl.h>
10187 #include <unistd.h>
10188#endif
10189
10190#ifndef WIN32
10191 #include <ifaddrs.h>
10192 #include <netdb.h>
10193#endif
10194// clang-format on
10195
10196#include <cstring>
10197#include <algorithm>
10198#include <array>
10199#include <iostream>
10200#include <iterator>
10201#include <sstream>
10202#include <utility>
10203#include <vector>
10204
10205namespace cluon {
10206
10207inline UDPReceiver::UDPReceiver(const std::string &receiveFromAddress,
10208 uint16_t receiveFromPort,
10209 std::function<void(std::string &&, std::string &&, std::chrono::system_clock::time_point &&)> delegate,
10210 uint16_t localSendFromPort) noexcept
10211 : m_localSendFromPort(localSendFromPort)
10212 , m_receiveFromAddress()
10213 , m_mreq()
10214 , m_readFromSocketThread()
10215 , m_delegate(std::move(delegate)) {
10216 // Decompose given address string to check validity with numerical IPv4 address.
10217 std::string tmp{cluon::getIPv4FromHostname(receiveFromAddress)};
10218 std::replace(tmp.begin(), tmp.end(), '.', ' ');
10219 std::istringstream sstr{tmp};
10220 std::vector<int> receiveFromAddressTokens{std::istream_iterator<int>(sstr), std::istream_iterator<int>()};
10221
10222 if ((!receiveFromAddress.empty()) && (4 == receiveFromAddressTokens.size())
10223 && !(std::end(receiveFromAddressTokens)
10224 != std::find_if(receiveFromAddressTokens.begin(), receiveFromAddressTokens.end(), [](int a) { return (a < 0) || (a > 255); }))
10225 && (0 < receiveFromPort)) {
10226 // Check for valid IP address.
10227 struct sockaddr_in tmpSocketAddress {};
10228 const bool isValid = (0 < ::inet_pton(AF_INET, receiveFromAddress.c_str(), &(tmpSocketAddress.sin_addr))) && (224 > receiveFromAddressTokens[0]);
10229
10230 // Check for UDP multicast, i.e., IP address range [225.0.0.1 - 239.255.255.255].
10231 m_isMulticast = (((224 < receiveFromAddressTokens[0]) && (receiveFromAddressTokens[0] <= 239))
10232 && ((0 <= receiveFromAddressTokens[1]) && (receiveFromAddressTokens[1] <= 255))
10233 && ((0 <= receiveFromAddressTokens[2]) && (receiveFromAddressTokens[2] <= 255))
10234 && ((1 <= receiveFromAddressTokens[3]) && (receiveFromAddressTokens[3] <= 255)));
10235
10236 std::memset(&m_receiveFromAddress, 0, sizeof(m_receiveFromAddress));
10237#ifdef WIN32
10238 // According to http://www.sockets.com/err_lst1.htm, the binding is
10239 // different on Windows opposed to POSIX when using the real address
10240 // here; thus, we need to use INADDR_ANY.
10241 m_receiveFromAddress.sin_addr.s_addr = (m_isMulticast ? htonl(INADDR_ANY) : ::inet_addr(receiveFromAddress.c_str()));
10242#else
10243 m_receiveFromAddress.sin_addr.s_addr = ::inet_addr(receiveFromAddress.c_str());
10244#endif
10245 m_receiveFromAddress.sin_family = AF_INET;
10246 m_receiveFromAddress.sin_port = htons(receiveFromPort);
10247
10248#ifdef WIN32
10249 // Load Winsock 2.2 DLL.
10250 WSADATA wsaData;
10251 if (WSAStartup(MAKEWORD(2, 2), &wsaData) != 0) {
10252 std::cerr << "[cluon::UDPReceiver] Error while calling WSAStartUp: " << WSAGetLastError() << std::endl;
10253 }
10254#endif
10255
10256 m_socket = ::socket(PF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP);
10257
10258#ifdef WIN32
10259 if (m_socket < 0) {
10260 std::cerr << "[cluon::UDPReceiver] Error while creating socket: " << WSAGetLastError() << std::endl;
10261 WSACleanup();
10262 }
10263#endif
10264
10265 if (!(m_socket < 0)) {
10266 // Allow reusing of ports by multiple calls with same address/port.
10267 uint32_t YES = 1;
10268 // clang-format off
10269 auto retVal = ::setsockopt(m_socket, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, reinterpret_cast<char *>(&YES), sizeof(YES)); // NOLINT
10270 // clang-format on
10271 if (0 > retVal) {
10272#ifdef WIN32 // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10273 auto errorCode = WSAGetLastError();
10274#else
10275 auto errorCode = errno; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10276#endif // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10277 closeSocket(errorCode); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10278 }
10279 }
10280
10281 if (!(m_socket < 0)) {
10282 // Trying to enable non_blocking mode.
10283#ifdef WIN32 // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10284 u_long nonBlocking = 1;
10285 m_isBlockingSocket = !(NO_ERROR == ::ioctlsocket(m_socket, FIONBIO, &nonBlocking));
10286#else
10287 const int FLAGS = ::fcntl(m_socket, F_GETFL, 0);
10288 m_isBlockingSocket = !(0 == ::fcntl(m_socket, F_SETFL, FLAGS | O_NONBLOCK));
10289#endif
10290 }
10291
10292 if (!(m_socket < 0)) {
10293 // Trying to enable non_blocking mode.
10294#ifdef WIN32 // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10295 u_long nonBlocking = 1;
10296 m_isBlockingSocket = !(NO_ERROR == ::ioctlsocket(m_socket, FIONBIO, &nonBlocking));
10297#else
10298 const int FLAGS = ::fcntl(m_socket, F_GETFL, 0);
10299 m_isBlockingSocket = !(0 == ::fcntl(m_socket, F_SETFL, FLAGS | O_NONBLOCK));
10300#endif
10301 }
10302
10303 if (!(m_socket < 0)) {
10304 // Try setting receiving buffer.
10305 int recvBuffer{26214400};
10306 auto retVal = ::setsockopt(m_socket, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF, reinterpret_cast<char *>(&recvBuffer), sizeof(recvBuffer));
10307 if (retVal < 0) {
10308#ifdef WIN32 // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10309 auto errorCode = WSAGetLastError();
10310#else
10311 auto errorCode = errno; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10312#endif // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10313 std::cerr << "[cluon::UDPReceiver] Error while trying to set SO_RCVBUF to " << recvBuffer << ": " << errorCode << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10314 }
10315 }
10316
10317 if (!(m_socket < 0)) {
10318 // Bind to receive address/port.
10319 // clang-format off
10320 auto retVal = ::bind(m_socket, reinterpret_cast<struct sockaddr *>(&m_receiveFromAddress), sizeof(m_receiveFromAddress)); // NOLINT
10321 // clang-format on
10322 if (0 > retVal) {
10323#ifdef WIN32 // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10324 auto errorCode = WSAGetLastError();
10325#else
10326 auto errorCode = errno; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10327#endif // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10328 closeSocket(errorCode); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10329 }
10330 }
10331
10332 if (!(m_socket < 0)) {
10333 if (m_isMulticast) {
10334 // Join the multicast group.
10335 m_mreq.imr_multiaddr.s_addr = ::inet_addr(receiveFromAddress.c_str());
10336 m_mreq.imr_interface.s_addr = htonl(INADDR_ANY);
10337 // clang-format off
10338 auto retval = ::setsockopt(m_socket, IPPROTO_IP, IP_ADD_MEMBERSHIP, reinterpret_cast<char *>(&m_mreq), sizeof(m_mreq)); // NOLINT
10339 // clang-format on
10340 if (0 > retval) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10341#ifdef WIN32 // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10342 closeSocket(WSAGetLastError());
10343#else
10344 closeSocket(errno); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10345#endif // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10346 }
10347 } else if (!isValid) {
10348 closeSocket(EBADF);
10349 }
10350 }
10351
10352 // Fill list of local IP address to avoid sending data to ourselves.
10353 if (!(m_socket < 0)) {
10354#ifdef WIN32
10355 DWORD size{0};
10356 if (ERROR_BUFFER_OVERFLOW == GetAdaptersAddresses(AF_UNSPEC, GAA_FLAG_INCLUDE_PREFIX, NULL, NULL, &size)) {
10357 PIP_ADAPTER_ADDRESSES adapters = reinterpret_cast<PIP_ADAPTER_ADDRESSES>(malloc(size));
10358 if (ERROR_SUCCESS == GetAdaptersAddresses(AF_UNSPEC, GAA_FLAG_INCLUDE_PREFIX, NULL, adapters, &size)) {
10359 for (PIP_ADAPTER_ADDRESSES adapter = adapters; nullptr != adapter; adapter = adapter->Next) {
10360 for (PIP_ADAPTER_UNICAST_ADDRESS unicastAddress = adapter->FirstUnicastAddress; unicastAddress != NULL;
10361 unicastAddress = unicastAddress->Next) {
10362 if (AF_INET == unicastAddress->Address.lpSockaddr->sa_family) {
10363 ::getnameinfo(unicastAddress->Address.lpSockaddr, unicastAddress->Address.iSockaddrLength, nullptr, 0, NULL, 0, NI_NUMERICHOST);
10364 std::memcpy(&tmpSocketAddress, unicastAddress->Address.lpSockaddr, sizeof(tmpSocketAddress)); /* Flawfinder: ignore */ // NOLINT
10365 const unsigned long LOCAL_IP = tmpSocketAddress.sin_addr.s_addr;
10366 m_listOfLocalIPAddresses.insert(LOCAL_IP);
10367 }
10368 }
10369 }
10370 }
10371 free(adapters);
10372 }
10373#else
10374 struct ifaddrs *interfaceAddress;
10375 if (0 == ::getifaddrs(&interfaceAddress)) {
10376 for (struct ifaddrs *it = interfaceAddress; nullptr != it; it = it->ifa_next) {
10377 if ((nullptr != it->ifa_addr) && (it->ifa_addr->sa_family == AF_INET)) {
10378 if (0 == ::getnameinfo(it->ifa_addr, sizeof(struct sockaddr_in), nullptr, 0, nullptr, 0, NI_NUMERICHOST)) {
10379 std::memcpy(&tmpSocketAddress, it->ifa_addr, sizeof(tmpSocketAddress)); /* Flawfinder: ignore */ // NOLINT
10380 const unsigned long LOCAL_IP = tmpSocketAddress.sin_addr.s_addr;
10381 m_listOfLocalIPAddresses.insert(LOCAL_IP);
10382 }
10383 }
10384 }
10385 ::freeifaddrs(interfaceAddress);
10386 }
10387#endif
10388 }
10389
10390 if (!(m_socket < 0)) {
10391 // Constructing the receiving thread could fail.
10392 try {
10393 m_readFromSocketThread = std::thread(&UDPReceiver::readFromSocket, this);
10394
10395 // Let the operating system spawn the thread.
10396 using namespace std::literals::chrono_literals; // NOLINT
10397 do { std::this_thread::sleep_for(1ms); } while (!m_readFromSocketThreadRunning.load());
10398 } catch (...) { closeSocket(ECHILD); } // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10399
10400 try {
10401 m_pipeline = std::make_shared<cluon::NotifyingPipeline<PipelineEntry>>(
10402 [this](PipelineEntry &&entry) { this->m_delegate(std::move(entry.m_data), std::move(entry.m_from), std::move(entry.m_sampleTime)); });
10403 if (m_pipeline) {
10404 // Let the operating system spawn the thread.
10405 using namespace std::literals::chrono_literals; // NOLINT
10406 do { std::this_thread::sleep_for(1ms); } while (!m_pipeline->isRunning());
10407 }
10408 } catch (...) { closeSocket(ECHILD); } // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10409 }
10410 }
10411}
10412
10413inline UDPReceiver::~UDPReceiver() noexcept {
10414 {
10415 m_readFromSocketThreadRunning.store(false);
10416
10417 // Joining the thread could fail.
10418 try {
10419 if (m_readFromSocketThread.joinable()) {
10420 m_readFromSocketThread.join();
10421 }
10422 } catch (...) {} // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10423 }
10424
10425 m_pipeline.reset();
10426
10427 closeSocket(0);
10428}
10429
10430inline void UDPReceiver::closeSocket(int errorCode) noexcept {
10431 if (0 != errorCode) {
10432 std::cerr << "[cluon::UDPReceiver] Failed to perform socket operation: ";
10433#ifdef WIN32
10434 std::cerr << errorCode << std::endl;
10435#else
10436 std::cerr << ::strerror(errorCode) << " (" << errorCode << ")" << std::endl;
10437#endif
10438 }
10439
10440 if (!(m_socket < 0)) {
10441 if (m_isMulticast) {
10442 // clang-format off
10443 auto retVal = ::setsockopt(m_socket, IPPROTO_IP, IP_DROP_MEMBERSHIP, reinterpret_cast<char *>(&m_mreq), sizeof(m_mreq)); // NOLINT
10444 // clang-format on
10445 if (0 > retVal) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10446 std::cerr << "[cluon::UDPReceiver] Failed to drop multicast membership" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10447 }
10448 }
10449
10450#ifdef WIN32
10451 ::shutdown(m_socket, SD_BOTH);
10452 ::closesocket(m_socket);
10453 WSACleanup();
10454#else
10455 ::shutdown(m_socket, SHUT_RDWR); // Disallow further read/write operations.
10456 ::close(m_socket);
10457#endif
10458 }
10459 m_socket = -1;
10460}
10461
10462inline bool UDPReceiver::isRunning() const noexcept {
10463 return (m_readFromSocketThreadRunning.load() && !TerminateHandler::instance().isTerminated.load());
10464}
10465
10466inline void UDPReceiver::readFromSocket() noexcept {
10467 // Create buffer to store data from socket.
10468 constexpr uint16_t MAX_LENGTH = static_cast<uint16_t>(UDPPacketSizeConstraints::MAX_SIZE_UDP_PACKET)
10469 - static_cast<uint16_t>(UDPPacketSizeConstraints::SIZE_IPv4_HEADER)
10470 - static_cast<uint16_t>(UDPPacketSizeConstraints::SIZE_UDP_HEADER);
10471 std::array<char, MAX_LENGTH> buffer{};
10472
10473 struct timeval timeout {};
10474
10475 // Define file descriptor set to watch for read operations.
10476 fd_set setOfFiledescriptorsToReadFrom{};
10477
10478 // Sender address and port.
10479 constexpr uint16_t MAX_ADDR_SIZE{1024};
10480 std::array<char, MAX_ADDR_SIZE> remoteAddress{};
10481
10482 struct sockaddr_storage remote {};
10483 socklen_t addrLength{sizeof(remote)};
10484
10485 // Indicate to main thread that we are ready.
10486 m_readFromSocketThreadRunning.store(true);
10487
10488 while (m_readFromSocketThreadRunning.load()) {
10489 // Define timeout for select system call. The timeval struct must be
10490 // reinitialized for every select call as it might be modified containing
10491 // the actual time slept.
10492 timeout.tv_sec = 0;
10493 timeout.tv_usec = 20 * 1000; // Check for new data with 50Hz.
10494
10495 FD_ZERO(&setOfFiledescriptorsToReadFrom); // NOLINT
10496 FD_SET(m_socket, &setOfFiledescriptorsToReadFrom); // NOLINT
10497 ::select(m_socket + 1, &setOfFiledescriptorsToReadFrom, nullptr, nullptr, &timeout);
10498
10499 ssize_t totalBytesRead{0};
10500 if (FD_ISSET(m_socket, &setOfFiledescriptorsToReadFrom)) { // NOLINT
10501 ssize_t bytesRead{0};
10502 do {
10503 bytesRead = ::recvfrom(m_socket,
10504 buffer.data(),
10505 buffer.max_size(),
10506 0,
10507 reinterpret_cast<struct sockaddr *>(&remote), // NOLINT
10508 reinterpret_cast<socklen_t *>(&addrLength)); // NOLINT
10509
10510 if ((0 < bytesRead) && (nullptr != m_delegate)) {
10511#ifdef __linux__
10512 std::chrono::system_clock::time_point timestamp;
10513 struct timeval receivedTimeStamp {};
10514 if (0 == ::ioctl(m_socket, SIOCGSTAMP, &receivedTimeStamp)) { // NOLINT
10515 // Transform struct timeval to C++ chrono.
10516 std::chrono::time_point<std::chrono::system_clock, std::chrono::microseconds> transformedTimePoint(
10517 std::chrono::microseconds(receivedTimeStamp.tv_sec * 1000000L + receivedTimeStamp.tv_usec));
10518 timestamp = std::chrono::time_point_cast<std::chrono::system_clock::duration>(transformedTimePoint);
10519 } else { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10520 // In case the ioctl failed, fall back to chrono. // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10521 timestamp = std::chrono::system_clock::now(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10522 }
10523#else
10524 std::chrono::system_clock::time_point timestamp = std::chrono::system_clock::now();
10525#endif
10526
10527 // Transform sender address to C-string.
10528 ::inet_ntop(remote.ss_family,
10529 &((reinterpret_cast<struct sockaddr_in *>(&remote))->sin_addr), // NOLINT
10530 remoteAddress.data(),
10531 remoteAddress.max_size());
10532 const unsigned long RECVFROM_IP{reinterpret_cast<struct sockaddr_in *>(&remote)->sin_addr.s_addr}; // NOLINT
10533 const uint16_t RECVFROM_PORT{ntohs(reinterpret_cast<struct sockaddr_in *>(&remote)->sin_port)}; // NOLINT
10534
10535 // Check if the bytes actually came from us.
10536 bool sentFromUs{false};
10537 {
10538 auto pos = m_listOfLocalIPAddresses.find(RECVFROM_IP);
10539 const bool sentFromLocalIP = (pos != m_listOfLocalIPAddresses.end() && (*pos == RECVFROM_IP));
10540 sentFromUs = sentFromLocalIP && (m_localSendFromPort == RECVFROM_PORT);
10541 }
10542
10543 // Create a pipeline entry to be processed concurrently.
10544 if (!sentFromUs) {
10545 PipelineEntry pe;
10546 pe.m_data = std::string(buffer.data(), static_cast<size_t>(bytesRead));
10547 pe.m_from = std::string(remoteAddress.data()) + ':' + std::to_string(RECVFROM_PORT);
10548 pe.m_sampleTime = timestamp;
10549
10550 // Store entry in queue.
10551 if (m_pipeline) {
10552 m_pipeline->add(std::move(pe));
10553 }
10554 }
10555 totalBytesRead += bytesRead;
10556 }
10557 } while (!m_isBlockingSocket && (bytesRead > 0));
10558 }
10559
10560 if (static_cast<int32_t>(totalBytesRead) > 0) {
10561 if (m_pipeline) {
10562 m_pipeline->notifyAll();
10563 }
10564 }
10565 }
10566}
10567} // namespace cluon
10568/*
10569 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
10570 *
10571 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
10572 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
10573 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
10574 */
10575
10576//#include "cluon/TCPConnection.hpp"
10577//#include "cluon/IPv4Tools.hpp"
10578//#include "cluon/TerminateHandler.hpp"
10579
10580// clang-format off
10581#ifdef WIN32
10582 #include <errno.h>
10583 #include <iostream>
10584#else
10585 #ifdef __linux__
10586 #include <linux/sockios.h>
10587 #endif
10588
10589 #include <arpa/inet.h>
10590 #include <sys/ioctl.h>
10591 #include <sys/socket.h>
10592 #include <sys/types.h>
10593 #include <unistd.h>
10594#endif
10595// clang-format on
10596
10597#include <cstring>
10598#include <algorithm>
10599#include <array>
10600#include <iostream>
10601#include <iterator>
10602#include <sstream>
10603#include <utility>
10604#include <vector>
10605
10606namespace cluon {
10607
10608inline TCPConnection::TCPConnection(const int32_t &socket) noexcept
10609 : m_socket(socket)
10610 , m_newDataDelegate(nullptr)
10611 , m_connectionLostDelegate(nullptr) {
10612 if (!(m_socket < 0)) {
10613 startReadingFromSocket();
10614 }
10615}
10616
10617inline TCPConnection::TCPConnection(const std::string &address,
10618 uint16_t port,
10619 std::function<void(std::string &&, std::chrono::system_clock::time_point &&)> newDataDelegate,
10620 std::function<void()> connectionLostDelegate) noexcept
10621 : m_newDataDelegate(std::move(newDataDelegate))
10622 , m_connectionLostDelegate(std::move(connectionLostDelegate)) {
10623 // Decompose given address string to check validity with numerical IPv4 address.
10624 std::string resolvedHostname{cluon::getIPv4FromHostname(address)};
10625 std::string tmp{resolvedHostname};
10626 std::replace(tmp.begin(), tmp.end(), '.', ' ');
10627 std::istringstream sstr{tmp};
10628 std::vector<int> addressTokens{std::istream_iterator<int>(sstr), std::istream_iterator<int>()};
10629
10630 if ((!addressTokens.empty()) && (4 == addressTokens.size())
10631 && !(std::end(addressTokens) != std::find_if(addressTokens.begin(), addressTokens.end(), [](int a) { return (a < 0) || (a > 255); })) && (0 < port)) {
10632 // Check for valid IP address.
10633 struct sockaddr_in tmpSocketAddress {};
10634 const bool isValid = (0 < ::inet_pton(AF_INET, resolvedHostname.c_str(), &(tmpSocketAddress.sin_addr)));
10635 if (isValid) {
10636 std::memset(&m_address, 0, sizeof(m_address));
10637 m_address.sin_addr.s_addr = ::inet_addr(resolvedHostname.c_str());
10638 m_address.sin_family = AF_INET;
10639 m_address.sin_port = htons(port);
10640#ifdef WIN32
10641 // Load Winsock 2.2 DLL.
10642 WSADATA wsaData;
10643 if (WSAStartup(MAKEWORD(2, 2), &wsaData) != 0) {
10644 std::cerr << "[cluon::TCPConnection] Error while calling WSAStartUp: " << WSAGetLastError() << std::endl;
10645 }
10646#endif
10647
10648 m_socket = ::socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, IPPROTO_TCP);
10649
10650#ifdef WIN32
10651 if (m_socket < 0) {
10652 std::cerr << "[cluon::TCPConnection] Error while creating socket: " << WSAGetLastError() << std::endl;
10653 WSACleanup();
10654 }
10655#endif
10656
10657 if (!(m_socket < 0)) {
10658 auto retVal = ::connect(m_socket, reinterpret_cast<struct sockaddr *>(&m_address), sizeof(m_address));
10659 if (0 > retVal) {
10660#ifdef WIN32 // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10661 auto errorCode = WSAGetLastError();
10662#else
10663 auto errorCode = errno; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10664#endif // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10665 closeSocket(errorCode); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10666 } else {
10667 startReadingFromSocket();
10668 }
10669 }
10670 }
10671 }
10672}
10673
10674inline TCPConnection::~TCPConnection() noexcept {
10675 {
10676 m_readFromSocketThreadRunning.store(false);
10677
10678 // Joining the thread could fail.
10679 try {
10680 if (m_readFromSocketThread.joinable()) {
10681 m_readFromSocketThread.join();
10682 }
10683 } catch (...) {} // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10684 }
10685
10686 m_pipeline.reset();
10687
10688 closeSocket(0);
10689}
10690
10691inline void TCPConnection::closeSocket(int errorCode) noexcept {
