14197//#include "cluon/EnvelopeConverter.hpp"
14198//#include "cluon/Envelope.hpp"
14199//#include "cluon/FromJSONVisitor.hpp"
14200//#include "cluon/FromProtoVisitor.hpp"
14201//#include "cluon/GenericMessage.hpp"
14202//#include "cluon/MessageParser.hpp"
14203//#include "cluon/Time.hpp"
14204//#include "cluon/ToJSONVisitor.hpp"
14205//#include "cluon/ToProtoVisitor.hpp"
14206//#include "cluon/any/any.hpp"
14207
14208#include <algorithm>
14209#include <sstream>
14210#include <utility>
14211
14212namespace cluon {
14213
14214inline int32_t EnvelopeConverter::setMessageSpecification(const std::string &ms) noexcept {
14215 int32_t retVal{-1};
14216
14217 m_listOfMetaMessages.clear();
14218 m_scopeOfMetaMessages.clear();
14219
14220 cluon::MessageParser mp;
14221 auto parsingResult = mp.parse(ms);
14222 if (cluon::MessageParser::MessageParserErrorCodes::NO_MESSAGEPARSER_ERROR == parsingResult.second) {
14223 m_listOfMetaMessages = parsingResult.first;
14224 for (const auto &mm : m_listOfMetaMessages) { m_scopeOfMetaMessages[mm.messageIdentifier()] = mm; }
14225 retVal = static_cast<int32_t>(m_listOfMetaMessages.size());
14226 }
14227 return retVal;
14228}
14229
14230inline std::string EnvelopeConverter::getJSONFromProtoEncodedEnvelope(const std::string &protoEncodedEnvelope) noexcept {
14231 std::string retVal{"{}"};
14232 if (!m_listOfMetaMessages.empty()) {
14233 cluon::data::Envelope envelope;
14234 std::stringstream sstr(protoEncodedEnvelope);
14235 constexpr uint8_t OD4_HEADER_SIZE{5};
14236 if (OD4_HEADER_SIZE < protoEncodedEnvelope.size()) {
14237 // Try decoding complete OD4-encoded Envelope including header.
14238 constexpr uint8_t byte0{0x0D};
14239 constexpr uint8_t byte1{0xA4};
14240 if ((static_cast<uint8_t>(protoEncodedEnvelope.at(0)) == byte0) && (static_cast<uint8_t>(protoEncodedEnvelope.at(1)) == byte1)) {
14241 uint32_t length = (*reinterpret_cast<const uint32_t *>(protoEncodedEnvelope.data() + 1));
14242 length = le32toh(length) >> 8;
14243 if ((OD4_HEADER_SIZE + length) == protoEncodedEnvelope.size()) {
14244 auto result{extractEnvelope(sstr)};
14245 if (result.first) {
14246 envelope = result.second;
14247 }
14248 }
14249 }
14250 }
14251
14252 if (0 == envelope.dataType()) {
14253 // Directly decoding complete OD4 container failed, try decoding without header.
14254 cluon::FromProtoVisitor protoDecoder;
14255 protoDecoder.decodeFrom(sstr, envelope);
14256 }
14257
14258 retVal = getJSONFromEnvelope(envelope);
14259 }
14260 return retVal;
14261}
14262
14263inline std::string EnvelopeConverter::getJSONFromEnvelope(cluon::data::Envelope &envelope) noexcept {
14264 std::string retVal{"{}"};
14265 if (!m_listOfMetaMessages.empty()) {
14266 if (0 < m_scopeOfMetaMessages.count(envelope.dataType())) {
14267 // First, create JSON from Envelope.
14268 constexpr bool OUTER_CURLY_BRACES{false};
14269 // Ignore field 2 (= serializedData) as it will be replaced below.
14270 const std::map<uint32_t, bool> mask{{2, false}};
14271 ToJSONVisitor envelopeToJSON{OUTER_CURLY_BRACES, mask};
14272 envelope.accept(envelopeToJSON);
14273
14274 std::stringstream sstr{envelope.serializedData()};
14275 cluon::FromProtoVisitor protoDecoder;
14276 protoDecoder.decodeFrom(sstr);
14277
14278 // Now, create JSON from payload.
14279 cluon::MetaMessage payload{m_scopeOfMetaMessages[envelope.dataType()]};
14280 cluon::GenericMessage gm;
14281
14282 // Create "empty" GenericMessage from this MetaMessage.
14283 gm.createFrom(payload, m_listOfMetaMessages);
14284
14285 // Set values in the newly created GenericMessage from ProtoDecoder.
14286 gm.accept(protoDecoder);
14287
14288 ToJSONVisitor payloadToJSON{OUTER_CURLY_BRACES};
14289 try {
14290 // Catch possible linb::any exception.
14291 gm.accept(payloadToJSON);
14292 } catch (const linb::bad_any_cast &) {} // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
14293
14294 std::string tmp{payload.messageName()};
14295 std::replace(tmp.begin(), tmp.end(), '.', '_');
14296
14297 const std::string strPayloadJSON{payloadToJSON.json() != "{}" ? payloadToJSON.json() : ""};
14298
14299 retVal = '{' + envelopeToJSON.json() + ',' + '\n' + '"' + tmp + '"' + ':' + '{' + strPayloadJSON + '}' + '}';
14300 }
14301 }
14302 return retVal;
14303}
14304
14305// clang-format off
14306inline std::string EnvelopeConverter::getProtoEncodedEnvelopeFromJSONWithoutTimeStamps(const std::string &json, int32_t messageIdentifier, uint32_t senderStamp) noexcept {
14307 // clang-format on
14308 return getProtoEncodedEnvelopeFromJSON(json, messageIdentifier, senderStamp, cluon::data::TimeStamp());
14309}
14310
14311// clang-format off
14312inline std::string EnvelopeConverter::getProtoEncodedEnvelopeFromJSON(const std::string &json, int32_t messageIdentifier, uint32_t senderStamp) noexcept {
14313 // clang-format on
14314 return getProtoEncodedEnvelopeFromJSON(json, messageIdentifier, senderStamp, cluon::time::now());
14315}
14316
14317// clang-format off
14318inline std::string EnvelopeConverter::getProtoEncodedEnvelopeFromJSON(const std::string &json, int32_t messageIdentifier, uint32_t senderStamp, cluon::data::TimeStamp sampleTimeStamp) noexcept {
14319 // clang-format on
14320 std::string retVal;
14321 if (0 < m_scopeOfMetaMessages.count(messageIdentifier)) {
14322 // Get specification for message to be created.
14323 cluon::MetaMessage message{m_scopeOfMetaMessages[messageIdentifier]};
14324
14325 // Create "empty" instance for the required message as GenericMessage.
14326 cluon::GenericMessage gm;
14327 gm.createFrom(message, m_listOfMetaMessages);
14328
14329 // Parse data from given JSON.
14330 std::stringstream sstr{json};
14331 cluon::FromJSONVisitor jsonDecoder;
14332 jsonDecoder.decodeFrom(sstr);
14333
14334 // Set values in the newly created GenericMessage from JSONDecoder.
14335 gm.accept(jsonDecoder);
14336
14337 // Finally, transform GenericMessage into Envelope.
14338 ToProtoVisitor protoEncoder;
14339 gm.accept(protoEncoder);
14340
14341 cluon::data::Envelope env;
14342 env.dataType(messageIdentifier).serializedData(protoEncoder.encodedData()).senderStamp(senderStamp).sampleTimeStamp(sampleTimeStamp);
14343
14344 retVal = cluon::serializeEnvelope(std::move(env));
14345 }
14346 return retVal;
14347}
14348
14349} // namespace cluon
14350/*
14351 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
14352 *
14353 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
14354 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
14355 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
14356 */
14357
14358//#include "cluon/Player.hpp"
14359//#include "cluon/Envelope.hpp"
14360//#include "cluon/Time.hpp"
14361
14362#include <algorithm>
14363#include <chrono>
14364#include <cmath>
14365#include <cstdio>
14366#include <fstream>
14367#include <iostream>
14368#include <limits>
14369#include <thread>
14370#include <utility>
14371
14372namespace cluon {
14373
14374inline IndexEntry::IndexEntry(const int64_t &sampleTimeStamp, const uint64_t &filePosition) noexcept
14375 : m_sampleTimeStamp(sampleTimeStamp)
14376 , m_filePosition(filePosition)
14377 , m_available(false) {}
14378
14380
14381inline Player::Player(const std::string &file, const bool &autoRewind, const bool &threading) noexcept
14382 : m_threading(threading)
14383 , m_file(file)
14384 , m_recFile()
14385 , m_recFileValid(false)
14386 , m_autoRewind(autoRewind)
14387 , m_indexMutex()
14388 , m_index()
14389 , m_previousPreviousEnvelopeAlreadyReplayed(m_index.end())
14390 , m_previousEnvelopeAlreadyReplayed(m_index.begin())
14391 , m_currentEnvelopeToReplay(m_index.begin())
14392 , m_nextEntryToReadFromRecFile(m_index.begin())
14393 , m_desiredInitialLevel(0)
14394 , m_firstTimePointReturningAEnvelope()
14395 , m_numberOfReturnedEnvelopesInTotal(0)
14396 , m_delay(0)
14397 , m_envelopeCacheFillingThreadIsRunningMutex()
14398 , m_envelopeCacheFillingThreadIsRunning(false)
14399 , m_envelopeCacheFillingThread()
14400 , m_envelopeCache()
14401 , m_playerListenerMutex()
14402 , m_playerListener(nullptr) {
14403 initializeIndex();
14404 computeInitialCacheLevelAndFillCache();
14405
14406 if (m_threading) {
14407 // Start concurrent thread to manage cache.
14408 setEnvelopeCacheFillingRunning(true);
14409 m_envelopeCacheFillingThread = std::thread(&Player::manageCache, this);
14410 }
14411}
14412
14413inline Player::~Player() {
14414 if (m_threading) {
14415 // Stop concurrent thread to manage cache.
14416 setEnvelopeCacheFillingRunning(false);
14417 m_envelopeCacheFillingThread.join();
14418 }
14419
14420 m_recFile.close();
14421}
14422
14424
14425inline void Player::setPlayerListener(std::function<void(cluon::data::PlayerStatus playerStatus)> playerListener) noexcept {
14426 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(m_playerListenerMutex);
14427 m_playerListener = playerListener;
14428}
14429
14431
14432inline void Player::initializeIndex() noexcept {
14433 m_recFile.open(m_file.c_str(), std::ios_base::in | std::ios_base::binary); /* Flawfinder: ignore */
14434 m_recFileValid = m_recFile.good();
14435
14436 if (m_recFileValid) {
14437 // Determine file size to display progress.
14438 m_recFile.seekg(0, m_recFile.end);
14439 int64_t fileLength = m_recFile.tellg();
14440 m_recFile.seekg(0, m_recFile.beg);
14441
14442 // Read complete file and store file positions to envelopes to create
14443 // index of available data. The actual reading of Envelopes is deferred.
14444 uint64_t totalBytesRead = 0;
14445 const cluon::data::TimeStamp BEFORE{cluon::time::now()};
14446 {
14447 int32_t oldPercentage = -1;
14448 while (m_recFile.good()) {
14449 const uint64_t POS_BEFORE = static_cast<uint64_t>(m_recFile.tellg());
14450 auto retVal = extractEnvelope(m_recFile);
14451 const uint64_t POS_AFTER = static_cast<uint64_t>(m_recFile.tellg());
14452
14453 if (!m_recFile.eof() && retVal.first) {
14454 totalBytesRead += (POS_AFTER - POS_BEFORE);
14455
14456 // Store mapping .rec file position --> index entry.
14457 const int64_t microseconds = cluon::time::toMicroseconds(retVal.second.sampleTimeStamp());
14458 m_index.emplace(std::make_pair(microseconds, IndexEntry(microseconds, POS_BEFORE)));
14459
14460 const int32_t percentage = static_cast<int32_t>((static_cast<float>(m_recFile.tellg()) * 100.0f) / static_cast<float>(fileLength));
14461 if ((percentage % 5 == 0) && (percentage != oldPercentage)) {
14462 std::clog << "[cluon::Player]: Indexed " << percentage << "% from " << m_file << "." << std::endl;
14463 oldPercentage = percentage;
14464 }
14465 }
14466 }
14467 }
14468 const cluon::data::TimeStamp AFTER{cluon::time::now()};
14469
14470 std::clog << "[cluon::Player]: " << m_file << " contains " << m_index.size() << " entries; "
14471 << "read " << totalBytesRead << " bytes "
14472 << "in " << cluon::time::deltaInMicroseconds(AFTER, BEFORE) / static_cast<int64_t>(1000 * 1000) << "s." << std::endl;
14473 } else {
14474 std::clog << "[cluon::Player]: " << m_file << " could not be opened." << std::endl;
14475 }
14476}
14477
14478inline void Player::resetCaches() noexcept {
14479 try {
14480 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(m_indexMutex);
14481 m_delay = 0;
14482 m_numberOfReturnedEnvelopesInTotal = 0;
14483 m_envelopeCache.clear();
14484 } catch (...) {} // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
14485}
14486
14487inline void Player::resetIterators() noexcept {
14488 try {
14489 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(m_indexMutex);
14490 // Point to first entry in index.
14491 m_nextEntryToReadFromRecFile = m_previousEnvelopeAlreadyReplayed = m_currentEnvelopeToReplay = m_index.begin();
14492 // Invalidate iterator for erasing entries point.
14493 m_previousPreviousEnvelopeAlreadyReplayed = m_index.end();
14494 } catch (...) {} // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
14495}
14496
14497inline void Player::computeInitialCacheLevelAndFillCache() noexcept {
14498 if (m_recFileValid && (m_index.size() > 0)) {
14499 int64_t smallestSampleTimePoint = (std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::max)();
14500 int64_t largestSampleTimePoint = (std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min)();
14501 for (auto it = m_index.begin(); it != m_index.end(); it++) {
14502 smallestSampleTimePoint = (std::min)(smallestSampleTimePoint, it->first);
14503 largestSampleTimePoint = (std::max)(largestSampleTimePoint, it->first);
14504 }
14505
14506 const uint32_t ENTRIES_TO_READ_PER_SECOND_FOR_REALTIME_REPLAY
14507 = static_cast<uint32_t>(std::ceil(static_cast<float>(m_index.size()) * (static_cast<float>(Player::ONE_SECOND_IN_MICROSECONDS))
14508 / static_cast<float>(largestSampleTimePoint - smallestSampleTimePoint)));
14509 m_desiredInitialLevel = (std::max<uint32_t>)(ENTRIES_TO_READ_PER_SECOND_FOR_REALTIME_REPLAY * Player::LOOK_AHEAD_IN_S, MIN_ENTRIES_FOR_LOOK_AHEAD);
14510
14511 std::clog << "[cluon::Player]: Initializing cache with " << m_desiredInitialLevel << " entries." << std::endl;
14512
14513 resetCaches();
14514 resetIterators();
14515 fillEnvelopeCache(m_desiredInitialLevel);
14516 }
14517}
14518
14519inline uint32_t Player::fillEnvelopeCache(const uint32_t &maxNumberOfEntriesToReadFromFile) noexcept {
14520 uint32_t entriesReadFromFile = 0;
14521 if (m_recFileValid && (maxNumberOfEntriesToReadFromFile > 0)) {
14522 // Reset any fstream's error states.
14523 m_recFile.clear();
14524
14525 while ((m_nextEntryToReadFromRecFile != m_index.end()) && (entriesReadFromFile < maxNumberOfEntriesToReadFromFile)) {
14526 // Move to corresponding position in the .rec file.
14527 m_recFile.seekg(static_cast<std::streamoff>(m_nextEntryToReadFromRecFile->second.m_filePosition));
14528
14529 // Read the corresponding cluon::data::Envelope.
14530 auto retVal = extractEnvelope(m_recFile);
14531 if (retVal.first) {
14532 // Store the envelope in the envelope cache.
14533 try {
14534 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(m_indexMutex);
14535 m_nextEntryToReadFromRecFile->second.m_available
14536 = m_envelopeCache.emplace(std::make_pair(m_nextEntryToReadFromRecFile->second.m_filePosition, retVal.second)).second;
14537 } catch (...) {} // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
14538
14539 m_nextEntryToReadFromRecFile++;
14540 entriesReadFromFile++;
14541 }
14542 }
14543 }
14544
14545 return entriesReadFromFile;
14546}
14547
14548inline std::pair<bool, cluon::data::Envelope> Player::getNextEnvelopeToBeReplayed() noexcept {
14549 bool hasEnvelopeToReturn{false};
14550 cluon::data::Envelope envelopeToReturn;
14551
14552 // If at "EOF", either throw exception or autorewind.
14553 if (m_currentEnvelopeToReplay == m_index.end()) {
14554 if (!m_autoRewind) {
14555 return std::make_pair(hasEnvelopeToReturn, envelopeToReturn);
14556 } else {
14557 rewind();
14558 }
14559 }
14560
14561 if (m_currentEnvelopeToReplay != m_index.end()) {
14562 checkAvailabilityOfNextEnvelopeToBeReplayed();
14563
14564 try {
14565 {
14566 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(m_indexMutex);
14567
14568 cluon::data::Envelope &nextEnvelope = m_envelopeCache[m_currentEnvelopeToReplay->second.m_filePosition];
14569 envelopeToReturn = nextEnvelope;
14570
14571 m_delay = static_cast<uint32_t>(m_currentEnvelopeToReplay->first - m_previousEnvelopeAlreadyReplayed->first);
14572
14573 // TODO: Delegate deleting into own thread.
14574 if (m_previousPreviousEnvelopeAlreadyReplayed != m_index.end()) {
14575 auto it = m_envelopeCache.find(m_previousEnvelopeAlreadyReplayed->second.m_filePosition);
14576 if (it != m_envelopeCache.end()) {
14577 m_envelopeCache.erase(it);
14578 }
14579 }
14580
14581 m_previousPreviousEnvelopeAlreadyReplayed = m_previousEnvelopeAlreadyReplayed;
14582 m_previousEnvelopeAlreadyReplayed = m_currentEnvelopeToReplay++;
14583
14584 m_numberOfReturnedEnvelopesInTotal++;
14585 }
14586
14587 // TODO compensate for internal data processing.
14588
14589 // If Player is non-threaded, read next entry sequentially.
14590 if (!m_threading) {
14591 fillEnvelopeCache(1);
14592 }
14593
14594 // Store sample time stamp as int64 to avoid unnecessary copying of Envelopes.
14595 hasEnvelopeToReturn = true;
14596 } catch (...) {} // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
14597 }
14598 return std::make_pair(hasEnvelopeToReturn, envelopeToReturn);
14599}
14600
14601inline void Player::checkAvailabilityOfNextEnvelopeToBeReplayed() noexcept {
14602 uint64_t numberOfEntries = 0;
14603 do {
14604 {
14605 try {
14606 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(m_indexMutex);
14607 numberOfEntries = m_envelopeCache.size();
14608 } catch (...) {} // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
14609 }
14610 if (0 == numberOfEntries) {
14611 using namespace std::chrono_literals; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
14612 std::this_thread::sleep_for(10ms); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
14613 }
14614 } while (0 == numberOfEntries);
14615}
14616
14618
14619inline uint32_t Player::totalNumberOfEnvelopesInRecFile() const noexcept {
14620 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(m_indexMutex);
14621 return static_cast<uint32_t>(m_index.size());
14622}
14623
14624inline uint32_t Player::delay() const noexcept {
14625 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(m_indexMutex);
14626 // Make sure that delay is not exceeding the specified maximum delay.
14627 return std::min<uint32_t>(m_delay, Player::MAX_DELAY_IN_MICROSECONDS);
14628}
14629
14630inline void Player::rewind() noexcept {
14631 if (m_threading) {
14632 // Stop concurrent thread.
14633 setEnvelopeCacheFillingRunning(false);
14634 m_envelopeCacheFillingThread.join();
14635 }
14636
14637 computeInitialCacheLevelAndFillCache();
14638
14639 if (m_threading) {
14640 // Re-start concurrent thread.
14641 setEnvelopeCacheFillingRunning(true);
14642 m_envelopeCacheFillingThread = std::thread(&Player::manageCache, this);
14643 }
14644}
14645
14646inline void Player::seekTo(float ratio) noexcept {
14647 if (!(ratio < 0) && !(ratio > 1)) {
14648 bool enableThreading = m_threading;
14649 if (m_threading) {
14650 // Stop concurrent thread.
14651 setEnvelopeCacheFillingRunning(false);
14652 m_envelopeCacheFillingThread.join();
14653 }
14654
14655 // Read data sequentially.
14656 m_threading = false;
14657
14658 resetCaches();
14659 resetIterators();
14660
14661 uint32_t numberOfEntriesInIndex = 0;
14662 try {
14663 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(m_indexMutex);
14664 numberOfEntriesInIndex = static_cast<uint32_t>(m_index.size());
14665 } catch (...) {} // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
14666
14667 // Fast forward.
14668 m_numberOfReturnedEnvelopesInTotal = 0;
14669 std::clog << "[cluon::Player]: Seeking to " << static_cast<float>(numberOfEntriesInIndex) * ratio << "/" << numberOfEntriesInIndex << std::endl;
14670 if (0 < ratio) {
14671 for (m_numberOfReturnedEnvelopesInTotal = 0;
14672 m_numberOfReturnedEnvelopesInTotal < static_cast<uint32_t>(static_cast<float>(numberOfEntriesInIndex) * ratio) - 1;
14673 m_numberOfReturnedEnvelopesInTotal++) {
14674 m_currentEnvelopeToReplay++;
14675 }
14676 }
14677 try {
14678 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(m_indexMutex);
14679 m_nextEntryToReadFromRecFile = m_previousEnvelopeAlreadyReplayed = m_currentEnvelopeToReplay;
14680 } catch (...) {} // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
14681
14682 // Refill cache.
14683 m_envelopeCache.clear();
14684 fillEnvelopeCache(static_cast<uint32_t>(static_cast<float>(m_desiredInitialLevel) * .3f));
14685
14686 // Correct iterators if not at the beginning.
14687 if ((0 < ratio) && (ratio < 1)) {
14688 getNextEnvelopeToBeReplayed();
14689 }
14690 std::clog << "[cluon::Player]: Seeking done." << std::endl;
14691
14692 if (enableThreading) {
14693 m_threading = enableThreading;
14694 // Re-start concurrent thread.
14695 setEnvelopeCacheFillingRunning(true);
14696 m_envelopeCacheFillingThread = std::thread(&Player::manageCache, this);
14697 }
14698 }
14699}
14700
14701inline bool Player::hasMoreData() const noexcept {
14702 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(m_indexMutex);
14703 return hasMoreDataFromRecFile();
14704}
14705
14706inline bool Player::hasMoreDataFromRecFile() const noexcept {
14707 // File must be successfully opened AND
14708 // the Player must be configured as m_autoRewind OR
14709 // some entries are left to replay.
14710 return (m_recFileValid && (m_autoRewind || (m_currentEnvelopeToReplay != m_index.end())));
14711}
14712
14714
14715inline void Player::setEnvelopeCacheFillingRunning(const bool &running) noexcept {
14716 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(m_envelopeCacheFillingThreadIsRunningMutex);
14717 m_envelopeCacheFillingThreadIsRunning = running;
14718}
14719
14720inline bool Player::isEnvelopeCacheFillingRunning() const noexcept {
14721 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(m_envelopeCacheFillingThreadIsRunningMutex);
14722 return m_envelopeCacheFillingThreadIsRunning;
14723}
14724
14725inline void Player::manageCache() noexcept {
14726 uint8_t statisticsCounter = 0;
14727 float refillMultiplicator = 1.1f;
14728 uint32_t numberOfEntries = 0;
14729
14730 while (isEnvelopeCacheFillingRunning()) {
14731 try {
14732 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(m_indexMutex);
14733 numberOfEntries = static_cast<uint32_t>(m_envelopeCache.size());
14734 } catch (...) {} // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
14735
14736 // Check if refilling of the cache is needed.
14737 refillMultiplicator = checkRefillingCache(numberOfEntries, refillMultiplicator);
14738 (void)refillMultiplicator;
14739
14740 // Manage cache at 10 Hz.
14741 using namespace std::chrono_literals;
14742 std::this_thread::sleep_for(100ms);
14743
14744 // Publish some statistics at 1 Hz.
14745 if (0 == ((++statisticsCounter) % 10)) {
14746 uint64_t numberOfReturnedEnvelopesInTotal = 0;
14747 uint32_t totalNumberOfEnvelopes = 0;
14748 try {
14749 // m_numberOfReturnedEnvelopesInTotal is modified in a different thread.
14750 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(m_indexMutex);
14751 numberOfReturnedEnvelopesInTotal = m_numberOfReturnedEnvelopesInTotal;
14752 totalNumberOfEnvelopes = static_cast<uint32_t>(m_index.size());
14753 } catch (...) {} // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
14754
14755 try {
14756 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(m_playerListenerMutex);
14757 if (nullptr != m_playerListener) {
14758 cluon::data::PlayerStatus ps;
14759 ps.state(2); // State: "playback"
14760 ps.numberOfEntries(totalNumberOfEnvelopes);
14761 ps.currentEntryForPlayback(static_cast<uint32_t>(numberOfReturnedEnvelopesInTotal));
14762 m_playerListener(ps);
14763 }
14764 } catch (...) {} // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
14765
14766 statisticsCounter = 0;
14767 }
14768 }
14769}
14770
14771inline float Player::checkRefillingCache(const uint32_t &numberOfEntries, float refillMultiplicator) noexcept {
14772 // If filling level is around 35%, pour in more from the recording.
14773 if (numberOfEntries < 0.35 * m_desiredInitialLevel) {
14774 const uint32_t entriesReadFromFile = fillEnvelopeCache(static_cast<uint32_t>(refillMultiplicator * static_cast<float>(m_desiredInitialLevel)));
14775 if (entriesReadFromFile > 0) {
14776 std::clog << "[cluon::Player]: Number of entries in cache: " << numberOfEntries << ". " << entriesReadFromFile << " added to cache. "
14777 << m_envelopeCache.size() << " entries available." << std::endl;
14778 refillMultiplicator *= 1.25f;
14779 }
14780 }
14781 return refillMultiplicator;
14782}
14783
14784} // namespace cluon
14785/*
14786 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
14787 *
14788 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
14789 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
14790 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
14791 */
14792
14793//#include "cluon/SharedMemory.hpp"
14794
14795// clang-format off
14796#ifdef WIN32
14797 #include <limits>
14798#else
14799 #include <cstdlib>
14800 #include <fcntl.h>
14801 #include <sys/ipc.h>
14802 #include <sys/mman.h>
14803 #include <sys/sem.h>
14804 #include <sys/shm.h>
14805 #include <sys/stat.h>
14806 #include <sys/time.h>
14807 #include <sys/types.h>
14808 #include <unistd.h>
14809#endif
14810// clang-format on
14811
14812#include <cerrno>
14813#include <cstring>
14814#include <iostream>
14815#include <fstream>
14816
14817#if !defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(__OpenBSD__) && (defined(_SEM_SEMUN_UNDEFINED) || !defined(__FreeBSD__))
14818union semun {
14819 int val; /* for SETVAL */
14820 struct semid_ds *buf; /* for IPC_STAT and IPC_SET */
14821 unsigned short *array; /* for GETALL and SETALL*/
14822};
14823#endif
14824
14825namespace cluon {
14826
14827inline SharedMemory::SharedMemory(const std::string &name, uint32_t size) noexcept
14828 : m_size(size) {
14829 if (!name.empty()) {
14830#ifdef WIN32
14831 constexpr int MAX_LENGTH_NAME{MAX_PATH};
14832#else
14833 constexpr int MAX_LENGTH_NAME{254};
14834#endif
14835 const std::string n{name.substr(0, (name.size() > MAX_LENGTH_NAME ? MAX_LENGTH_NAME : name.size()))};
14836 if ('/' != n[0]) {
14837 m_name = "/";
14838 }
14839
14840#ifndef WIN32
14841#if defined(__NetBSD__) || defined(__OpenBSD__)
14842 std::clog << "[cluon::SharedMemory] Found NetBSD or OpenBSD; using SysV implementation." << std::endl;
14843 m_usePOSIX = false;
14844#else
14845 const char *CLUON_SHAREDMEMORY_POSIX = getenv("CLUON_SHAREDMEMORY_POSIX");
14846 m_usePOSIX = ((nullptr != CLUON_SHAREDMEMORY_POSIX) && (CLUON_SHAREDMEMORY_POSIX[0] == '1'));
14847 std::clog << "[cluon::SharedMemory] Using " << (m_usePOSIX ? "POSIX" : "SysV") << " implementation." << std::endl;
14848#endif
14849 // Define filename for timestamping.
14850 if (0 != n.find("/tmp")) {
14851 m_nameForTimeStamping = "/tmp" + m_name;
14852
14853 // For NetBSD and OpenBSD or for the SysV-based implementation, we put all token files to /tmp.
14854 if (!m_usePOSIX) {
14855 m_name = m_nameForTimeStamping;
14856 }
14857 }
14858#endif
14859
14860 // Name of the shared memory.
14861 {
14862 m_name += n;
14863 if (m_name.size() > MAX_LENGTH_NAME) {
14864 m_name = m_name.substr(0, MAX_LENGTH_NAME);
14865 }
14866 }
14867
14868 // Name of the file for timestamping.
14869 {
14870 m_nameForTimeStamping += n;
14871 if (m_nameForTimeStamping.size() > MAX_LENGTH_NAME) {
14872 m_nameForTimeStamping = m_nameForTimeStamping.substr(0, MAX_LENGTH_NAME);
14873 }
14874 }
14875
14876#ifdef WIN32
14877 initWIN32();
14878#else
14879 if (m_usePOSIX) {
14880 initPOSIX();
14881 } else {
14882 initSysV();
14883 }
14884#endif
14885 }
14886}
14887
14888inline SharedMemory::~SharedMemory() noexcept {
14889#ifdef WIN32
14890 deinitWIN32();
14891#else
14892 if (m_usePOSIX) {
14893 deinitPOSIX();
14894 } else {
14895 deinitSysV();
14896 }
14897#endif
14898}
14899
14900inline bool SharedMemory::isLocked() const noexcept {
14901 return m_isLocked.load();
14902}
14903
14904inline void SharedMemory::lock() noexcept {
14905#ifdef WIN32
14906 lockWIN32();
14907#else
14908 if (m_usePOSIX) {
14909 lockPOSIX();
14910 } else {
14911 lockSysV();
14912 }
14913#endif
14914 m_isLocked.store(true);
14915}
14916
14917inline void SharedMemory::unlock() noexcept {
14918#ifdef WIN32
14919 unlockWIN32();
14920#else
14921 if (m_usePOSIX) {
14922 unlockPOSIX();
14923 } else {
14924 unlockSysV();
14925 }
14926#endif
14927 m_isLocked.store(false);
14928}
14929
14930inline void SharedMemory::wait() noexcept {
14931#ifdef WIN32
14932 waitWIN32();
14933#else
14934 if (m_usePOSIX) {
14935 waitPOSIX();
14936 } else {
14937 waitSysV();
14938 }
14939#endif
14940}
14941
14942inline void SharedMemory::notifyAll() noexcept {
14943#ifdef WIN32
14944 notifyAllWIN32();
14945#else
14946 if (m_usePOSIX) {
14947 notifyAllPOSIX();
14948 } else {
14949 notifyAllSysV();
14950 }
14951#endif
14952}
14953
14954inline bool SharedMemory::setTimeStamp(const cluon::data::TimeStamp &ts) noexcept {
14955 bool retVal{false};
14956
14957#ifdef WIN32
14958 (void)ts;
14959#else
14960 if ((retVal = isLocked())) {
14961#ifdef __APPLE__
14962 struct timeval accessedTime;
14963 accessedTime.tv_sec = 0;
14964 accessedTime.tv_usec = 0;
14965
14966 struct timeval modifiedTime;
14967 modifiedTime.tv_sec = ts.seconds();
14968 modifiedTime.tv_usec = ts.microseconds();
14969
14970 struct timeval times[2]{accessedTime, modifiedTime};
14971 if (0 != futimes(m_fdForTimeStamping, times)) {
14972 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory] Failed to set time stamp: '" << strerror(errno) << "' (" << errno << "): " << std::endl;
14973 retVal = false;
14974 }
14975#else
14976 struct timespec accessedTime;
14977 accessedTime.tv_sec = 0;
14978 accessedTime.tv_nsec = UTIME_OMIT;
14979
14980 struct timespec modifiedTime;
14981 modifiedTime.tv_sec = ts.seconds();
14982 modifiedTime.tv_nsec = ts.microseconds()*1000;
14983
14984 struct timespec times[2]{accessedTime, modifiedTime};
14985 if (0 != futimens(m_fdForTimeStamping, times)) {
14986 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory] Failed to set time stamp: '" << strerror(errno) << "' (" << errno << "): " << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
14987 retVal = false; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
14988 }
14989#endif
14990 }
14991#endif
14992
14993 return retVal;
14994}
14995
14996inline std::pair<bool, cluon::data::TimeStamp> SharedMemory::getTimeStamp() noexcept {
14997 bool retVal{false};
14998 cluon::data::TimeStamp sampleTimeStamp;
14999
15000#ifndef WIN32
15001 if ((retVal = isLocked())) {
15002 struct stat fileStatus;
15003 auto r = fstat(m_fdForTimeStamping, &fileStatus);
15004 if (0 == r) {
15005#ifdef __APPLE__
15006 sampleTimeStamp.seconds(static_cast<int32_t>(fileStatus.st_mtimespec.tv_sec))
15007 .microseconds(static_cast<int32_t>(fileStatus.st_mtimespec.tv_nsec/1000));
15008#else
15009 sampleTimeStamp.seconds(static_cast<int32_t>(fileStatus.st_mtim.tv_sec))
15010 .microseconds(static_cast<int32_t>(fileStatus.st_mtim.tv_nsec/1000));
15011#endif
15012 }
15013 }
15014#endif
15015
15016 return std::make_pair(retVal, sampleTimeStamp);
15017}
15018
15019inline bool SharedMemory::valid() noexcept {
15020 bool valid{!m_broken.load()};
15021 valid &= (nullptr != m_sharedMemory);
15022 valid &= (0 < m_size);
15023#ifndef WIN32
15024 if (m_usePOSIX) {
15025 valid &= validPOSIX();
15026 } else {
15027 valid &= validSysV();
15028 }
15029#endif
15030 return valid;
15031}
15032
15033inline char *SharedMemory::data() noexcept {
15034 return m_userAccessibleSharedMemory;
15035}
15036
15037inline uint32_t SharedMemory::size() const noexcept {
15038 return m_size;
15039}
15040
15041inline const std::string SharedMemory::name() const noexcept {
15042 return m_name;
15043}
15044
15046// Platform-dependent implementations.
15047#ifdef WIN32
15048inline void SharedMemory::initWIN32() noexcept {
15049 std::string mutexName = m_name;
15050 if (mutexName.size() > MAX_PATH) {
15051 mutexName = mutexName.substr(0, MAX_PATH - 6);
15052 }
15053 const std::string conditionEventName = mutexName + "_event";
15054 mutexName += "_mutex";
15055
15056 if (0 < m_size) {
15057 // Create a shared memory area and semaphores.
15058 const LONG MUTEX_INITIAL_COUNT = 1;
15059 const LONG MUTEX_MAX_COUNT = 1;
15060 const DWORD FLAGS = 0; // Reserved.
15061 __mutex = CreateSemaphoreEx(NULL, MUTEX_INITIAL_COUNT, MUTEX_MAX_COUNT, mutexName.c_str(), FLAGS, SEMAPHORE_ALL_ACCESS);
15062 if (nullptr != __mutex) {
15063 __conditionEvent = CreateEvent(
15064 NULL /*use default security*/, TRUE /*manually resetting event*/, FALSE /*initial state is not signaled*/, conditionEventName.c_str());
15065 if (nullptr != __conditionEvent) {
15066 __sharedMemory = CreateFileMapping(INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE /*use paging file*/,
15067 NULL /*use default security*/,
15068 PAGE_READWRITE,
15069 0,
15070 m_size + sizeof(uint32_t) /*size + size-information (uint32_t)*/,
15071 m_name.c_str());
15072 if (nullptr != __sharedMemory) {
15073 m_sharedMemory = (char *)MapViewOfFile(__sharedMemory, FILE_MAP_ALL_ACCESS, 0, 0, m_size + sizeof(uint32_t));
15074 if (nullptr != m_sharedMemory) {
15075 // Provide size information at the beginning of the shared memory.
15076 *(uint32_t *)m_sharedMemory = m_size;
15077 m_userAccessibleSharedMemory = m_sharedMemory + sizeof(uint32_t);
15078 } else {
15079 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory] Failed to map shared memory '" << m_name << "': "
15080 << " (" << GetLastError() << ")" << std::endl;
15081 CloseHandle(__sharedMemory);
15082 __sharedMemory = nullptr;
15083
15084 CloseHandle(__conditionEvent);
15085 __conditionEvent = nullptr;
15086
15087 CloseHandle(__mutex);
15088 __mutex = nullptr;
15089 }
15090 } else {
15091 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory] Failed to request shared memory '" << m_name << "': "
15092 << " (" << GetLastError() << ")" << std::endl;
15093 CloseHandle(__conditionEvent);
15094 __conditionEvent = nullptr;
15095
15096 CloseHandle(__mutex);
15097 __mutex = nullptr;
15098 }
15099 } else {
15100 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory] Failed to request event '" << conditionEventName << "': "
15101 << " (" << GetLastError() << ")" << std::endl;
15102 CloseHandle(__conditionEvent);
15103 __conditionEvent = nullptr;
15104
15105 CloseHandle(__mutex);
15106 __mutex = nullptr;
15107 }
15108 } else {
15109 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory] Failed to create mutex '" << mutexName << "': "
15110 << " (" << GetLastError() << ")" << std::endl;
15111 CloseHandle(__mutex);
15112 __mutex = nullptr;
15113 }
15114 } else {
15115 // Open a shared memory area and semaphores.
15116 m_hasOnlyAttachedToSharedMemory = true;
15117 const BOOL INHERIT_HANDLE = FALSE;
15118 __mutex = OpenSemaphore(SEMAPHORE_ALL_ACCESS, INHERIT_HANDLE, mutexName.c_str());
15119 if (nullptr != __mutex) {
15120 __conditionEvent = OpenEvent(EVENT_ALL_ACCESS, FALSE /*do not inherit the name*/, conditionEventName.c_str());
15121 if (nullptr != __conditionEvent) {
15122 __sharedMemory = OpenFileMapping(FILE_MAP_ALL_ACCESS, FALSE /*do not inherit the name*/, m_name.c_str());
15123 if (nullptr != __sharedMemory) {
15124 // Firstly, map only for the size of a uint32_t to read the entire size.
15125 m_sharedMemory = (char *)MapViewOfFile(__sharedMemory, FILE_MAP_ALL_ACCESS, 0, 0, sizeof(uint32_t));
15126 if (nullptr != m_sharedMemory) {
15127 // Now, read the real size...
15128 m_size = *(uint32_t *)m_sharedMemory;
15129 // ..unmap and re-map.
15130 UnmapViewOfFile(m_sharedMemory);
15131 m_sharedMemory = (char *)MapViewOfFile(__sharedMemory, FILE_MAP_ALL_ACCESS, 0, 0, m_size + sizeof(uint32_t));
15132 if (nullptr != m_sharedMemory) {
15133 m_userAccessibleSharedMemory = m_sharedMemory + sizeof(uint32_t);
15134 } else {
15135 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory] Failed to finally map shared memory '" << m_name << "': "
15136 << " (" << GetLastError() << ")" << std::endl;
15137 CloseHandle(__sharedMemory);
15138 __sharedMemory = nullptr;
15139
15140 CloseHandle(__conditionEvent);
15141 __conditionEvent = nullptr;
15142
15143 CloseHandle(__mutex);
15144 __mutex = nullptr;
15145 }
15146 } else {
15147 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory] Failed to temporarily map shared memory '" << m_name << "': "
15148 << " (" << GetLastError() << ")" << std::endl;
15149 CloseHandle(__sharedMemory);
15150 __sharedMemory = nullptr;
15151
15152 CloseHandle(__conditionEvent);
15153 __conditionEvent = nullptr;
15154
15155 CloseHandle(__mutex);
15156 __mutex = nullptr;
15157 }
15158 } else {
15159 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory] Failed to open shared memory '" << m_name << "': "
15160 << " (" << GetLastError() << ")" << std::endl;
15161 CloseHandle(__conditionEvent);
15162 __conditionEvent = nullptr;
15163
15164 CloseHandle(__mutex);
15165 __mutex = nullptr;
15166 }
15167 } else {
15168 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory] Failed to open event '" << conditionEventName << "': "
15169 << " (" << GetLastError() << ")" << std::endl;
15170 CloseHandle(__conditionEvent);
15171 __conditionEvent = nullptr;
15172
15173 CloseHandle(__mutex);
15174 __mutex = nullptr;
15175 }
15176 } else {
15177 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory] Failed to open mutex '" << mutexName << "': "
15178 << " (" << GetLastError() << ")" << std::endl;
15179 CloseHandle(__mutex);
15180 __mutex = nullptr;
15181 }
15182 }
15183}
15184
15185inline void SharedMemory::deinitWIN32() noexcept {
15186 if (nullptr != __conditionEvent) {
15187 SetEvent(__conditionEvent);
15188 CloseHandle(__conditionEvent);
15189 }
15190 if (nullptr != __mutex) {
15191 unlock();
15192 CloseHandle(__mutex);
15193 }
15194 if (nullptr != m_sharedMemory) {
15195 UnmapViewOfFile(m_sharedMemory);
15196 }
15197 if (nullptr != __sharedMemory) {
15198 CloseHandle(__sharedMemory);
15199 }
15200}
15201
15202inline void SharedMemory::lockWIN32() noexcept {
15203 if (nullptr != __mutex) {
15204 if (0 != WaitForSingleObject(__mutex, INFINITE)) {
15205 m_broken.store(true);
15206 }
15207 }
15208}
15209
15210inline void SharedMemory::unlockWIN32() noexcept {
15211 if (nullptr != __mutex) {
15212 const LONG RELEASE_COUNT = 1;
15213 if (/* Testing for equality with 0 is correct according to MSDN reference. */ 0 == ReleaseSemaphore(__mutex, RELEASE_COUNT, 0)) {
15214 m_broken.store(true);
15215 }
15216 }
15217}
15218
15219inline void SharedMemory::waitWIN32() noexcept {
15220 if (nullptr != __conditionEvent) {
15221 if (0 != WaitForSingleObject(__conditionEvent, INFINITE)) {
15222 m_broken.store(true);
15223 }
15224 }
15225}
15226
15227inline void SharedMemory::notifyAllWIN32() noexcept {
15228 if (nullptr != __conditionEvent) {
15229 if (/* Testing for equality with 0 is correct according to MSDN reference. */ 0 == SetEvent(__conditionEvent)) {
15230 m_broken.store(true);
15231 }
15232 if (/* Testing for equality with 0 is correct according to MSDN reference. */ 0 == ResetEvent(__conditionEvent)) {
15233 m_broken.store(true);
15234 }
15235 }
15236}
15237
15238#else /* POSIX and SysV */
15239
15240inline void SharedMemory::initPOSIX() noexcept {
15241#if !defined(__NetBSD__) && !defined(__OpenBSD__)
15242 // If size is greater than 0, the caller wants to create a new shared
15243 // memory area. Otherwise, the caller wants to open an existing shared memory.
15244 int flags = O_RDWR;
15245 if (0 < m_size) {
15246 flags |= O_CREAT | O_EXCL;
15247 }
15248
15249 m_fd = ::shm_open(m_name.c_str(), flags, S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR);
15250 if (-1 == m_fd) {
15251// clang-format off
15252 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (POSIX)] Failed to open shared memory '" << m_name << "': " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl;
15253// clang-format on
15254 // Try to remove existing shared memory segment and try again.
15255 if ((flags & O_CREAT) == O_CREAT) {
15256 std::clog << "[cluon::SharedMemory (POSIX)] Trying to remove existing shared memory '" << m_name << "' and trying again... ";
15257 if (0 == ::shm_unlink(m_name.c_str())) {
15258 m_fd = ::shm_open(m_name.c_str(), flags, S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR);
15259 }
15260
15261 if (-1 == m_fd) {
15262 std::cerr << "failed: " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15263 } else {
15264 std::cerr << "succeeded." << std::endl;
15265 }
15266 }
15267 }
15268
15269 if (-1 != m_fd) {
15270 bool retVal{true};
15271
15272 // When creating a shared memory segment, truncate it.
15273 if (0 < m_size) {
15274 retVal = (0 == ::ftruncate(m_fd, static_cast<off_t>(sizeof(SharedMemoryHeader) + m_size)));
15275 if (!retVal) {
15276// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15277 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (POSIX)] Failed to truncate '" << m_name << "': " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15278// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15279 }
15280 }
15281
15282 // Accessing shared memory segment.
15283 if (retVal) {
15284 // On opening (i.e., NOT creating) a shared memory segment, m_size is still 0 and we need to figure out the size first.
15285 m_sharedMemory = static_cast<char *>(::mmap(0, sizeof(SharedMemoryHeader) + m_size, PROT_READ | PROT_WRITE, MAP_SHARED, m_fd, 0));
15286 if (MAP_FAILED != m_sharedMemory) {
15287 m_sharedMemoryHeader = reinterpret_cast<SharedMemoryHeader *>(m_sharedMemory);
15288
15289 // On creating (i.e., NOT opening) a shared memory segment, setup the shared memory header.
15290 if (0 < m_size) {
15291 // Store user accessible size in shared memory.
15292 m_sharedMemoryHeader->__size = m_size;
15293
15294 // Create process-shared mutex (fastest approach, cf. Stevens & Rago: "Advanced Programming in the UNIX (R) Environment").
15295 pthread_mutexattr_t mutexAttribute;
15296 ::pthread_mutexattr_init(&mutexAttribute);
15297 ::pthread_mutexattr_setpshared(&mutexAttribute, PTHREAD_PROCESS_SHARED); // Share between unrelated processes.
15298#ifndef __APPLE__
15299 ::pthread_mutexattr_setrobust(&mutexAttribute, PTHREAD_MUTEX_ROBUST); // Allow continuation of other processes waiting for this mutex
15300 // when the currently holding process unexpectedly terminates.
15301#endif
15302 ::pthread_mutexattr_settype(&mutexAttribute, PTHREAD_MUTEX_NORMAL); // Using regular mutex with deadlock behavior.
15303 ::pthread_mutex_init(&(m_sharedMemoryHeader->__mutex), &mutexAttribute);
15304 ::pthread_mutexattr_destroy(&mutexAttribute);
15305
15306 // Create shared condition.
15307 pthread_condattr_t conditionAttribute;
15308 ::pthread_condattr_init(&conditionAttribute);
15309#ifndef __APPLE__
15310 ::pthread_condattr_setclock(&conditionAttribute, CLOCK_MONOTONIC); // Use realtime clock for timed waits with non-negative jumps.
15311#endif
15312 ::pthread_condattr_setpshared(&conditionAttribute, PTHREAD_PROCESS_SHARED); // Share between unrelated processes.
15313 ::pthread_cond_init(&(m_sharedMemoryHeader->__condition), &conditionAttribute);
15314 ::pthread_condattr_destroy(&conditionAttribute);
15315 } else {
15316 // Indicate that this instance is attaching to an existing shared memory segment.
15317 m_hasOnlyAttachedToSharedMemory = true;
15318
15319 // Read size as we are attaching to an existing shared memory.
15320 m_size = m_sharedMemoryHeader->__size;
15321
15322 // Now, as we know the real size, unmap the first mapping that did not know the size.
15323 if (::munmap(m_sharedMemory, sizeof(SharedMemoryHeader))) {
15324// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15325 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (POSIX)] Failed to unmap shared memory: " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15326// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15327 }
15328
15329 // Invalidate all pointers.
15330 m_sharedMemory = nullptr;
15331 m_sharedMemoryHeader = nullptr;
15332
15333 // Re-map with the correct size parameter.
15334 m_sharedMemory = static_cast<char *>(::mmap(0, sizeof(SharedMemoryHeader) + m_size, PROT_READ | PROT_WRITE, MAP_SHARED, m_fd, 0));
15335 if (MAP_FAILED != m_sharedMemory) {
15336 m_sharedMemoryHeader = reinterpret_cast<SharedMemoryHeader *>(m_sharedMemory);
15337 }
15338 }
15339 } else { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15340// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15341 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (POSIX)] Failed to map '" << m_name << "': " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15342// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15343 }
15344
15345 // If the shared memory segment is correctly available, store the pointer for the user data.
15346 if (MAP_FAILED != m_sharedMemory) {
15347 m_userAccessibleSharedMemory = m_sharedMemory + sizeof(SharedMemoryHeader);
15348
15349 // Lock the shared memory into RAM for performance reasons.
15350 if (-1 == ::mlock(m_sharedMemory, sizeof(SharedMemoryHeader) + m_size)) {
15351 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (POSIX)] Failed to mlock shared memory: " // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15352 << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15353 }
15354 }
15355 } else { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15356 if (-1 != m_fd) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15357 if (-1 == ::shm_unlink(m_name.c_str())) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15358// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15359 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (POSIX)] Failed to unlink shared memory: " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15360// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15361 }
15362 }
15363 m_fd = -1; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15364 }
15365 }
15366#endif
15367
15368#ifdef __linux__
15369 // On Linux, the POSIX shared memory lives in /dev/shm and we have a valid
15370 // file descriptor to use for timestamping.
15371 if (-1 != m_fd) {
15372 m_fdForTimeStamping = m_fd;
15373 }
15374#else
15375#if !defined(__NetBSD__) && !defined(__OpenBSD__)
15376 // On *BSDs, the POSIX shared memory lives not in /dev/shm and we have
15377 // need to use a separate file for timestamping.
15378 if (-1 != m_fd) {
15379 m_fdForTimeStamping = ::open(m_nameForTimeStamping.c_str(), O_CREAT|O_RDONLY, S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR | S_IRGRP | S_IWGRP | S_IROTH | S_IWOTH);
15380 }
15381#endif
15382#endif
15383}
15384
15385inline void SharedMemory::deinitPOSIX() noexcept {
15386#if !defined(__NetBSD__) && !defined(__OpenBSD__)
15387 if ((nullptr != m_sharedMemoryHeader) && (!m_hasOnlyAttachedToSharedMemory)) {
15388 // Wake any waiting threads as we are going to end the shared memory session.
15389 ::pthread_cond_broadcast(&(m_sharedMemoryHeader->__condition));
15390 ::pthread_cond_destroy(&(m_sharedMemoryHeader->__condition));
15391 ::pthread_mutex_destroy(&(m_sharedMemoryHeader->__mutex));
15392 }
15393 if ((nullptr != m_sharedMemory) && ::munmap(m_sharedMemory, sizeof(SharedMemoryHeader) + m_size)) {
15394// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15395 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (POSIX)] Failed to unmap shared memory: " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15396// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15397 }
15398 if (!m_hasOnlyAttachedToSharedMemory && (-1 != m_fd) && (-1 == ::shm_unlink(m_name.c_str()) && (ENOENT != errno))) {
15399// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15400 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (POSIX)] Failed to unlink shared memory: " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15401// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15402 }
15403#endif
15404
15405#ifndef __linux__
15406 // On *BSDs, the POSIX shared memory lives not in /dev/shm and we have
15407 // used a separate file for timestamping.
15408 if (-1 != m_fdForTimeStamping) {
15409 ::close(m_fdForTimeStamping);
15410 ::unlink(m_nameForTimeStamping.c_str());
15411 }
15412#endif
15413}
15414
15415inline void SharedMemory::lockPOSIX() noexcept {
15416#if !defined(__NetBSD__) && !defined(__OpenBSD__)
15417 if (nullptr != m_sharedMemoryHeader) {
15418 auto retVal = ::pthread_mutex_lock(&(m_sharedMemoryHeader->__mutex));
15419 if (EOWNERDEAD == retVal) {
15420// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15421 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (POSIX)] pthread_mutex_lock returned for EOWNERDEAD for mutex in shared memory '" << m_name << "': " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15422// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15423 } else if (0 != retVal) {
15424 m_broken.store(true); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15425 }
15426 }
15427#endif
15428}
15429
15430inline void SharedMemory::unlockPOSIX() noexcept {
15431#if !defined(__NetBSD__) && !defined(__OpenBSD__)
15432 if (nullptr != m_sharedMemoryHeader) {
15433 if (0 != ::pthread_mutex_unlock(&(m_sharedMemoryHeader->__mutex))) {
15434 m_broken.store(true); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15435 }
15436 }
15437#endif
15438}
15439
15440inline void SharedMemory::waitPOSIX() noexcept {
15441#if !defined(__NetBSD__) && !defined(__OpenBSD__)
15442 if (nullptr != m_sharedMemoryHeader) {
15443 lock();
15444 if (0 != ::pthread_cond_wait(&(m_sharedMemoryHeader->__condition), &(m_sharedMemoryHeader->__mutex))) {
15445 m_broken.store(true); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15446 }
15447 unlock();
15448 }
15449#endif
15450}
15451
15452inline void SharedMemory::notifyAllPOSIX() noexcept {
15453#if !defined(__NetBSD__) && !defined(__OpenBSD__)
15454 if (nullptr != m_sharedMemoryHeader) {
15455 if (0 != ::pthread_cond_broadcast(&(m_sharedMemoryHeader->__condition))) {
15456 m_broken.store(true); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15457 }
15458 }
15459#endif
15460}
15461
15462inline bool SharedMemory::validPOSIX() noexcept {
15463#if !defined(__NetBSD__) && !defined(__OpenBSD__)
15464 return (-1 != m_fd) && (MAP_FAILED != m_sharedMemory);
15465#else
15466 return false;
15467#endif
15468}
15469
15471
15472inline void SharedMemory::initSysV() noexcept {
15473 // If size is greater than 0, the caller wants to create a new shared
15474 // memory area. Otherwise, the caller wants to open an existing shared memory.
15475
15476 // Create a key to identify the shared memory area.
15477 constexpr int32_t ID_SHM = 1;
15478 constexpr int32_t ID_SEM_AS_MUTEX = 2;
15479 constexpr int32_t ID_SEM_AS_CONDITION = 3;
15480 bool tokenFileExisting{false};
15481
15482 if (0 < m_size) {
15483 // The file should not exist; otherwise, we need to clear an existing
15484 // set of semaphores and shared memory areas.
15485 std::fstream tokenFile(m_name.c_str(), std::ios::in);
15486 if (tokenFile.good()) {
15487 // Existing tokenFile found. Cleaning up will be tried in the code below.
15488 }
15489 tokenFile.close();
15490
15491 tokenFile.open(m_name.c_str(), std::ios::out);
15492 tokenFileExisting = tokenFile.good();
15493 if (!tokenFileExisting) {
15494 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Token file '" << m_name << "' could not be created; shared memory cannot be created." << std::endl;
15495 }
15496 tokenFile.close();
15497 } else {
15498 // Open an existing shared memory area indicated by an existing token file.
15499 m_hasOnlyAttachedToSharedMemory = true;
15500
15501 std::fstream tokenFile(m_name.c_str(), std::ios::in);
15502 tokenFileExisting = tokenFile.good();
15503 if (!tokenFileExisting) {
15504 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Token file '" << m_name << "' not found; shared memory cannot be created." << std::endl;
15505 }
15506 tokenFile.close();
15507 }
15508
15509 // We have a token file to be used for the keys.
15510 if (tokenFileExisting) {
15511 m_shmKeySysV = ::ftok(m_name.c_str(), ID_SHM);
15512 if (-1 == m_shmKeySysV) {
15513// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15514 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Key for shared memory could not be created: " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15515// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15516 } else {
15517 if (!m_hasOnlyAttachedToSharedMemory) {
15518 // The caller wants to create a shared memory segment.
15519
15520 // First, try to clean up an orphaned shared memory segment.
15521 // Therefore, we try to open the shared memory area without the
15522 // IPC_CREAT flag. On a clean environment, this call must fail
15523 // as there should not be any shared memory segments left.
15524 {
15525 int orphanedSharedMemoryIDSysV = ::shmget(m_shmKeySysV, 0, S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR | S_IRGRP | S_IWGRP | S_IROTH | S_IWOTH);
15526 if (!(orphanedSharedMemoryIDSysV < 0)) {
15527 if (::shmctl(orphanedSharedMemoryIDSysV, IPC_RMID, 0)) {
15528// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15529 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Existing shared memory (0x" << std::hex << m_shmKeySysV << std::dec << ") found; removing failed." << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15530// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15531 }
15532 }
15533 }
15534
15535 // Now, create the shared memory segment.
15536 m_sharedMemoryIDSysV = ::shmget(m_shmKeySysV, m_size, IPC_CREAT | IPC_EXCL | S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR | S_IRGRP | S_IWGRP | S_IROTH | S_IWOTH);
15537 if (-1 != m_sharedMemoryIDSysV) {
15538 m_sharedMemory = reinterpret_cast<char *>(::shmat(m_sharedMemoryIDSysV, nullptr, 0));
15539#pragma GCC diagnostic push
15540#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wold-style-cast"
15541 if ((void *)-1 != m_sharedMemory) {
15542 m_userAccessibleSharedMemory = m_sharedMemory;
15543 } else { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15544// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15545 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Failed to attach to shared memory (0x" << std::hex << m_shmKeySysV << std::dec << "): " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15546// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15547 }
15548#pragma GCC diagnostic pop
15549 } else { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15550// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15551 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Failed to get to shared memory (0x" << std::hex << m_shmKeySysV << std::dec << "): " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15552// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15553 }
15554 } else {
15555 // The caller wants to attach to an existing shared memory segment.
15556 m_sharedMemoryIDSysV = ::shmget(m_shmKeySysV, 0, S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR | S_IRGRP | S_IWGRP | S_IROTH | S_IWOTH);
15557 if (-1 != m_sharedMemoryIDSysV) {
15558 struct shmid_ds info;
15559 if (-1 != ::shmctl(m_sharedMemoryIDSysV, IPC_STAT, &info)) {
15560 m_size = static_cast<uint32_t>(info.shm_segsz);
15561 m_sharedMemory = reinterpret_cast<char *>(::shmat(m_sharedMemoryIDSysV, nullptr, 0));
15562#pragma GCC diagnostic push
15563#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wold-style-cast"
15564 if ((void *)-1 != m_sharedMemory) {
15565 m_userAccessibleSharedMemory = m_sharedMemory;
15566 } else { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15567// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15568 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Failed to attach to shared memory (0x" << std::hex << m_shmKeySysV << std::dec << "): " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15569// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15570 }
15571#pragma GCC diagnostic pop
15572 } else { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15573// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15574 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Could not read information about shared memory (0x" << std::hex << m_shmKeySysV << std::dec << "): " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15575// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15576 }
15577 } else { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15578// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15579 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Failed to get shared memory (0x" << std::hex << m_shmKeySysV << std::dec << "): " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15580// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15581 }
15582 }
15583 }
15584
15585 // Next, create the mutex (but only if the shared memory was acquired correctly.
15586 m_mutexKeySysV = ::ftok(m_name.c_str(), ID_SEM_AS_MUTEX);
15587 if (-1 == m_mutexKeySysV) {
15588// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15589 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Key for mutex could not be created: " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15590// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15591 }
15592 if ((-1 != m_shmKeySysV) && (-1 != m_mutexKeySysV) && (nullptr != m_userAccessibleSharedMemory)) {
15593 if (!m_hasOnlyAttachedToSharedMemory) {
15594 // The caller has created the shared memory segment and thus,
15595 // we need the corresponding mutex.
15596
15597 // First, try to remove the orphaned one.
15598 {
15599 int orphanedMutexIDSysV = ::semget(m_mutexKeySysV, 0, S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR | S_IRGRP | S_IWGRP | S_IROTH | S_IWOTH);
15600 if (!(orphanedMutexIDSysV < 0)) {
15601 if (::semctl(orphanedMutexIDSysV, 0, IPC_RMID)) {
15602// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15603 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Existing semaphore (0x" << std::hex << m_mutexKeySysV << std::dec << ", intended to use as mutex) found; removing failed." << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15604// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15605 }
15606 }
15607 }
15608
15609 // Next, create the correct semaphore used as mutex.
15610 {
15611 constexpr int NSEMS{1};
15612 m_mutexIDSysV = ::semget(m_mutexKeySysV, NSEMS, IPC_CREAT | IPC_EXCL | S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR | S_IRGRP | S_IWGRP | S_IROTH | S_IWOTH);
15613 if (-1 != m_mutexIDSysV) {
15614 constexpr int NUMBER_OF_SEMAPHORE_TO_CONTROL{0};
15615 constexpr int INITIAL_VALUE{1};
15616 union semun tmp;
15617 tmp.val = INITIAL_VALUE;
15618#pragma GCC diagnostic push
15619#if defined(__clang__)
15620#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wclass-varargs"
15621#endif
15622 if (-1 == ::semctl(m_mutexIDSysV, NUMBER_OF_SEMAPHORE_TO_CONTROL, SETVAL, tmp)) {
15623// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15624 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Failed to initialize semaphore (0x" << std::hex << m_mutexKeySysV << std::dec << ", intended to use as mutex): " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15625// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15626 }
15627#pragma GCC diagnostic pop
15628 } else { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15629// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15630 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Failed to create semaphore (0x" << std::hex << m_mutexKeySysV << std::dec << ", intended to use as mutex): " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15631// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15632 }
15633 }
15634 } else {
15635 m_mutexIDSysV = ::semget(m_mutexKeySysV, 0, S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR | S_IRGRP | S_IWGRP | S_IROTH | S_IWOTH);
15636 if (-1 == m_mutexIDSysV) {
15637// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15638 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Failed to get semaphore (0x" << std::hex << m_mutexKeySysV << std::dec << ", intended to use as mutex): " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15639// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15640 }
15641 }
15642 }
15643
15644 // Next, create the condition variable (but only if the shared memory was acquired correctly.
15645 m_conditionKeySysV = ::ftok(m_name.c_str(), ID_SEM_AS_CONDITION);
15646 if (-1 == m_conditionKeySysV) {
15647// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15648 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Key for condition could not be created: " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15649// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15650 }
15651 if ((-1 != m_shmKeySysV) && (-1 != m_mutexKeySysV) && (-1 != m_conditionKeySysV) && (nullptr != m_userAccessibleSharedMemory)) {
15652 if (!m_hasOnlyAttachedToSharedMemory) {
15653 // The caller has created the shared memory segment and thus,
15654 // we need the corresponding condition variable.
15655
15656 // First, try to remove the orphaned one.
15657 {
15658 int orphanedConditionIDSysV = ::semget(m_conditionKeySysV, 0, S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR | S_IRGRP | S_IWGRP | S_IROTH | S_IWOTH);
15659 if (!(orphanedConditionIDSysV < 0)) {
15660 if (::semctl(orphanedConditionIDSysV, 0, IPC_RMID)) {
15661// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15662 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Existing semaphore (0x" << std::hex << m_conditionKeySysV << std::dec << ", intended to use as condition variable) found; removing failed." << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15663// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15664 }
15665 }
15666 }
15667
15668 // Next, create the correct semaphore used as condition variable.
15669 {
15670 constexpr int NSEMS{1};
15671 m_conditionIDSysV = ::semget(m_conditionKeySysV, NSEMS, IPC_CREAT | IPC_EXCL | S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR | S_IRGRP | S_IWGRP | S_IROTH | S_IWOTH);
15672 if (-1 != m_conditionIDSysV) {
15673 constexpr int NUMBER_OF_SEMAPHORE_TO_CONTROL{0};
15674 constexpr int INITIAL_VALUE{1};
15675 union semun tmp;
15676 tmp.val = INITIAL_VALUE;
15677#pragma GCC diagnostic push
15678#if defined(__clang__)
15679#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wclass-varargs"
15680#endif
15681 if (-1 == ::semctl(m_conditionIDSysV, NUMBER_OF_SEMAPHORE_TO_CONTROL, SETVAL, tmp)) {
15682// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15683 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Failed to initialize semaphore (0x" << std::hex << m_conditionKeySysV << std::dec << ", intended to use as condition variable): " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15684// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15685 }
15686#pragma GCC diagnostic pop
15687 } else { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15688// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15689 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Failed to create semaphore (0x" << std::hex << m_conditionKeySysV << std::dec << ", intended to use as condition variable): " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15690// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15691 }
15692 }
15693 } else {
15694 m_conditionIDSysV = ::semget(m_conditionKeySysV, 0, S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR | S_IRGRP | S_IWGRP | S_IROTH | S_IWOTH);
15695 if (-1 == m_conditionIDSysV) {
15696// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15697 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Failed to get semaphore (0x" << std::hex << m_conditionKeySysV << std::dec << ", intended to use as condition variable): " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15698// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15699 }
15700 }
15701 }
15702 }
15703
15704 // If the shared memory is present, open the token file for the time stamping.
15705 if (nullptr != m_sharedMemory) {
15706 m_fdForTimeStamping = ::open(m_name.c_str(), O_RDONLY);
15707 }
15708}
15709
15710inline void SharedMemory::deinitSysV() noexcept {
15711 if (nullptr != m_sharedMemory) {
15712 // Close token file.
15713 ::close(m_fdForTimeStamping);
15714 m_fdForTimeStamping = -1;
15715
15716 if (-1 == ::shmdt(m_sharedMemory)) {
15717// clang-format off // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15718 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Could not detach shared memory (0x" << std::hex << m_shmKeySysV << std::dec << "): " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15719// clang-format on // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
15720 }
15721 }
15722
15723 if (!m_hasOnlyAttachedToSharedMemory) {
15724 notifyAllSysV();
15725
15726 if (-1 != m_conditionIDSysV) {
15727 if (-1 == ::semctl(m_conditionIDSysV, 0, IPC_RMID)) {
15728 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Semaphore (0x" << std::hex << m_conditionKeySysV << std::dec
15729 << ") used as condition could not be removed: " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl;
15730 }
15731 }
15732
15733 if (-1 != m_mutexIDSysV) {
15734 if (-1 == ::semctl(m_mutexIDSysV, 0, IPC_RMID)) {
15735 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Semaphore (0x" << std::hex << m_mutexKeySysV << std::dec
15736 << ") used as mutex could not be removed: " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl;
15737 }
15738 }
15739 if (-1 != m_sharedMemoryIDSysV) {
15740 if (-1 == ::shmctl(m_sharedMemoryIDSysV, IPC_RMID, 0)) {
15741 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Shared memory (0x" << std::hex << m_shmKeySysV << std::dec
15742 << ") could not be removed: " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl;
15743 }
15744 }
15745
15746 if (-1 == ::unlink(m_name.c_str())) {
15747 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Token file '" << m_name << "' could not be removed: " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")"
15748 << std::endl;
15749 }
15750 }
15751}
15752
15753inline void SharedMemory::lockSysV() noexcept {
15754 if (-1 != m_mutexIDSysV) {
15755 constexpr int NUMBER_OF_SEMAPHORE_TO_CONTROL{0};
15756 constexpr int VALUE{-1};
15757
15758 struct sembuf tmp;
15759 tmp.sem_num = NUMBER_OF_SEMAPHORE_TO_CONTROL;
15760 tmp.sem_op = VALUE;
15761 tmp.sem_flg = SEM_UNDO; // When the caller terminates unexpectedly, let the kernel restore the original value.
15762 if (-1 == ::semop(m_mutexIDSysV, &tmp, 1)) {
15763 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Failed to lock semaphore (0x" << std::hex << m_mutexKeySysV << std::dec << "): " << ::strerror(errno)
15764 << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl;
15765 m_broken.store(true);
15766 }
15767 }
15768}
15769
15770inline void SharedMemory::unlockSysV() noexcept {
15771 if (-1 != m_mutexIDSysV) {
15772 constexpr int NUMBER_OF_SEMAPHORE_TO_CONTROL{0};
15773 constexpr int VALUE{+1};
15774
15775 struct sembuf tmp;
15776 tmp.sem_num = NUMBER_OF_SEMAPHORE_TO_CONTROL;
15777 tmp.sem_op = VALUE;
15778 tmp.sem_flg = SEM_UNDO; // When the caller terminates unexpectedly, let the kernel restore the original value.
15779 if (-1 == ::semop(m_mutexIDSysV, &tmp, 1)) {
15780 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Failed to unlock semaphore (0x" << std::hex << m_mutexKeySysV << std::dec << "): " << ::strerror(errno)
15781 << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl;
15782 m_broken.store(true);
15783 }
15784 }
15785}
15786
15787inline void SharedMemory::waitSysV() noexcept {
15788 if (-1 != m_conditionIDSysV) {
15789 constexpr int NUMBER_OF_SEMAPHORE_TO_CONTROL{0};
15790 constexpr int VALUE{0}; // Wait for this semaphore to become 0.
15791
15792 struct sembuf tmp;
15793 tmp.sem_num = NUMBER_OF_SEMAPHORE_TO_CONTROL;
15794 tmp.sem_op = VALUE;
15795 tmp.sem_flg = 0;
15796 if (-1 == ::semop(m_conditionIDSysV, &tmp, 1)) {
15797 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Failed to wait on semaphore (0x" << std::hex << m_conditionKeySysV << std::dec
15798 << "): " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl;
15799 m_broken.store(true);
15800 }
15801 }
15802}
15803
15804inline void SharedMemory::notifyAllSysV() noexcept {
15805 if (-1 != m_conditionIDSysV) {
15806 {
15807 constexpr int NUMBER_OF_SEMAPHORE_TO_CONTROL{0};
15808 constexpr int WAKEUP_VALUE{0};
15809
15810 union semun tmp;
15811 tmp.val = WAKEUP_VALUE;
15812#pragma GCC diagnostic push
15813#if defined(__clang__)
15814#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wclass-varargs"
15815#endif
15816 if (-1 == ::semctl(m_conditionIDSysV, NUMBER_OF_SEMAPHORE_TO_CONTROL, SETVAL, tmp)) {
15817 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Failed to notify semaphore (0x" << std::hex << m_conditionKeySysV << std::dec
15818 << ", intended to use as condition variable): " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl;
15819 m_broken.store(true);
15820 }
15821#pragma GCC diagnostic pop
15822 }
15823 {
15824 constexpr int NUMBER_OF_SEMAPHORE_TO_CONTROL{0};
15825 constexpr int SLEEPING_VALUE{1};
15826
15827 union semun tmp;
15828 tmp.val = SLEEPING_VALUE;
15829#pragma GCC diagnostic push
15830#if defined(__clang__)
15831#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wclass-varargs"
15832#endif
15833 if (-1 == ::semctl(m_conditionIDSysV, NUMBER_OF_SEMAPHORE_TO_CONTROL, SETVAL, tmp)) {
15834 std::cerr << "[cluon::SharedMemory (SysV)] Failed to reset semaphore for notification (0x" << std::hex << m_conditionKeySysV << std::dec
15835 << ", intended to use as condition variable): " << ::strerror(errno) << " (" << errno << ")" << std::endl;
15836 m_broken.store(true);
15837 }
15838#pragma GCC diagnostic pop
15839 }
15840 }
15841}
15842
15843inline bool SharedMemory::validSysV() noexcept {
15844 return (-1 != m_sharedMemoryIDSysV) && (nullptr != m_sharedMemory) && (0 < m_size) && (-1 != m_mutexIDSysV) && (-1 != m_conditionIDSysV);
15845}
15846#endif
15847
15848} // namespace cluon
15849#endif
15850#ifdef HAVE_CLUON_MSC

15880#ifndef KAINJOW_MUSTACHE_HPP
15881#define KAINJOW_MUSTACHE_HPP
15882
15883#include <cassert>
15884#include <cctype>
15885#include <functional>
15886#include <iostream>
15887#include <memory>
15888#include <sstream>
15889#include <unordered_map>
15890#include <vector>
15891
15892namespace kainjow {
15893namespace mustache {
15894
15895template <typename string_type>
15896string_type trim(const string_type& s) {
15897 auto it = s.begin();
15898 while (it != s.end() && std::isspace(*it)) {
15899 it++;
15900 }
15901 auto rit = s.rbegin();
15902 while (rit.base() != it && std::isspace(*rit)) {
15903 rit++;
15904 }
15905 return {it, rit.base()};
15906}
15907
15908template <typename string_type>
15909string_type html_escape(const string_type& s) {
15910 string_type ret;
15911 ret.reserve(s.size()*2);
15912 for (const auto ch : s) {
15913 switch (ch) {
15914 case '&':
15915 ret.append({'&','a','m','p',';'});
15916 break;
15917 case '<':
15918 ret.append({'&','l','t',';'});
15919 break;
15920 case '>':
15921 ret.append({'&','g','t',';'});
15922 break;
15923 case '\"':
15924 ret.append({'&','q','u','o','t',';'});
15925 break;
15926 case '\'':
15927 ret.append({'&','a','p','o','s',';'});
15928 break;
15929 default:
15930 ret.append(1, ch);
15931 break;
15932 }
15933 }
15934 return ret;
15935}
15936
15937template <typename string_type>
15938std::vector<string_type> split(const string_type& s, typename string_type::value_type delim) {
15939 std::vector<string_type> elems;
15940 std::basic_stringstream<typename string_type::value_type> ss(s);
15941 string_type item;
15942 while (std::getline(ss, item, delim)) {
15943 elems.push_back(item);
15944 }
15945 return elems;
15946}
15947
15948template <typename string_type>
15949class basic_renderer {
15950public:
15951 using type1 = std::function<string_type(const string_type&)>;
15952 using type2 = std::function<string_type(const string_type&, bool escaped)>;
15953
15954 string_type operator()(const string_type& text) const {
15955 return type1_(text);
15956 }
15957
15958 string_type operator()(const string_type& text, bool escaped) const {
15959 return type2_(text, escaped);
15960 }
15961
15962private:
15963 basic_renderer(const type1& t1, const type2& t2)
15964 : type1_(t1)
15965 , type2_(t2)
15966 {}
15967
15968 const type1& type1_;
15969 const type2& type2_;
15970
15971 template <typename StringType>
15972 friend class basic_mustache;
15973};
15974
15975template <typename string_type>
15976class basic_lambda_t {
15977public:
15978 using type1 = std::function<string_type(const string_type&)>;
15979 using type2 = std::function<string_type(const string_type&, const basic_renderer<string_type>& render)>;
15980
15981 basic_lambda_t(const type1& t) : type1_(new type1(t)) {}
15982 basic_lambda_t(const type2& t) : type2_(new type2(t)) {}
15983
15984 bool is_type1() const { return static_cast<bool>(type1_); }
15985 bool is_type2() const { return static_cast<bool>(type2_); }
15986
15987 const type1& type1_value() const { return *type1_; }
15988 const type2& type2_value() const { return *type2_; }
15989
15990 // Copying
15991 basic_lambda_t(const basic_lambda_t& l) {
15992 if (l.type1_) {
15993 type1_.reset(new type1(*l.type1_));
15994 } else if (l.type2_) {
15995 type2_.reset(new type2(*l.type2_));
15996 }
15997 }
15998
15999 string_type operator()(const string_type& text) const {
16000 return (*type1_)(text);
16001 }
16002
16003 string_type operator()(const string_type& text, const basic_renderer<string_type>& render) const {
16004 return (*type2_)(text, render);
16005 }
16006
16007private:
16008 std::unique_ptr<type1> type1_;
16009 std::unique_ptr<type2> type2_;
16010};
16011
16012template <typename string_type>
16013class basic_data;
16014template <typename string_type>
16015using basic_object = std::unordered_map<string_type, basic_data<string_type>>;
16016template <typename string_type>
16017using basic_list = std::vector<basic_data<string_type>>;
16018template <typename string_type>
16019using basic_partial = std::function<string_type()>;
16020template <typename string_type>
16021using basic_lambda = typename basic_lambda_t<string_type>::type1;
16022template <typename string_type>
16023using basic_lambda2 = typename basic_lambda_t<string_type>::type2;
16024
16025template <typename string_type>
16026class basic_data {
16027public:
16028 enum class type {
16029 object,
16030 string,
16031 list,
16032 bool_true,
16033 bool_false,
16034 partial,
16035 lambda,
16036 lambda2,
16037 invalid,
16038 };
16039
16040 // Construction
16041 basic_data() : basic_data(type::object) {
16042 }
16043 basic_data(const string_type& string) : type_{type::string} {
16044 str_.reset(new string_type(string));
16045 }
16046 basic_data(const typename string_type::value_type* string) : type_{type::string} {
16047 str_.reset(new string_type(string));
16048 }
16049 basic_data(const basic_object<string_type>& obj) : type_{type::object} {
16050 obj_.reset(new basic_object<string_type>(obj));
16051 }
16052 basic_data(const basic_list<string_type>& l) : type_{type::list} {
16053 list_.reset(new basic_list<string_type>(l));
16054 }
16055 basic_data(type t) : type_{t} {
16056 switch (type_) {
16057 case type::object:
16058 obj_.reset(new basic_object<string_type>);
16059 break;
16060 case type::string:
16061 str_.reset(new string_type);
16062 break;
16063 case type::list:
16064 list_.reset(new basic_list<string_type>);
16065 break;
16066 default:
16067 break;
16068 }
16069 }
16070 basic_data(const string_type& name, const basic_data& var) : basic_data{} {
16071 set(name, var);
16072 }
16073 basic_data(const basic_partial<string_type>& p) : type_{type::partial} {
16074 partial_.reset(new basic_partial<string_type>(p));
16075 }
16076 basic_data(const basic_lambda<string_type>& l) : type_{type::lambda} {
16077 lambda_.reset(new basic_lambda_t<string_type>(l));
16078 }
16079 basic_data(const basic_lambda2<string_type>& l) : type_{type::lambda2} {
16080 lambda_.reset(new basic_lambda_t<string_type>(l));
16081 }
16082 basic_data(const basic_lambda_t<string_type>& l) {
16083 if (l.is_type1()) {
16084 type_ = type::lambda;
16085 } else if (l.is_type2()) {
16086 type_ = type::lambda2;
16087 }
16088 lambda_.reset(new basic_lambda_t<string_type>(l));
16089 }
16090 basic_data(bool b) : type_{b ? type::bool_true : type::bool_false} {
16091 }
16092
16093 // Copying
16094 basic_data(const basic_data& dat) : type_(dat.type_) {
16095 if (dat.obj_) {
16096 obj_.reset(new basic_object<string_type>(*dat.obj_));
16097 } else if (dat.str_) {
16098 str_.reset(new string_type(*dat.str_));
16099 } else if (dat.list_) {
16100 list_.reset(new basic_list<string_type>(*dat.list_));
16101 } else if (dat.partial_) {
16102 partial_.reset(new basic_partial<string_type>(*dat.partial_));
16103 } else if (dat.lambda_) {
16104 lambda_.reset(new basic_lambda_t<string_type>(*dat.lambda_));
16105 }
16106 }
16107
16108 // Move
16109 basic_data(basic_data&& dat) : type_{dat.type_} {
16110 if (dat.obj_) {
16111 obj_ = std::move(dat.obj_);
16112 } else if (dat.str_) {
16113 str_ = std::move(dat.str_);
16114 } else if (dat.list_) {
16115 list_ = std::move(dat.list_);
16116 } else if (dat.partial_) {
16117 partial_ = std::move(dat.partial_);
16118 } else if (dat.lambda_) {
16119 lambda_ = std::move(dat.lambda_);
16120 }
16121 dat.type_ = type::invalid;
16122 }
16123 basic_data& operator= (basic_data&& dat) {
16124 if (this != &dat) {
16125 obj_.reset();
16126 str_.reset();
16127 list_.reset();
16128 partial_.reset();
16129 lambda_.reset();
16130 if (dat.obj_) {
16131 obj_ = std::move(dat.obj_);
16132 } else if (dat.str_) {
16133 str_ = std::move(dat.str_);
16134 } else if (dat.list_) {
16135 list_ = std::move(dat.list_);
16136 } else if (dat.partial_) {
16137 partial_ = std::move(dat.partial_);
16138 } else if (dat.lambda_) {
16139 lambda_ = std::move(dat.lambda_);
16140 }
16141 type_ = dat.type_;
16142 dat.type_ = type::invalid;
16143 }
16144 return *this;
16145 }
16146
16147 // Type info
16148 bool is_object() const {
16149 return type_ == type::object;
16150 }
16151 bool is_string() const {
16152 return type_ == type::string;
16153 }
16154 bool is_list() const {
16155 return type_ == type::list;
16156 }
16157 bool is_bool() const {
16158 return is_true() || is_false();
16159 }
16160 bool is_true() const {
16161 return type_ == type::bool_true;
16162 }
16163 bool is_false() const {
16164 return type_ == type::bool_false;
16165 }
16166 bool is_partial() const {
16167 return type_ == type::partial;
16168 }
16169 bool is_lambda() const {
16170 return type_ == type::lambda;
16171 }
16172 bool is_lambda2() const {
16173 return type_ == type::lambda2;
16174 }
16175 bool is_invalid() const {
16176 return type_ == type::invalid;
16177 }
16178
16179 // Object data
16180 bool is_empty_object() const {
16181 return is_object() && obj_->empty();
16182 }
16183 bool is_non_empty_object() const {
16184 return is_object() && !obj_->empty();
16185 }
16186 void set(const string_type& name, const basic_data& var) {
16187 if (is_object()) {
16188 auto it = obj_->find(name);
16189 if (it != obj_->end()) {
16190 obj_->erase(it);
16191 }
16192 obj_->insert(std::pair<string_type,basic_data>{name, var});
16193 }
16194 }
16195 const basic_data* get(const string_type& name) const {
16196 if (!is_object()) {
16197 return nullptr;
16198 }
16199 const auto& it = obj_->find(name);
16200 if (it == obj_->end()) {
16201 return nullptr;
16202 }
16203 return &it->second;
16204 }
16205
16206 // List data
16207 void push_back(const basic_data& var) {
16208 if (is_list()) {
16209 list_->push_back(var);
16210 }
16211 }
16212 const basic_list<string_type>& list_value() const {
16213 return *list_;
16214 }
16215 bool is_empty_list() const {
16216 return is_list() && list_->empty();
16217 }
16218 bool is_non_empty_list() const {
16219 return is_list() && !list_->empty();
16220 }
16221 basic_data& operator<< (const basic_data& data) {
16222 push_back(data);
16223 return *this;
16224 }
16225
16226 // String data
16227 const string_type& string_value() const {
16228 return *str_;
16229 }
16230
16231 basic_data& operator[] (const string_type& key) {
16232 return (*obj_)[key];
16233 }
16234
16235 const basic_partial<string_type>& partial_value() const {
16236 return (*partial_);
16237 }
16238
16239 const basic_lambda<string_type>& lambda_value() const {
16240 return lambda_->type1_value();
16241 }
16242
16243 const basic_lambda2<string_type>& lambda2_value() const {
16244 return lambda_->type2_value();
16245 }
16246
16247private:
16248 type type_;
16249 std::unique_ptr<basic_object<string_type>> obj_;
16250 std::unique_ptr<string_type> str_;
16251 std::unique_ptr<basic_list<string_type>> list_;
16252 std::unique_ptr<basic_partial<string_type>> partial_;
16253 std::unique_ptr<basic_lambda_t<string_type>> lambda_;
16254};
16255
16256template <typename string_type>
16257class delimiter_set {
16258public:
16259 string_type begin;
16260 string_type end;
16261 delimiter_set()
16262 : begin(default_begin)
16263 , end(default_end)
16264 {}
16265 bool is_default() const { return begin == default_begin && end == default_end; }
16266 static const string_type default_begin;
16267 static const string_type default_end;
16268};
16269
16270template <typename string_type>
16271const string_type delimiter_set<string_type>::default_begin(2, '{');
16272template <typename string_type>
16273const string_type delimiter_set<string_type>::default_end(2, '}');
16274
16275template <typename string_type>
16276class basic_context {
16277public:
16278 virtual ~basic_context() = default;
16279 virtual void push(const basic_data<string_type>* data) = 0;
16280 virtual void pop() = 0;
16281
16282 virtual const basic_data<string_type>* get(const string_type& name) const = 0;
16283 virtual const basic_data<string_type>* get_partial(const string_type& name) const = 0;
16284};
16285
16286template <typename string_type>
16287class context : public basic_context<string_type> {
16288public:
16289 context(const basic_data<string_type>* data) {
16290 push(data);
16291 }
16292
16293 context() {
16294 }
16295
16296 virtual void push(const basic_data<string_type>* data) override {
16297 items_.insert(items_.begin(), data);
16298 }
16299
16300 virtual void pop() override {
16301 items_.erase(items_.begin());
16302 }
16303
16304 virtual const basic_data<string_type>* get(const string_type& name) const override {
16305 // process {{.}} name
16306 if (name.size() == 1 && name.at(0) == '.') {
16307 return items_.front();
16308 }
16309 if (name.find('.') == string_type::npos) {
16310 // process normal name without having to split which is slower
16311 for (const auto& item : items_) {
16312 const auto var = item->get(name);
16313 if (var) {
16314 return var;
16315 }
16316 }
16317 return nullptr;
16318 }
16319 // process x.y-like name
16320 const auto names = split(name, '.');
16321 for (const auto& item : items_) {
16322 auto var = item;
16323 for (const auto& n : names) {
16324 var = var->get(n);
16325 if (!var) {
16326 break;
16327 }
16328 }
16329 if (var) {
16330 return var;
16331 }
16332 }
16333 return nullptr;
16334 }
16335
16336 virtual const basic_data<string_type>* get_partial(const string_type& name) const override {
16337 for (const auto& item : items_) {
16338 const auto var = item->get(name);
16339 if (var) {
16340 return var;
16341 }
16342 }
16343 return nullptr;
16344 }
16345
16346 context(const context&) = delete;
16347 context& operator= (const context&) = delete;
16348
16349private:
16350 std::vector<const basic_data<string_type>*> items_;
16351};
16352
16353template <typename string_type>
16354class line_buffer_state {
16355public:
16356 string_type data;
16357 bool contained_section_tag = false;
16358
16359 bool is_empty_or_contains_only_whitespace() const {
16360 for (const auto ch : data) {
