16361 // don't look at newlines
16362 if (ch != ' ' && ch != '\t') {
16363 return false;
16364 }
16365 }
16366 return true;
16367 }
16368
16369 void clear() {
16370 data.clear();
16371 contained_section_tag = false;
16372 }
16373};
16374
16375template <typename string_type>
16376class context_internal {
16377public:
16378 basic_context<string_type>& ctx;
16379 delimiter_set<string_type> delim_set;
16380 line_buffer_state<string_type> line_buffer;
16381
16382 context_internal(basic_context<string_type>& a_ctx)
16383 : ctx(a_ctx)
16384 {
16385 }
16386};
16387
16388enum class tag_type {
16389 text,
16390 variable,
16391 unescaped_variable,
16392 section_begin,
16393 section_end,
16394 section_begin_inverted,
16395 comment,
16396 partial,
16397 set_delimiter,
16398};
16399
16400template <typename string_type>
16401class mstch_tag /* gcc doesn't allow "tag tag;" so rename the class :( */ {
16402public:
16403 string_type name;
16404 tag_type type = tag_type::text;
16405 std::shared_ptr<string_type> section_text;
16406 std::shared_ptr<delimiter_set<string_type>> delim_set;
16407 bool is_section_begin() const {
16408 return type == tag_type::section_begin || type == tag_type::section_begin_inverted;
16409 }
16410 bool is_section_end() const {
16411 return type == tag_type::section_end;
16412 }
16413};
16414
16415template <typename string_type>
16416class context_pusher {
16417public:
16418 context_pusher(context_internal<string_type>& ctx, const basic_data<string_type>* data)
16419 : ctx_(ctx)
16420 {
16421 ctx.ctx.push(data);
16422 }
16423 ~context_pusher() {
16424 ctx_.ctx.pop();
16425 }
16426 context_pusher(const context_pusher&) = delete;
16427 context_pusher& operator= (const context_pusher&) = delete;
16428private:
16429 context_internal<string_type>& ctx_;
16430};
16431
16432template <typename string_type>
16433class component {
16434private:
16435 using string_size_type = typename string_type::size_type;
16436
16437public:
16438 string_type text;
16439 mstch_tag<string_type> tag;
16440 std::vector<component> children;
16441 string_size_type position = string_type::npos;
16442
16443 enum class walk_control {
16444 walk, // "continue" is reserved :/
16445 stop,
16446 skip,
16447 };
16448 using walk_callback = std::function<walk_control(component&)>;
16449
16450 component() {}
16451 component(const string_type& t, string_size_type p) : text(t), position(p) {}
16452
16453 bool is_text() const {
16454 return tag.type == tag_type::text;
16455 }
16456
16457 bool is_newline() const {
16458 return is_text() && ((text.size() == 2 && text[0] == '\r' && text[1] == '\n') ||
16459 (text.size() == 1 && (text[0] == '\n' || text[0] == '\r')));
16460 }
16461
16462 bool is_non_newline_whitespace() const {
16463 return is_text() && !is_newline() && text.size() == 1 && (text[0] == ' ' || text[0] == '\t');
16464 }
16465
16466 void walk_children(const walk_callback& callback) {
16467 for (auto& child : children) {
16468 if (child.walk(callback) != walk_control::walk) {
16469 break;
16470 }
16471 }
16472 }
16473
16474private:
16475 walk_control walk(const walk_callback& callback) {
16476 walk_control control{callback(*this)};
16477 if (control == walk_control::stop) {
16478 return control;
16479 } else if (control == walk_control::skip) {
16480 return walk_control::walk;
16481 }
16482 for (auto& child : children) {
16483 control = child.walk(callback);
16484 if (control == walk_control::stop) {
16485 return control;
16486 }
16487 }
16488 return control;
16489 }
16490};
16491
16492template <typename string_type>
16493class parser {
16494public:
16495 parser(const string_type& input, context_internal<string_type>& ctx, component<string_type>& root_component, string_type& error_message)
16496 {
16497 parse(input, ctx, root_component, error_message);
16498 }
16499
16500private:
16501 void parse(const string_type& input, context_internal<string_type>& ctx, component<string_type>& root_component, string_type& error_message) const {
16502 using string_size_type = typename string_type::size_type;
16503 using streamstring = std::basic_ostringstream<typename string_type::value_type>;
16504
16505 const string_type brace_delimiter_end_unescaped(3, '}');
16506 const string_size_type input_size{input.size()};
16507
16508 bool current_delimiter_is_brace{ctx.delim_set.is_default()};
16509
16510 std::vector<component<string_type>*> sections{&root_component};
16511 std::vector<string_size_type> section_starts;
16512 string_type current_text;
16513 string_size_type current_text_position = -1;
16514
16515 current_text.reserve(input_size);
16516
16517 const auto process_current_text = [&current_text, &current_text_position, &sections]() {
16518 if (!current_text.empty()) {
16519 const component<string_type> comp{current_text, current_text_position};
16520 sections.back()->children.push_back(comp);
16521 current_text.clear();
16522 current_text_position = -1;
16523 }
16524 };
16525
16526 const std::vector<string_type> whitespace{
16527 string_type(1, '\r') + string_type(1, '\n'),
16528 string_type(1, '\n'),
16529 string_type(1, '\r'),
16530 string_type(1, ' '),
16531 string_type(1, '\t'),
16532 };
16533
16534 for (string_size_type input_position = 0; input_position != input_size;) {
16535 bool parse_tag = false;
16536
16537 if (input.compare(input_position, ctx.delim_set.begin.size(), ctx.delim_set.begin) == 0) {
16538 process_current_text();
16539
16540 // Tag start delimiter
16541 parse_tag = true;
16542 } else {
16543 bool parsed_whitespace = false;
16544 for (const auto& whitespace_text : whitespace) {
16545 if (input.compare(input_position, whitespace_text.size(), whitespace_text) == 0) {
16546 process_current_text();
16547
16548 const component<string_type> comp{whitespace_text, input_position};
16549 sections.back()->children.push_back(comp);
16550 input_position += whitespace_text.size();
16551
16552 parsed_whitespace = true;
16553 break;
16554 }
16555 }
16556
16557 if (!parsed_whitespace) {
16558 if (current_text.empty()) {
16559 current_text_position = input_position;
16560 }
16561 current_text.append(1, input[input_position]);
16562 input_position++;
16563 }
16564 }
16565
16566 if (!parse_tag) {
16567 continue;
16568 }
16569
16570 // Find the next tag start delimiter
16571 const string_size_type tag_location_start = input_position;
16572
16573 // Find the next tag end delimiter
16574 string_size_type tag_contents_location{tag_location_start + ctx.delim_set.begin.size()};
16575 const bool tag_is_unescaped_var{current_delimiter_is_brace && tag_location_start != (input_size - 2) && input.at(tag_contents_location) == ctx.delim_set.begin.at(0)};
16576 const string_type& current_tag_delimiter_end{tag_is_unescaped_var ? brace_delimiter_end_unescaped : ctx.delim_set.end};
16577 const auto current_tag_delimiter_end_size = current_tag_delimiter_end.size();
16578 if (tag_is_unescaped_var) {
16579 ++tag_contents_location;
16580 }
16581 const string_size_type tag_location_end{input.find(current_tag_delimiter_end, tag_contents_location)};
16582 if (tag_location_end == string_type::npos) {
16583 streamstring ss;
16584 ss << "Unclosed tag at " << tag_location_start;
16585 error_message.assign(ss.str());
16586 return;
16587 }
16588
16589 // Parse tag
16590 const string_type tag_contents{trim(string_type{input, tag_contents_location, tag_location_end - tag_contents_location})};
16591 component<string_type> comp;
16592 if (!tag_contents.empty() && tag_contents[0] == '=') {
16593 if (!parse_set_delimiter_tag(tag_contents, ctx.delim_set)) {
16594 streamstring ss;
16595 ss << "Invalid set delimiter tag at " << tag_location_start;
16596 error_message.assign(ss.str());
16597 return;
16598 }
16599 current_delimiter_is_brace = ctx.delim_set.is_default();
16600 comp.tag.type = tag_type::set_delimiter;
16601 comp.tag.delim_set.reset(new delimiter_set<string_type>(ctx.delim_set));
16602 }
16603 if (comp.tag.type != tag_type::set_delimiter) {
16604 parse_tag_contents(tag_is_unescaped_var, tag_contents, comp.tag);
16605 }
16606 comp.position = tag_location_start;
16607 sections.back()->children.push_back(comp);
16608
16609 // Start next search after this tag
16610 input_position = tag_location_end + current_tag_delimiter_end_size;
16611
16612 // Push or pop sections
16613 if (comp.tag.is_section_begin()) {
16614 sections.push_back(&sections.back()->children.back());
16615 section_starts.push_back(input_position);
16616 } else if (comp.tag.is_section_end()) {
16617 if (sections.size() == 1) {
16618 streamstring ss;
16619 ss << "Unopened section \"" << comp.tag.name << "\" at " << comp.position;
16620 error_message.assign(ss.str());
16621 return;
16622 }
16623 sections.back()->tag.section_text.reset(new string_type(input.substr(section_starts.back(), tag_location_start - section_starts.back())));
16624 sections.pop_back();
16625 section_starts.pop_back();
16626 }
16627 }
16628
16629 process_current_text();
16630
16631 // Check for sections without an ending tag
16632 root_component.walk_children([&error_message](component<string_type>& comp) -> typename component<string_type>::walk_control {
16633 if (!comp.tag.is_section_begin()) {
16634 return component<string_type>::walk_control::walk;
16635 }
16636 if (comp.children.empty() || !comp.children.back().tag.is_section_end() || comp.children.back().tag.name != comp.tag.name) {
16637 streamstring ss;
16638 ss << "Unclosed section \"" << comp.tag.name << "\" at " << comp.position;
16639 error_message.assign(ss.str());
16640 return component<string_type>::walk_control::stop;
16641 }
16642 comp.children.pop_back(); // remove now useless end section component
16643 return component<string_type>::walk_control::walk;
16644 });
16645 if (!error_message.empty()) {
16646 return;
16647 }
16648 }
16649
16650 bool is_set_delimiter_valid(const string_type& delimiter) const {
16651 // "Custom delimiters may not contain whitespace or the equals sign."
16652 for (const auto ch : delimiter) {
16653 if (ch == '=' || std::isspace(ch)) {
16654 return false;
16655 }
16656 }
16657 return true;
16658 }
16659
16660 bool parse_set_delimiter_tag(const string_type& contents, delimiter_set<string_type>& delimiter_set) const {
16661 // Smallest legal tag is "=X X="
16662 if (contents.size() < 5) {
16663 return false;
16664 }
16665 if (contents.back() != '=') {
16666 return false;
16667 }
16668 const auto contents_substr = trim(contents.substr(1, contents.size() - 2));
16669 const auto spacepos = contents_substr.find(' ');
16670 if (spacepos == string_type::npos) {
16671 return false;
16672 }
16673 const auto nonspace = contents_substr.find_first_not_of(' ', spacepos + 1);
16674 assert(nonspace != string_type::npos);
16675 const string_type begin = contents_substr.substr(0, spacepos);
16676 const string_type end = contents_substr.substr(nonspace, contents_substr.size() - nonspace);
16677 if (!is_set_delimiter_valid(begin) || !is_set_delimiter_valid(end)) {
16678 return false;
16679 }
16680 delimiter_set.begin = begin;
16681 delimiter_set.end = end;
16682 return true;
16683 }
16684
16685 void parse_tag_contents(bool is_unescaped_var, const string_type& contents, mstch_tag<string_type>& tag) const {
16686 if (is_unescaped_var) {
16687 tag.type = tag_type::unescaped_variable;
16688 tag.name = contents;
16689 } else if (contents.empty()) {
16690 tag.type = tag_type::variable;
16691 tag.name.clear();
16692 } else {
16693 switch (contents.at(0)) {
16694 case '#':
16695 tag.type = tag_type::section_begin;
16696 break;
16697 case '^':
16698 tag.type = tag_type::section_begin_inverted;
16699 break;
16700 case '/':
16701 tag.type = tag_type::section_end;
16702 break;
16703 case '>':
16704 tag.type = tag_type::partial;
16705 break;
16706 case '&':
16707 tag.type = tag_type::unescaped_variable;
16708 break;
16709 case '!':
16710 tag.type = tag_type::comment;
16711 break;
16712 default:
16713 tag.type = tag_type::variable;
16714 break;
16715 }
16716 if (tag.type == tag_type::variable) {
16717 tag.name = contents;
16718 } else {
16719 string_type name{contents};
16720 name.erase(name.begin());
16721 tag.name = trim(name);
16722 }
16723 }
16724 }
16725};
16726
16727template <typename StringType>
16728class basic_mustache {
16729public:
16730 using string_type = StringType;
16731
16732 basic_mustache(const string_type& input)
16733 : basic_mustache() {
16734 context<string_type> ctx;
16735 context_internal<string_type> context{ctx};
16736 parser<string_type> parser{input, context, root_component_, error_message_};
16737 }
16738
16739 bool is_valid() const {
16740 return error_message_.empty();
16741 }
16742
16743 const string_type& error_message() const {
16744 return error_message_;
16745 }
16746
16747 using escape_handler = std::function<string_type(const string_type&)>;
16748 void set_custom_escape(const escape_handler& escape_fn) {
16749 escape_ = escape_fn;
16750 }
16751
16752 template <typename stream_type>
16753 stream_type& render(const basic_data<string_type>& data, stream_type& stream) {
16754 render(data, [&stream](const string_type& str) {
16755 stream << str;
16756 });
16757 return stream;
16758 }
16759
16760 string_type render(const basic_data<string_type>& data) {
16761 std::basic_ostringstream<typename string_type::value_type> ss;
16762 return render(data, ss).str();
16763 }
16764
16765 template <typename stream_type>
16766 stream_type& render(basic_context<string_type>& ctx, stream_type& stream) {
16767 context_internal<string_type> context{ctx};
16768 render([&stream](const string_type& str) {
16769 stream << str;
16770 }, context);
16771 return stream;
16772 }
16773
16774 string_type render(basic_context<string_type>& ctx) {
16775 std::basic_ostringstream<typename string_type::value_type> ss;
16776 return render(ctx, ss).str();
16777 }
16778
16779 using render_handler = std::function<void(const string_type&)>;
16780 void render(const basic_data<string_type>& data, const render_handler& handler) {
16781 if (!is_valid()) {
16782 return;
16783 }
16784 context<string_type> ctx{&data};
16785 context_internal<string_type> context{ctx};
16786 render(handler, context);
16787 }
16788
16789private:
16790 using string_size_type = typename string_type::size_type;
16791
16792 basic_mustache()
16793 : escape_(html_escape<string_type>)
16794 {
16795 }
16796
16797 basic_mustache(const string_type& input, context_internal<string_type>& ctx)
16798 : basic_mustache() {
16799 parser<string_type> parser{input, ctx, root_component_, error_message_};
16800 }
16801
16802 string_type render(context_internal<string_type>& ctx) {
16803 std::basic_ostringstream<typename string_type::value_type> ss;
16804 render([&ss](const string_type& str) {
16805 ss << str;
16806 }, ctx);
16807 return ss.str();
16808 }
16809
16810 void render(const render_handler& handler, context_internal<string_type>& ctx, bool root_renderer = true) {
16811 root_component_.walk_children([&handler, &ctx, this](component<string_type>& comp) -> typename component<string_type>::walk_control {
16812 return render_component(handler, ctx, comp);
16813 });
16814 // process the last line, but only for the top-level renderer
16815 if (root_renderer) {
16816 render_current_line(handler, ctx, nullptr);
16817 }
16818 }
16819
16820 void render_current_line(const render_handler& handler, context_internal<string_type>& ctx, const component<string_type>* comp) const {
16821 // We're at the end of a line, so check the line buffer state to see
16822 // if the line had tags in it, and also if the line is now empty or
16823 // contains whitespace only. if this situation is true, skip the line.
16824 bool output = true;
16825 if (ctx.line_buffer.contained_section_tag && ctx.line_buffer.is_empty_or_contains_only_whitespace()) {
16826 output = false;
16827 }
16828 if (output) {
16829 handler(ctx.line_buffer.data);
16830 if (comp) {
16831 handler(comp->text);
16832 }
16833 }
16834 ctx.line_buffer.clear();
16835 }
16836
16837 void render_result(context_internal<string_type>& ctx, const string_type& text) const {
16838 ctx.line_buffer.data.append(text);
16839 }
16840
16841 typename component<string_type>::walk_control render_component(const render_handler& handler, context_internal<string_type>& ctx, component<string_type>& comp) {
16842 if (comp.is_text()) {
16843 if (comp.is_newline()) {
16844 render_current_line(handler, ctx, &comp);
16845 } else {
16846 render_result(ctx, comp.text);
16847 }
16848 return component<string_type>::walk_control::walk;
16849 }
16850
16851 const mstch_tag<string_type>& tag{comp.tag};
16852 const basic_data<string_type>* var = nullptr;
16853 switch (tag.type) {
16854 case tag_type::variable:
16855 case tag_type::unescaped_variable:
16856 if ((var = ctx.ctx.get(tag.name)) != nullptr) {
16857 if (!render_variable(handler, var, ctx, tag.type == tag_type::variable)) {
16858 return component<string_type>::walk_control::stop;
16859 }
16860 }
16861 break;
16862 case tag_type::section_begin:
16863 if ((var = ctx.ctx.get(tag.name)) != nullptr) {
16864 if (var->is_lambda() || var->is_lambda2()) {
16865 if (!render_lambda(handler, var, ctx, render_lambda_escape::optional, *comp.tag.section_text, true)) {
16866 return component<string_type>::walk_control::stop;
16867 }
16868 } else if (!var->is_false() && !var->is_empty_list()) {
16869 render_section(handler, ctx, comp, var);
16870 }
16871 }
16872 return component<string_type>::walk_control::skip;
16873 case tag_type::section_begin_inverted:
16874 if ((var = ctx.ctx.get(tag.name)) == nullptr || var->is_false() || var->is_empty_list()) {
16875 render_section(handler, ctx, comp, var);
16876 }
16877 return component<string_type>::walk_control::skip;
16878 case tag_type::partial:
16879 if ((var = ctx.ctx.get_partial(tag.name)) != nullptr && (var->is_partial() || var->is_string())) {
16880 const auto& partial_result = var->is_partial() ? var->partial_value()() : var->string_value();
16881 basic_mustache tmpl{partial_result};
16882 tmpl.set_custom_escape(escape_);
16883 if (!tmpl.is_valid()) {
16884 error_message_ = tmpl.error_message();
16885 } else {
16886 tmpl.render(handler, ctx, false);
16887 if (!tmpl.is_valid()) {
16888 error_message_ = tmpl.error_message();
16889 }
16890 }
16891 if (!tmpl.is_valid()) {
16892 return component<string_type>::walk_control::stop;
16893 }
16894 }
16895 break;
16896 case tag_type::set_delimiter:
16897 ctx.delim_set = *comp.tag.delim_set;
16898 break;
16899 default:
16900 break;
16901 }
16902
16903 return component<string_type>::walk_control::walk;
16904 }
16905
16906 enum class render_lambda_escape {
16907 escape,
16908 unescape,
16909 optional,
16910 };
16911
16912 bool render_lambda(const render_handler& handler, const basic_data<string_type>* var, context_internal<string_type>& ctx, render_lambda_escape escape, const string_type& text, bool parse_with_same_context) {
16913 const typename basic_renderer<string_type>::type2 render2 = [this, &ctx, parse_with_same_context, escape](const string_type& text, bool escaped) {
16914 const auto process_template = [this, &ctx, escape, escaped](basic_mustache& tmpl) -> string_type {
16915 if (!tmpl.is_valid()) {
16916 error_message_ = tmpl.error_message();
16917 return {};
16918 }
16919 const string_type str{tmpl.render(ctx)};
16920 if (!tmpl.is_valid()) {
16921 error_message_ = tmpl.error_message();
16922 return {};
16923 }
16924 bool do_escape = false;
16925 switch (escape) {
16926 case render_lambda_escape::escape:
16927 do_escape = true;
16928 break;
16929 case render_lambda_escape::unescape:
16930 do_escape = false;
16931 break;
16932 case render_lambda_escape::optional:
16933 do_escape = escaped;
16934 break;
16935 }
16936 return do_escape ? escape_(str) : str;
16937 };
16938 if (parse_with_same_context) {
16939 basic_mustache tmpl{text, ctx};
16940 tmpl.set_custom_escape(escape_);
16941 return process_template(tmpl);
16942 }
16943 basic_mustache tmpl{text};
16944 tmpl.set_custom_escape(escape_);
16945 return process_template(tmpl);
16946 };
16947 const typename basic_renderer<string_type>::type1 render = [&render2](const string_type& text) {
16948 return render2(text, false);
16949 };
16950 if (var->is_lambda2()) {
16951 const basic_renderer<string_type> renderer{render, render2};
16952 render_result(ctx, var->lambda2_value()(text, renderer));
16953 } else {
16954 render_current_line(handler, ctx, nullptr);
16955 render_result(ctx, render(var->lambda_value()(text)));
16956 }
16957 return error_message_.empty();
16958 }
16959
16960 bool render_variable(const render_handler& handler, const basic_data<string_type>* var, context_internal<string_type>& ctx, bool escaped) {
16961 if (var->is_string()) {
16962 const auto& varstr = var->string_value();
16963 render_result(ctx, escaped ? escape_(varstr) : varstr);
16964 } else if (var->is_lambda()) {
16965 const render_lambda_escape escape_opt = escaped ? render_lambda_escape::escape : render_lambda_escape::unescape;
16966 return render_lambda(handler, var, ctx, escape_opt, {}, false);
16967 } else if (var->is_lambda2()) {
16968 using streamstring = std::basic_ostringstream<typename string_type::value_type>;
16969 streamstring ss;
16970 ss << "Lambda with render argument is not allowed for regular variables";
16971 error_message_ = ss.str();
16972 return false;
16973 }
16974 return true;
16975 }
16976
16977 void render_section(const render_handler& handler, context_internal<string_type>& ctx, component<string_type>& incomp, const basic_data<string_type>* var) {
16978 const auto callback = [&handler, &ctx, this](component<string_type>& comp) -> typename component<string_type>::walk_control {
16979 return render_component(handler, ctx, comp);
16980 };
16981 if (var && var->is_non_empty_list()) {
16982 for (const auto& item : var->list_value()) {
16983 // account for the section begin tag
16984 ctx.line_buffer.contained_section_tag = true;
16985
16986 const context_pusher<string_type> ctxpusher{ctx, &item};
16987 incomp.walk_children(callback);
16988
16989 // ctx may have been cleared. account for the section end tag
16990 ctx.line_buffer.contained_section_tag = true;
16991 }
16992 } else if (var) {
16993 // account for the section begin tag
16994 ctx.line_buffer.contained_section_tag = true;
16995
16996 const context_pusher<string_type> ctxpusher{ctx, var};
16997 incomp.walk_children(callback);
16998
16999 // ctx may have been cleared. account for the section end tag
17000 ctx.line_buffer.contained_section_tag = true;
17001 } else {
17002 // account for the section begin tag
17003 ctx.line_buffer.contained_section_tag = true;
17004
17005 incomp.walk_children(callback);
17006
17007 // ctx may have been cleared. account for the section end tag
17008 ctx.line_buffer.contained_section_tag = true;
17009 }
17010 }
17011
17012private:
17013 string_type error_message_;
17014 component<string_type> root_component_;
17015 escape_handler escape_;
17016};
17017
17018using mustache = basic_mustache<std::string>;
17019using data = basic_data<mustache::string_type>;
17020using object = basic_object<mustache::string_type>;
17021using list = basic_list<mustache::string_type>;
17022using partial = basic_partial<mustache::string_type>;
17023using renderer = basic_renderer<mustache::string_type>;
17024using lambda = basic_lambda<mustache::string_type>;
17025using lambda2 = basic_lambda2<mustache::string_type>;
17026using lambda_t = basic_lambda_t<mustache::string_type>;
17027
17028using mustachew = basic_mustache<std::wstring>;
17029using dataw = basic_data<mustachew::string_type>;
17030
17031} // namespace mustache
17032} // namespace kainjow
17033
17034#endif // KAINJOW_MUSTACHE_HPP
17035/*
17036 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
17037 *
17038 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
17039 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
17040 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
17041 */
17042
17043#ifndef CLUON_METAMESSAGETOCPPTRANSFORMATOR_HPP
17044#define CLUON_METAMESSAGETOCPPTRANSFORMATOR_HPP
17045
17046//#include "Mustache/mustache.hpp"
17047//#include "cluon/MetaMessage.hpp"
17048//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
17049
17050#include <string>
17051
17052namespace cluon {
17058class LIBCLUON_API MetaMessageToCPPTransformator {
17059 private:
17060 MetaMessageToCPPTransformator(MetaMessageToCPPTransformator &&) = delete;
17061 MetaMessageToCPPTransformator &operator=(const MetaMessageToCPPTransformator &) = delete;
17062 MetaMessageToCPPTransformator &operator=(MetaMessageToCPPTransformator &&) = delete;
17063
17064 public:
17065 MetaMessageToCPPTransformator() = default;
17066 MetaMessageToCPPTransformator(const MetaMessageToCPPTransformator &) = default;
17067
17073 void visit(const MetaMessage &mm) noexcept;
17074
17078 std::string content() noexcept;
17079
17080 private:
17081 kainjow::mustache::data m_dataToBeRendered{};
17082 kainjow::mustache::data m_fields{kainjow::mustache::data::type::list};
17083};
17084} // namespace cluon
17085
17086#endif
17087/*
17088 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
17089 *
17090 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
17091 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
17092 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
17093 */
17094
17095#ifndef CLUON_METAMESSAGETOPROTOTRANSFORMATOR_HPP
17096#define CLUON_METAMESSAGETOPROTOTRANSFORMATOR_HPP
17097
17098//#include "Mustache/mustache.hpp"
17099//#include "cluon/MetaMessage.hpp"
17100//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
17101
17102#include <string>
17103
17104namespace cluon {
17110class LIBCLUON_API MetaMessageToProtoTransformator {
17111 private:
17112 MetaMessageToProtoTransformator(MetaMessageToProtoTransformator &&) = delete;
17113 MetaMessageToProtoTransformator &operator=(const MetaMessageToProtoTransformator &) = delete;
17114 MetaMessageToProtoTransformator &operator=(MetaMessageToProtoTransformator &&) = delete;
17115
17116 public:
17117 MetaMessageToProtoTransformator() = default;
17118 MetaMessageToProtoTransformator(const MetaMessageToProtoTransformator &) = default;
17119
17125 void visit(const MetaMessage &mm) noexcept;
17126
17130 std::string content(bool withProtoHeader) noexcept;
17131
17132 private:
17133 kainjow::mustache::data m_dataToBeRendered;
17134 kainjow::mustache::data m_fields{kainjow::mustache::data::type::list};
17135};
17136} // namespace cluon
17137
17138#endif
17139/*
17140 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
17141 *
17142 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
17143 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
17144 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
17145 */
17146
17147//#include "cluon/MetaMessageToCPPTransformator.hpp"
17148//#include "cluon/MetaMessage.hpp"
17149
17150#include <algorithm>
17151#include <cctype>
17152#include <iostream>
17153#include <map>
17154#include <regex>
17155#include <sstream>
17156
17157//#include "Mustache/mustache.hpp"
17158
17159namespace cluon {
17160
17161const char *headerFileTemplate = R"(
17162/*
17163 * THIS IS AN AUTO-GENERATED FILE. DO NOT MODIFY AS CHANGES MIGHT BE OVERWRITTEN!
17164 */
17165
17166#ifndef VISITABLE_TYPE_TRAIT
17167#define VISITABLE_TYPE_TRAIT
17168#include <cstdint>
17169#include <string>
17170#include <utility>
17171
17172template<bool b>
17173struct visitorSelector {
17174 template<typename T, class Visitor>
17175 static void impl(uint32_t fieldIdentifier, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value, Visitor &visitor) {
17176 visitor.visit(fieldIdentifier, std::move(typeName), std::move(name), value);
17177 }
17178};
17179
17180template<>
17181struct visitorSelector<true> {
17182 template<typename T, class Visitor>
17183 static void impl(uint32_t fieldIdentifier, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value, Visitor &visitor) {
17184 visitor.visit(fieldIdentifier, std::move(typeName), std::move(name), value);
17185 }
17186};
17187
17188template<typename T>
17189struct isVisitable {
17190 static const bool value = false;
17191};
17192
17193template<typename T, class Visitor>
17194void doVisit(uint32_t fieldIdentifier, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value, Visitor &visitor) {
17195 visitorSelector<isVisitable<T>::value >::impl(fieldIdentifier, std::move(typeName), std::move(name), value, visitor);
17196}
17197#endif
17198
17199#ifndef TRIPLET_FORWARD_VISITABLE_TYPE_TRAIT
17200#define TRIPLET_FORWARD_VISITABLE_TYPE_TRAIT
17201#include <cstdint>
17202#include <string>
17203#include <utility>
17204
17205template<bool b>
17206struct tripletForwardVisitorSelector {
17207 template<typename T, class PreVisitor, class Visitor, class PostVisitor>
17208 static void impl(uint32_t fieldIdentifier, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value, PreVisitor &&preVisit, Visitor &&visit, PostVisitor &&postVisit) {
17209 (void)preVisit;
17210 (void)postVisit;
17211 std::forward<Visitor>(visit)(fieldIdentifier, std::move(typeName), std::move(name), value);
17212 }
17213};
17214
17215template<>
17216struct tripletForwardVisitorSelector<true> {
17217 template<typename T, class PreVisitor, class Visitor, class PostVisitor>
17218 static void impl(uint32_t fieldIdentifier, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value, PreVisitor &&preVisit, Visitor &&visit, PostVisitor &&postVisit) {
17219 (void)fieldIdentifier;
17220 (void)typeName;
17221 (void)name;
17222 // Apply preVisit, visit, and postVisit on value.
17223 value.accept(preVisit, visit, postVisit);
17224 }
17225};
17226
17227template<typename T>
17228struct isTripletForwardVisitable {
17229 static const bool value = false;
17230};
17231
17232template< typename T, class PreVisitor, class Visitor, class PostVisitor>
17233void doTripletForwardVisit(uint32_t fieldIdentifier, std::string &&typeName, std::string &&name, T &value, PreVisitor &&preVisit, Visitor &&visit, PostVisitor &&postVisit) {
17234 tripletForwardVisitorSelector<isTripletForwardVisitable<T>::value >::impl(fieldIdentifier, std::move(typeName), std::move(name), value, std::move(preVisit), std::move(visit), std::move(postVisit)); // NOLINT
17235}
17236#endif
17237
17238
17239#ifndef {{%HEADER_GUARD%}}_HPP
17240#define {{%HEADER_GUARD%}}_HPP
17241
17242#ifdef WIN32
17243 // Export symbols if compile flags "LIB_SHARED" and "LIB_EXPORTS" are set on Windows.
17244 #ifdef LIB_SHARED
17245 #ifdef LIB_EXPORTS
17246 #define LIB_API __declspec(dllexport)
17247 #else
17248 #define LIB_API __declspec(dllimport)
17249 #endif
17250 #else
17251 // Disable definition if linking statically.
17252 #define LIB_API
17253 #endif
17254#else
17255 // Disable definition for non-Win32 systems.
17256 #define LIB_API
17257#endif
17258
17259#include <string>
17260#include <utility>
17261{{%NAMESPACE_OPENING%}}
17262using namespace std::string_literals; // NOLINT
17263class LIB_API {{%MESSAGE%}} {
17264 private:
17265 static constexpr const char* TheShortName = "{{%MESSAGE%}}";
17266 static constexpr const char* TheLongName = "{{%COMPLETEPACKAGENAME%}}{{%MESSAGE%}}";
17267
17268 public:
17269 inline static int32_t ID() {
17270 return {{%IDENTIFIER%}};
17271 }
17272 inline static const std::string ShortName() {
17273 return TheShortName;
17274 }
17275 inline static const std::string LongName() {
17276 return TheLongName;
17277 }
17278
17279 public:
17280 {{%MESSAGE%}}() = default;
17281 {{%MESSAGE%}}(const {{%MESSAGE%}}&) = default;
17282 {{%MESSAGE%}}& operator=(const {{%MESSAGE%}}&) = default;
17283 {{%MESSAGE%}}({{%MESSAGE%}}&&) = default;
17284 {{%MESSAGE%}}& operator=({{%MESSAGE%}}&&) = default;
17285 ~{{%MESSAGE%}}() = default;
17286
17287 public:
17288 {{#%FIELDS%}}
17289 inline {{%MESSAGE%}}& {{%NAME%}}(const {{%TYPE%}} &v) noexcept {
17290 m_{{%NAME%}} = v;
17291 return *this;
17292 }
17293 inline {{%TYPE%}} {{%NAME%}}() const noexcept {
17294 return m_{{%NAME%}};
17295 }
17296 {{/%FIELDS%}}
17297
17298 public:
17299 template<class Visitor>
17300 inline void accept(uint32_t fieldId, Visitor &visitor) {
17301 (void)fieldId;
17302 (void)visitor;
17303// visitor.preVisit(ID(), ShortName(), LongName());
17304 {{#%FIELDS%}}
17305 if ({{%FIELDIDENTIFIER%}} == fieldId) {
17306 doVisit({{%FIELDIDENTIFIER%}}, std::move("{{%TYPE%}}"s), std::move("{{%NAME%}}"s), m_{{%NAME%}}, visitor);
17307 return;
17308 }
17309 {{/%FIELDS%}}
17310// visitor.postVisit();
17311 }
17312
17313 template<class Visitor>
17314 inline void accept(Visitor &visitor) {
17315 visitor.preVisit(ID(), ShortName(), LongName());
17316 {{#%FIELDS%}}
17317 doVisit({{%FIELDIDENTIFIER%}}, std::move("{{%TYPE%}}"s), std::move("{{%NAME%}}"s), m_{{%NAME%}}, visitor);
17318 {{/%FIELDS%}}
17319 visitor.postVisit();
17320 }
17321
17322 template<class PreVisitor, class Visitor, class PostVisitor>
17323 inline void accept(PreVisitor &&preVisit, Visitor &&visit, PostVisitor &&postVisit) {
17324 (void)visit; // Prevent warnings from empty messages.
17325 std::forward<PreVisitor>(preVisit)(ID(), ShortName(), LongName());
17326 {{#%FIELDS%}}
17327 doTripletForwardVisit({{%FIELDIDENTIFIER%}}, std::move("{{%TYPE%}}"s), std::move("{{%NAME%}}"s), m_{{%NAME%}}, preVisit, visit, postVisit);
17328 {{/%FIELDS%}}
17329 std::forward<PostVisitor>(postVisit)();
17330 }
17331
17332 private:
17333 {{#%FIELDS%}}
17334 {{%TYPE%}} m_{{%NAME%}}{ {{%FIELD_DEFAULT_INITIALIZATION_VALUE%}}{{%INITIALIZER_SUFFIX%}} }; // field identifier = {{%FIELDIDENTIFIER%}}.
17335 {{/%FIELDS%}}
17336};
17337{{%NAMESPACE_CLOSING%}}
17338
17339template<>
17340struct isVisitable<{{%COMPLETEPACKAGENAME_WITH_COLON_SEPARATORS%}}{{%MESSAGE%}}> {
17341 static const bool value = true;
17342};
17343template<>
17344struct isTripletForwardVisitable<{{%COMPLETEPACKAGENAME_WITH_COLON_SEPARATORS%}}{{%MESSAGE%}}> {
17345 static const bool value = true;
17346};
17347#endif
17348)";
17349
17350std::string MetaMessageToCPPTransformator::content() noexcept {
17351 m_dataToBeRendered.set("%FIELDS%", m_fields);
17352
17353 kainjow::mustache::mustache tmpl{headerFileTemplate};
17354 // Reset Mustache's default string-escaper.
17355 tmpl.set_custom_escape([](const std::string &s) { return s; });
17356 std::stringstream sstr;
17357 sstr << tmpl.render(m_dataToBeRendered);
17358 const std::string str(sstr.str());
17359 return str;
17360}
17361
17362void MetaMessageToCPPTransformator::visit(const MetaMessage &mm) noexcept {
17363 kainjow::mustache::data dataToBeRendered;
17364 kainjow::mustache::data fields{kainjow::mustache::data::type::list};
17365
17366 try {
17367 std::map<MetaMessage::MetaField::MetaFieldDataTypes, std::string> typeToTypeStringMap = {
17368 {MetaMessage::MetaField::BOOL_T, "bool"},
17369 {MetaMessage::MetaField::CHAR_T, "char"},
17370 {MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT8_T, "uint8_t"},
17371 {MetaMessage::MetaField::INT8_T, "int8_t"},
17372 {MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT16_T, "uint16_t"},
17373 {MetaMessage::MetaField::INT16_T, "int16_t"},
17374 {MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT32_T, "uint32_t"},
17375 {MetaMessage::MetaField::INT32_T, "int32_t"},
17376 {MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT64_T, "uint64_t"},
17377 {MetaMessage::MetaField::INT64_T, "int64_t"},
17378 {MetaMessage::MetaField::FLOAT_T, "float"},
17379 {MetaMessage::MetaField::DOUBLE_T, "double"},
17380 {MetaMessage::MetaField::STRING_T, "std::string"},
17381 {MetaMessage::MetaField::BYTES_T, "std::string"},
17382 };
17383
17384 std::map<MetaMessage::MetaField::MetaFieldDataTypes, std::string> typeToDefaultInitizationValueMap = {
17385 {MetaMessage::MetaField::BOOL_T, "false"},
17386 {MetaMessage::MetaField::CHAR_T, "'\\0'"},
17387 {MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT8_T, "0"},
17388 {MetaMessage::MetaField::INT8_T, "0"},
17389 {MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT16_T, "0"},
17390 {MetaMessage::MetaField::INT16_T, "0"},
17391 {MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT32_T, "0"},
17392 {MetaMessage::MetaField::INT32_T, "0"},
17393 {MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT64_T, "0"},
17394 {MetaMessage::MetaField::INT64_T, "0"},
17395 {MetaMessage::MetaField::FLOAT_T, "0.0"},
17396 {MetaMessage::MetaField::DOUBLE_T, "0.0"},
17397 {MetaMessage::MetaField::STRING_T, R"("")"},
17398 {MetaMessage::MetaField::BYTES_T, R"("")"},
17399 };
17400
17401 std::string namespacePrefix;
17402 std::string messageName{mm.messageName()};
17403 const auto pos = mm.messageName().find_last_of('.');
17404 if (std::string::npos != pos) {
17405 namespacePrefix = mm.messageName().substr(0, pos);
17406 messageName = mm.messageName().substr(pos + 1);
17407 }
17408
17409 const std::string completePackageName = mm.packageName() + (!mm.packageName().empty() && !namespacePrefix.empty() ? "." : "") + namespacePrefix;
17410 const std::string completePackageNameWithColonSeparators{std::regex_replace(completePackageName, std::regex("\\."), "::")}; // NOLINT
17411 const std::string namespaceHeader{std::regex_replace(completePackageName, std::regex("\\."), " { namespace ")}; // NOLINT
17412 const std::string namespaceFooter(
17413 static_cast<uint32_t>(std::count(std::begin(namespaceHeader), std::end(namespaceHeader), '{')) + (!namespaceHeader.empty() ? 1 : 0), '}');
17414 std::string headerGuard{std::regex_replace(completePackageName, std::regex("\\."), "_")}; // NOLINT
17415 headerGuard += (!headerGuard.empty() ? +"_" : "") + messageName;
17416 std::transform(std::begin(headerGuard), std::end(headerGuard), std::begin(headerGuard), [](unsigned char c) { return ::toupper(c); });
17417
17418 dataToBeRendered.set("%HEADER_GUARD%", headerGuard);
17419 dataToBeRendered.set("%NAMESPACE_OPENING%", (!namespaceHeader.empty() ? "namespace " + namespaceHeader + " {" : ""));
17420 dataToBeRendered.set("%COMPLETEPACKAGENAME%", completePackageName + (!completePackageName.empty() ? "." : ""));
17421 dataToBeRendered.set("%COMPLETEPACKAGENAME_WITH_COLON_SEPARATORS%",
17422 completePackageNameWithColonSeparators + (!completePackageNameWithColonSeparators.empty() ? "::" : ""));
17423 dataToBeRendered.set("%MESSAGE%", messageName);
17424 dataToBeRendered.set("%NAMESPACE_CLOSING%", namespaceFooter);
17425 dataToBeRendered.set("%IDENTIFIER%", std::to_string(mm.messageIdentifier()));
17426
17427 for (const auto &e : mm.listOfMetaFields()) {
17428 std::string fieldName{std::regex_replace(e.fieldName(), std::regex("\\."), "_")}; // NOLINT
17429 kainjow::mustache::data fieldEntry;
17430 fieldEntry.set("%NAME%", fieldName);
17431 if (MetaMessage::MetaField::MESSAGE_T != e.fieldDataType()) {
17432 fieldEntry.set("%TYPE%", typeToTypeStringMap[e.fieldDataType()]);
17433
17434 const std::string defaultInitializatioValue{
17435 (e.defaultInitializationValue().empty() ? typeToDefaultInitizationValueMap[e.fieldDataType()] : e.defaultInitializationValue())};
17436 fieldEntry.set("%FIELD_DEFAULT_INITIALIZATION_VALUE%", defaultInitializatioValue);
17437
17438 std::string initializerSuffix;
17439 if (e.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::FLOAT_T) {
17440 initializerSuffix = "f"; // suffix for float types.
17441 } else if (e.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::STRING_T || e.fieldDataType() == MetaMessage::MetaField::BYTES_T) {
17442 initializerSuffix = "s"; // suffix to enforce std::string initialization.
17443 }
17444 fieldEntry.set("%INITIALIZER_SUFFIX%", initializerSuffix);
17445 } else {
17446 const std::string tmp{mm.packageName() + (!mm.packageName().empty() ? "." : "") + e.fieldDataTypeName()};
17447 const std::string completeDataTypeNameWithDoubleColons{std::regex_replace(tmp, std::regex("\\."), "::")}; // NOLINT
17448
17449 fieldEntry.set("%TYPE%", completeDataTypeNameWithDoubleColons);
17450 }
17451 fieldEntry.set("%FIELDIDENTIFIER%", std::to_string(e.fieldIdentifier()));
17452
17453 fields.push_back(fieldEntry);
17454 }
17455 } catch (std::regex_error &) { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
17456 }
17457
17458 m_dataToBeRendered = std::move(dataToBeRendered);
17459 m_fields = std::move(fields);
17460}
17461} // namespace cluon
17462/*
17463 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
17464 *
17465 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
17466 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
17467 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
17468 */
17469
17470//#include "cluon/MetaMessageToProtoTransformator.hpp"
17471//#include "cluon/MetaMessage.hpp"
17472
17473#include <algorithm>
17474#include <map>
17475#include <regex>
17476#include <sstream>
17477
17478//#include "Mustache/mustache.hpp"
17479
17480namespace cluon {
17481
17482const char *proto2FileTemplate = R"(
17483//
17484// THIS IS AN AUTO-GENERATED FILE. DO NOT MODIFY AS CHANGES MIGHT BE OVERWRITTEN!
17485//
17486
17487{{%PROTO2_HEADER%}}
17488
17489// Message identifier: {{%MESSAGE_IDENTIFIER%}}.
17490message {{%MESSAGE%}} {
17491 {{#%FIELDS%}}
17492 optional {{%TYPE%}} {{%NAME%}} = {{%FIELD_IDENTIFIER%}};
17493 {{/%FIELDS%}}
17494}
17495)";
17496
17497std::string MetaMessageToProtoTransformator::content(bool withProtoHeader) noexcept {
17498 if (withProtoHeader) {
17499 m_dataToBeRendered.set("%PROTO2_HEADER%", R"(
17500// This line is only needed when using Google Protobuf 3.
17501syntax = "proto2";
17502)");
17503 }
17504 m_dataToBeRendered.set("%FIELDS%", m_fields);
17505
17506 kainjow::mustache::mustache tmpl{proto2FileTemplate};
17507 // Reset Mustache's default string-escaper.
17508 tmpl.set_custom_escape([](const std::string &s) { return s; });
17509 std::stringstream sstr;
17510 sstr << tmpl.render(m_dataToBeRendered);
17511 const std::string str(sstr.str());
17512 return str;
17513}
17514
17515void MetaMessageToProtoTransformator::visit(const MetaMessage &mm) noexcept {
17516 kainjow::mustache::data dataToBeRendered;
17517 kainjow::mustache::data fields{kainjow::mustache::data::type::list};
17518
17519 std::map<MetaMessage::MetaField::MetaFieldDataTypes, std::string> typeToTypeStringMap = {
17520 {MetaMessage::MetaField::BOOL_T, "bool"},
17521 {MetaMessage::MetaField::CHAR_T, "sint32"},
17522 {MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT8_T, "uint32"},
17523 {MetaMessage::MetaField::INT8_T, "sint32"},
17524 {MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT16_T, "uint32"},
17525 {MetaMessage::MetaField::INT16_T, "sint32"},
17526 {MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT32_T, "uint32"},
17527 {MetaMessage::MetaField::INT32_T, "sint32"},
17528 {MetaMessage::MetaField::UINT64_T, "uint64"},
17529 {MetaMessage::MetaField::INT64_T, "sint64"},
17530 {MetaMessage::MetaField::FLOAT_T, "float"},
17531 {MetaMessage::MetaField::DOUBLE_T, "double"},
17532 {MetaMessage::MetaField::STRING_T, "string"},
17533 {MetaMessage::MetaField::BYTES_T, "bytes"},
17534 };
17535
17536 std::string namespacePrefix;
17537 std::string messageName{mm.messageName()};
17538 const auto pos = mm.messageName().find_last_of('.');
17539 if (std::string::npos != pos) {
17540 namespacePrefix = mm.messageName().substr(0, pos);
17541 messageName = mm.messageName().substr(pos + 1);
17542 }
17543
17544 std::string packageNameWithUnderscores{mm.packageName()};
17545 std::replace(packageNameWithUnderscores.begin(), packageNameWithUnderscores.end(), '.', '_');
17546 const std::string completePackageNameWithNamespacePrefix
17547 = packageNameWithUnderscores + (!packageNameWithUnderscores.empty() && !namespacePrefix.empty() ? "." : "") + namespacePrefix;
17548
17549 std::string completePackageNameWithNamespacePrefixWithUnderscores{completePackageNameWithNamespacePrefix};
17550 std::replace(completePackageNameWithNamespacePrefixWithUnderscores.begin(), completePackageNameWithNamespacePrefixWithUnderscores.end(), '.', '_');
17551 const std::string completeMessageNameWithUnderscores
17552 = completePackageNameWithNamespacePrefixWithUnderscores + (!completePackageNameWithNamespacePrefixWithUnderscores.empty() ? +"_" : "") + messageName;
17553
17554 dataToBeRendered.set("%MESSAGE_IDENTIFIER%", std::to_string(mm.messageIdentifier()));
17555 dataToBeRendered.set("%MESSAGE%", completeMessageNameWithUnderscores);
17556
17557 for (const auto &f : mm.listOfMetaFields()) {
17558 std::string fieldName{f.fieldName()};
17559 std::replace(fieldName.begin(), fieldName.end(), '.', '_');
17560
17561 kainjow::mustache::data fieldEntry;
17562 fieldEntry.set("%NAME%", fieldName);
17563 if (MetaMessage::MetaField::MESSAGE_T != f.fieldDataType()) {
17564 fieldEntry.set("%TYPE%", typeToTypeStringMap[f.fieldDataType()]);
17565 } else {
17566 std::string dataTypeNameWithUnderscores{f.fieldDataTypeName()};
17567 std::replace(dataTypeNameWithUnderscores.begin(), dataTypeNameWithUnderscores.end(), '.', '_');
17568 std::string tmp{packageNameWithUnderscores + (!packageNameWithUnderscores.empty() ? "_" : "")};
17569 tmp += dataTypeNameWithUnderscores;
17570 fieldEntry.set("%TYPE%", tmp);
17571 }
17572 fieldEntry.set("%FIELD_IDENTIFIER%", std::to_string(f.fieldIdentifier()));
17573 fields.push_back(fieldEntry);
17574 }
17575
17576 m_dataToBeRendered = std::move(dataToBeRendered);
17577 m_fields = std::move(fields);
17578}
17579} // namespace cluon
17580/*
17581 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
17582 *
17583 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
17584 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
17585 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
17586 */
17587
17588#ifndef CLUON_MSC_HPP
17589#define CLUON_MSC_HPP
17590
17591//#include "cluon/MessageParser.hpp"
17592//#include "cluon/MetaMessage.hpp"
17593//#include "cluon/MetaMessageToCPPTransformator.hpp"
17594//#include "cluon/MetaMessageToProtoTransformator.hpp"
17595
17596//#include "argh/argh.h"
17597
17598#include <fstream>
17599#include <iostream>
17600#include <sstream>
17601#include <string>
17602
17603inline int32_t cluon_msc(int32_t argc, char **argv) {
17604 const std::string PROGRAM{argv[0]}; // NOLINT
17605 argh::parser commandline(argc, argv);
17606
17607 std::string inputFilename = commandline.pos_args().back();
17608 if (std::string::npos != inputFilename.find(PROGRAM)) {
17609 std::cerr << PROGRAM
17610 << " transforms a given message specification file in .odvd format into C++." << std::endl;
17611 std::cerr << "Usage: " << PROGRAM << " [--cpp] [--proto] [--out=<file>] <odvd file>" << std::endl;
17612 std::cerr << " " << PROGRAM << " --cpp: Generate C++14-compliant, self-contained header file." << std::endl;
17613 std::cerr << " " << PROGRAM << " --proto: Generate Proto version2-compliant file." << std::endl;
17614 std::cerr << std::endl;
17615 std::cerr << "Example: " << PROGRAM << " --cpp --out=/tmp/myOutput.hpp myFile.odvd" << std::endl;
17616 return 1;
17617 }
17618
17619 std::string outputFilename;
17620 commandline({"--out"}) >> outputFilename;
17621
17622 const bool generateCPP = commandline[{"--cpp"}];
17623 const bool generateProto = commandline[{"--proto"}];
17624
17625 int retVal = 1;
17626 std::ifstream inputFile(inputFilename, std::ios::in);
17627 if (inputFile.good()) {
17628 bool addHeaderForFirstProtoFile = true;
17629 std::string input(static_cast<std::stringstream const&>(std::stringstream() << inputFile.rdbuf()).str()); // NOLINT
17630
17631 cluon::MessageParser mp;
17632 auto result = mp.parse(input);
17633 retVal = result.second;
17634
17635 // Delete the content of a potentially existing file.
17636 if (!outputFilename.empty()) {
17637 std::ofstream outputFile(outputFilename, std::ios::out | std::ios::trunc);
17638 outputFile.close();
17639 }
17640 for (auto e : result.first) {
17641 std::string content;
17642 if (generateCPP) {
17643 cluon::MetaMessageToCPPTransformator transformation;
17644 e.accept([&trans = transformation](const cluon::MetaMessage &_mm){ trans.visit(_mm); });
17645 content = transformation.content();
17646 }
17647 if (generateProto) {
17648 cluon::MetaMessageToProtoTransformator transformation;
17649 e.accept([&trans = transformation](const cluon::MetaMessage &_mm){ trans.visit(_mm); });
17650 content = transformation.content(addHeaderForFirstProtoFile);
17651 addHeaderForFirstProtoFile = false;
17652 }
17653
17654 if (!outputFilename.empty()) {
17655 std::ofstream outputFile(outputFilename, std::ios::out | std::ios::app);
17656 outputFile << content << std::endl;
17657 outputFile.close();
17658 }
17659 else { // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
17660 std::cout << content << std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
17661 }
17662 }
17663 }
17664 else {
17665 std::cerr << "[" << PROGRAM << "] Could not find '" << inputFilename << "'." << std::endl;
17666 }
17667
17668 return retVal;
17669}
17670
17671#endif
17672/*
17673 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
17674 *
17675 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
17676 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
17677 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
17678 */
17679
17680// This test for a compiler definition is necessary to preserve single-file, header-only compability.
17681#ifndef HAVE_CLUON_MSC
17682#include "cluon-msc.hpp"
17683#endif
17684
17685#include <cstdint>
17686
17687int32_t main(int32_t argc, char **argv) {
17688 return cluon_msc(argc, argv);
17689}
17690#endif
17691#ifdef HAVE_CLUON_REPLAY
17692/*
17693 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
17694 *
17695 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
17696 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
17697 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
17698 */
17699
17700#ifndef CLUON_REPLAY_HPP
17701#define CLUON_REPLAY_HPP
17702
17703//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
17704//#include "cluon/Envelope.hpp"
17705//#include "cluon/OD4Session.hpp"
17706//#include "cluon/ToProtoVisitor.hpp"
17707//#include "cluon/Player.hpp"
17708//#include "cluon/cluonDataStructures.hpp"
17709
17710#include <cstdint>
17711#include <fstream>
17712#include <iostream>
17713#include <memory>
17714#include <mutex>
17715#include <string>
17716#include <thread>
17717
17718inline int32_t cluon_replay(int32_t argc, char **argv) {
17719 int32_t retCode{0};
17720 const std::string PROGRAM{argv[0]}; // NOLINT
17721 auto commandlineArguments = cluon::getCommandlineArguments(argc, argv);
17722 if (1 == argc) {
17723 std::cerr << PROGRAM << " replays a .rec file into an OpenDaVINCI session or to stdout; if playing back to an OD4Session using parameter --cid, you can specify the optional parameter --stdout to also playback to stdout; --keeprunning keeps " << PROGRAM << " open at the end of a recording file." << std::endl;
17724 std::cerr << "Usage: " << PROGRAM << " [--cid=<OpenDaVINCI session> [--stdout] [--keeprunning]] recording.rec" << std::endl;
17725 std::cerr << "Example: " << PROGRAM << " --cid=111 file.rec" << std::endl;
17726 std::cerr << " " << PROGRAM << " --cid=111 --stdout file.rec" << std::endl;
17727 std::cerr << " " << PROGRAM << " file.rec" << std::endl;
17728 retCode = 1;
17729 }
17730 else {
17731 const bool playBackToStdout = ( (0 != commandlineArguments.count("stdout")) || (0 == commandlineArguments.count("cid")) );
17732 const bool keepRunning = (0 != commandlineArguments.count("keeprunning"));
17733
17734 std::string recFile;
17735 for (auto e : commandlineArguments) {
17736 if (recFile.empty() && e.second.empty() && e.first != PROGRAM) {
17737 recFile = e.first;
17738 break;
17739 }
17740 }
17741
17742 std::fstream fin(recFile, std::ios::in|std::ios::binary);
17743 if (fin.good()) {
17744 std::atomic<bool> playCommandUpdate{false};
17745 std::mutex playerCommandMutex;
17746 cluon::data::PlayerCommand playerCommand;
17747
17748 // Create an OD4Session to relay the.
17749 std::unique_ptr<cluon::OD4Session> od4;
17750 if (0 != commandlineArguments.count("cid")) {
17751 // Interface to a running OpenDaVINCI session and listening for PlayerCommands.
17752 od4 = std::make_unique<cluon::OD4Session>(static_cast<uint16_t>(std::stoi(commandlineArguments["cid"]))); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
17753 if (od4) {
17754 od4->dataTrigger(cluon::data::PlayerCommand::ID(), [&playCommandUpdate, &playerCommandMutex, &playerCommand](cluon::data::Envelope &&env){
17755 cluon::data::PlayerCommand pc = cluon::extractMessage<cluon::data::PlayerCommand>(std::move(env));
17756 {
17757 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(playerCommandMutex);
17758 playerCommand = pc;
17759 }
17760 playCommandUpdate = true;
17761 });
17762 }
17763 }
17764
17765 // Listen for PlayerStatus updates.
17766 std::atomic<bool> playerStatusUpdate{false};
17767 std::mutex playerStatusMutex;
17768 cluon::data::PlayerStatus playerStatus;
17769 {
17770 std::string s;
17771 playerStatus.state(1); // Report: "loading file"
17772 {
17773 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(playerStatusMutex);
17774
17775 cluon::ToProtoVisitor protoEncoder;
17776 playerStatus.accept(protoEncoder);
17777 s = protoEncoder.encodedData();
17778 }
17779 cluon::data::Envelope env;
17780 env.dataType(playerStatus.ID())
17781 .sent(cluon::time::now())
17782 .sampleTimeStamp(cluon::time::now())
17783 .serializedData(s);
17784
17785 if (od4 && od4->isRunning()) {
17786 od4->send(std::move(env));
17787 }
17788 else {
17789 std::cout << cluon::serializeEnvelope(std::move(env));
17790 std::cout.flush();
17791 }
17792 }
17793 constexpr bool AUTOREWIND{false};
17794 constexpr bool THREADING{true};
17795 cluon::Player player(recFile, AUTOREWIND, THREADING);
17796 player.setPlayerListener([&playerStatusUpdate, &playerStatusMutex, &playerStatus](cluon::data::PlayerStatus &&ps){
17797 {
17798 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(playerStatusMutex);
17799 playerStatus = ps;
17800 }
17801 playerStatusUpdate = true;
17802 });
17803
17804 {
17805 std::string s;
17806 playerStatus.numberOfEntries(player.totalNumberOfEnvelopesInRecFile());
17807 playerStatus.state(2); // playback file
17808 {
17809 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(playerStatusMutex);
17810
17811 cluon::ToProtoVisitor protoEncoder;
17812 playerStatus.accept(protoEncoder);
17813 s = protoEncoder.encodedData();
17814 }
17815 cluon::data::Envelope env;
17816 env.dataType(playerStatus.ID())
17817 .sent(cluon::time::now())
17818 .sampleTimeStamp(cluon::time::now())
17819 .serializedData(s);
17820
17821 if (od4 && od4->isRunning()) {
17822 od4->send(std::move(env));
17823 }
17824 else {
17825 std::cout << cluon::serializeEnvelope(std::move(env));
17826 std::cout.flush();
17827 }
17828 }
17829
17830 bool play = true;
17831 bool step = false;
17832 while ( (player.hasMoreData() || keepRunning) ) {
17833 // Stop execution in case of a running OD4Session.
17834 if (od4 && !od4->isRunning()) {
17835 break;
17836 }
17837 // If we are at the end of the playback file, simply wait a little to avoid excessive system load.
17838 if (!player.hasMoreData() && keepRunning) {
17839 std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::duration<int32_t, std::milli>(200)); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
17840 }
17841 // Check for broadcasting status updates.
17842 if (playerStatusUpdate) {
17843 std::string s;
17844 {
17845 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(playerStatusMutex);
17846
17847 cluon::ToProtoVisitor protoEncoder;
17848 playerStatus.accept(protoEncoder);
17849 s = protoEncoder.encodedData();
17850 }
17851 cluon::data::Envelope env;
17852 env.dataType(playerStatus.ID())
17853 .sent(cluon::time::now())
17854 .sampleTimeStamp(cluon::time::now())
17855 .serializedData(s);
17856
17857 if (od4 && od4->isRunning()) {
17858 cluon::data::Envelope e = env;
17859 od4->send(std::move(e));
17860 }
17861 if (playBackToStdout) {
17862 cluon::data::Envelope e = env;
17863 std::cout << cluon::serializeEnvelope(std::move(e));
17864 std::cout.flush();
17865 }
17866 playerStatusUpdate = false;
17867 }
17868 // Check for remotely controlling the player.
17869 if (playCommandUpdate) {
17870 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(playerCommandMutex);
17871 if ( (playerCommand.command() == 1) || (playerCommand.command() == 2) ) {
17872 play = !(2 == playerCommand.command()); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
17873 std::clog << PROGRAM << ": Change state: " << +playerCommand.command() << ", play = " << play << std::endl;
17874 }
17875
17876 if (3 == playerCommand.command()) {
17877 std::clog << PROGRAM << ": Change state: " << +playerCommand.command() << ", seekTo: " << playerCommand.seekTo() << std::endl;
17878 player.seekTo(playerCommand.seekTo());
17879 }
17880
17881 if (4 == playerCommand.command()) {
17882 play = false;
17883 step = true;
17884 std::clog << PROGRAM << ": Change state: " << +playerCommand.command() << ", play = " << play << std::endl;
17885 }
17886
17887 playCommandUpdate = false;
17888 }
17889 // If playback is desired, relay the Envelope to the OD4Session.
17890 if (play || step) {
17891 auto next = player.getNextEnvelopeToBeReplayed();
17892 if (next.first) {
17893 if (od4 && od4->isRunning()) {
17894 cluon::data::Envelope e = next.second;
17895 od4->send(std::move(e));
17896 }
17897 if (playBackToStdout) {
17898 cluon::data::Envelope e = next.second;
17899 std::cout << cluon::serializeEnvelope(std::move(e));
17900 std::cout.flush();
17901 }
17902 std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::duration<int32_t, std::micro>(player.delay()));
17903 }
17904 }
17905 else {
17906 std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::duration<int32_t, std::milli>(100)); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
17907 } // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
17908
17909 // Reset step.
17910 step = false;
17911 }
17912 retCode = 0;
17913 }
17914 else {
17915 std::cerr << PROGRAM << ": file '" << recFile << "' not found." << std::endl;
17916 retCode = 1;
17917 }
17918 }
17919 return retCode;
17920}
17921
17922#endif
17923
17924/*
17925 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
17926 *
17927 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
17928 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
17929 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
17930 */
17931
17932// This test for a compiler definition is necessary to preserve single-file, header-only compability.
17933#ifndef HAVE_CLUON_REPLAY
17934#include "cluon-replay.hpp"
17935#endif
17936
17937#include <cstdint>
17938
17939int32_t main(int32_t argc, char **argv) {
17940 return cluon_replay(argc, argv);
17941}
17942#endif
17943#ifdef HAVE_CLUON_LIVEFEED
17944/*
17945 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
17946 *
17947 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
17948 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
17949 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
17950 */
17951
17952#ifndef CLUON_LIVEFEED_HPP
17953#define CLUON_LIVEFEED_HPP
17954
17955//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
17956//#include "cluon/MetaMessage.hpp"
17957//#include "cluon/MessageParser.hpp"
17958//#include "cluon/OD4Session.hpp"
17959//#include "cluon/TerminateHandler.hpp"
17960
17961#include <chrono>
17962#include <cstdint>
17963#include <fstream>
17964#include <iomanip>
17965#include <iostream>
17966#include <unordered_map>
17967#include <mutex>
17968#include <sstream>
17969#include <string>
17970#include <thread>
17971
17972enum Color {
17973 RED = 31,
17974 GREEN = 32,
17975 YELLOW = 33,
17976 DEFAULT = 39,
17977};
17978
17979inline void clearScreen() {
17980 std::cout << "\033[2J" << std::endl;
17981}
17982
17983inline void writeText(Color c, uint8_t y, uint8_t x, const std::string &text) {
17984 std::cout << "\033[" << +y << ";" << +x << "H" << "\033[0;" << +c << "m" << text << "\033[0m" << std::endl;
17985}
17986
17987inline std::string formatTimeStamp(const cluon::data::TimeStamp &ts) {
17988 std::time_t temp = static_cast<std::time_t>(ts.seconds());
17989 std::tm* t = std::gmtime(&temp);
17990 std::stringstream sstr;
17991 sstr << std::put_time(t, "%H:%M:%S") << "." << std::setfill('0') << std::setw(6) << ts.microseconds() << std::setw(0);
17992 const std::string str{sstr.str()};
17993 return str;
17994}
17995
17996inline int32_t cluon_livefeed(int32_t argc, char **argv) {
17997 int retVal{1};
17998 const std::string PROGRAM{argv[0]}; // NOLINT
17999 auto commandlineArguments = cluon::getCommandlineArguments(argc, argv);
18000 if (0 == commandlineArguments.count("cid")) {
18001 std::cerr << PROGRAM
18002 << " displays any Envelopes received from an OpenDaVINCI v4 session to stdout with optional data type resolving using a .odvd message specification." << std::endl;
18003 std::cerr << "Usage: " << PROGRAM << " [--odvd=<ODVD message specification file>] --cid=<OpenDaVINCI session>" << std::endl;
18004 std::cerr << "Examples: " << PROGRAM << " --cid=111" << std::endl;
18005 std::cerr << " " << PROGRAM << " --odvd=MyMessages.odvd --cid=111" << std::endl;
18006 } else {
18007 std::map<int32_t, cluon::MetaMessage> scopeOfMetaMessages{};
18008
18009 // Try parsing a supplied .odvd file to resolve numerical data types to human readable message names.
18010 {
18011 std::string odvdFile{commandlineArguments["odvd"]};
18012 if (!odvdFile.empty()) {
18013 std::fstream fin{odvdFile, std::ios::in};
18014 if (fin.good()) {
18015 const std::string s{static_cast<std::stringstream const&>(std::stringstream() << fin.rdbuf()).str()}; // NOLINT
18016
18017 cluon::MessageParser mp;
18018 auto parsingResult = mp.parse(s);
18019 if (!parsingResult.first.empty()) {
18020 for (const auto &mm : parsingResult.first) { scopeOfMetaMessages[mm.messageIdentifier()] = mm; }
18021 std::clog << "Parsed " << parsingResult.first.size() << " message(s)." << std::endl;
18022 }
18023 }
18024 }
18025 }
18026
18027 std::mutex mapOfLastEnvelopesMutex;
18028 std::unordered_map<int32_t, std::unordered_map<uint32_t, cluon::data::Envelope, cluon::UseUInt32ValueAsHashKey>, cluon::UseUInt32ValueAsHashKey> mapOfLastEnvelopes;
18029 std::unordered_map<int32_t, std::unordered_map<uint32_t, float>, cluon::UseUInt32ValueAsHashKey> mapOfUpdateRates;
18030
18031 cluon::OD4Session od4Session(static_cast<uint16_t>(std::stoi(commandlineArguments["cid"])),
18032 [&mapOfLastEnvelopesMutex, &mapOfLastEnvelopes, &mapOfUpdateRates](cluon::data::Envelope &&envelope) noexcept {
18033 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(mapOfLastEnvelopesMutex);
18034
18035 int64_t lastTimeStamp{0};
18036 int64_t currentTimeStamp{0};
18037 {
18038 // Update mapping for tupel (dataType, senderStamp) --> Envelope.
18039 auto entry = mapOfLastEnvelopes[envelope.dataType()];
18040 if (0 != entry.count(envelope.senderStamp())) {
18041 lastTimeStamp = cluon::time::toMicroseconds(entry[envelope.senderStamp()].sampleTimeStamp()); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
18042 }
18043 currentTimeStamp = cluon::time::toMicroseconds(envelope.sampleTimeStamp()); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
18044 if (currentTimeStamp != lastTimeStamp) {
18045 entry[envelope.senderStamp()] = envelope; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
18046 mapOfLastEnvelopes[envelope.dataType()] = entry; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
18047 }
18048 }
18049 if (currentTimeStamp != lastTimeStamp) {
18050 // Update mapping for tupel (dataType, senderStamp) --> deltaToLastEnvelope.
18051 auto entry = mapOfUpdateRates[envelope.dataType()];
18052
18053 float average{0};
18054 if (0 != entry.count(envelope.senderStamp())) {
18055 average = entry[envelope.senderStamp()]; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
18056 float freq = (static_cast<float>(currentTimeStamp - lastTimeStamp))/(1000.0f*1000.0f); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
18057 average = (1.0f/freq)*0.1f + 0.9f*average; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
18058 }
18059 entry[envelope.senderStamp()] = average;
18060 mapOfUpdateRates[envelope.dataType()] = entry;
18061 }
18062 });
18063
18064 if (od4Session.isRunning()) {
18065 od4Session.timeTrigger(5, [&mapOfLastEnvelopesMutex, &mapOfLastEnvelopes, &mapOfUpdateRates, &scopeOfMetaMessages, &od4Session](){
18066 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lck(mapOfLastEnvelopesMutex);
18067
18068 if (!mapOfLastEnvelopes.empty()) {
18069 clearScreen();
18070
18071 uint8_t y = 1;
18072 const uint8_t x = 1;
18073 for (auto e : mapOfLastEnvelopes) {
18074 for (auto ee : e.second) {
18075 auto env = ee.second;
18076 std::stringstream sstr;
18077
18078 float freq{0};
18079 if ( (0 < mapOfUpdateRates.count(ee.second.dataType())) && (0 < mapOfUpdateRates[ee.second.dataType()].count(ee.second.senderStamp())) ) {
18080 freq = mapOfUpdateRates[ee.second.dataType()][ee.second.senderStamp()];
18081 }
18082
18083 sstr << "Envelope: " << std::setfill(' ') << std::setw(5) << env.dataType() << std::setw(0) << "/" << env.senderStamp() << "; " << (static_cast<float>(static_cast<uint32_t>(freq*100.0f))/100.f) << " Hz; " << "sent: " << formatTimeStamp(env.sent()) << "; sample: " << formatTimeStamp(env.sampleTimeStamp());
18084 if (scopeOfMetaMessages.count(env.dataType()) > 0) {
18085 sstr << "; " << scopeOfMetaMessages[env.dataType()].messageName();
18086 }
18087 else {
18088 sstr << "; unknown data type";
18089 }
18090 sstr << std::endl;
18091
18092 const auto AGE{cluon::time::deltaInMicroseconds(cluon::time::now(), env.received())};
18093
18094 Color c = Color::DEFAULT;
18095 if (AGE <= 2 * 1000 * 1000) { c = Color::GREEN; }
18096 if (AGE > 2 * 1000 * 1000 && AGE <= 5 * 1000 * 1000) { c = Color::YELLOW; }
18097 if (AGE > 5 * 1000 * 1000) { c = Color::RED; }
18098
18099 writeText(c, y++, x, sstr.str());
18100 }
18101 }
18102 }
18103 return od4Session.isRunning();
18104 });
18105
18106 retVal = 0;
18107 }
18108 }
18109 return retVal;
18110}
18111
18112#endif
18113
18114/*
18115 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
18116 *
18117 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
18118 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
18119 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
18120 */
18121
18122// This test for a compiler definition is necessary to preserve single-file, header-only compability.
18123#ifndef HAVE_CLUON_LIVEFEED
18124#include "cluon-livefeed.hpp"
18125#endif
18126
18127#include <cstdint>
18128
18129int32_t main(int32_t argc, char **argv) {
18130 return cluon_livefeed(argc, argv);
18131}
18132#endif
18133#ifdef HAVE_CLUON_REC2CSV
18134/*
18135 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
18136 *
18137 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
18138 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
18139 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
18140 */
18141
18142#ifndef CLUON_REC2CSV_HPP
18143#define CLUON_REC2CSV_HPP
18144
18145//#include "cluon/cluon.hpp"
18146//#include "cluon/GenericMessage.hpp"
18147//#include "cluon/MessageParser.hpp"
18148//#include "cluon/MetaMessage.hpp"
18149//#include "cluon/Player.hpp"
18150//#include "cluon/ToCSVVisitor.hpp"
18151//#include "cluon/stringtoolbox.hpp"
18152//#include "cluon/cluonDataStructures.hpp"
18153
18154#include <algorithm>
18155#include <cstdint>
18156#include <iostream>
18157#include <map>
18158#include <sstream>
18159#include <string>
18160#include <thread>
18161
18162inline int32_t cluon_rec2csv(int32_t argc, char **argv) {
18163 int32_t retCode{0};
18164 auto commandlineArguments = cluon::getCommandlineArguments(argc, argv);
18165 if ( (0 == commandlineArguments.count("rec")) || (0 == commandlineArguments.count("odvd")) ) {
18166 std::cerr << argv[0] << " extracts the content from a given .rec file using a provided .odvd message specification into separate .csv files." << std::endl;
18167 std::cerr << "Usage: " << argv[0] << " --rec=<Recording from an OD4Session> --odvd=<ODVD Message Specification>" << std::endl;
18168 std::cerr << "Example: " << argv[0] << " --rec=myRecording.rec --odvd=myMessages.odvd" << std::endl;
18169 retCode = 1;
18170 } else {
18171 // Maps of container-ID & sender-stamp.
18172 std::map<std::string, std::string> mapOfFilenames;
18173 std::map<std::string, std::string> mapOfEntries;
18174 std::map<std::string, size_t> mapOfEntriesSizes;
18175 std::map<std::string, bool> mapOfFilenamesThatHaveBeenReset;
18176
18177 cluon::MessageParser mp;
18178 std::pair<std::vector<cluon::MetaMessage>, cluon::MessageParser::MessageParserErrorCodes> messageParserResult;
18179 {
18180 std::ifstream fin(commandlineArguments["odvd"], std::ios::in|std::ios::binary);
18181 if (fin.good()) {
18182 std::string input(static_cast<std::stringstream const&>(std::stringstream() << fin.rdbuf()).str()); // NOLINT
18183 fin.close();
18184 messageParserResult = mp.parse(input);
18185 std::clog << "Found " << messageParserResult.first.size() << " messages." << std::endl;
18186 }
18187 else {
18188 std::cerr << argv[0] << ": Message specification '" << commandlineArguments["odvd"] << "' not found." << std::endl;
18189 return retCode = 1;
18190 }
18191 }
18192
18193 std::fstream fin(commandlineArguments["rec"], std::ios::in|std::ios::binary);
18194 if (fin.good()) {
18195 fin.close();
18196
18197 auto fileWriter = [argv, &mapOfFilenames, &mapOfEntries, &mapOfEntriesSizes, &mapOfFilenamesThatHaveBeenReset](){
18198 for(auto entries : mapOfFilenames) {
18199 std::cerr << argv[0] << " writing '" << entries.second << ".csv'...";
18200 // Reset files on first access.
18201 std::ios_base::openmode openMode = std::ios::out|std::ios::binary|(mapOfFilenamesThatHaveBeenReset.count(entries.second) == 0 ? std::ios::trunc : std::ios::app);
18202 std::fstream fout(entries.second + ".csv", openMode);
18203 if (fout.good() && mapOfEntries.count(entries.first)) {
18204 const std::string tmp{mapOfEntries[entries.first]};
18205 fout.write(tmp.c_str(), static_cast<std::streamsize>(tmp.size()));
18206 // Reset memory.
18207 mapOfEntries[entries.first] = "";
18208 mapOfEntriesSizes[entries.first] = 0;
18209 }
18210 fout.close();
18211 mapOfFilenamesThatHaveBeenReset[entries.second] = true;
18212 std::cerr << " done." << std::endl;
18213 }
18214 };
18215
18216 std::map<int32_t, cluon::MetaMessage> scope;
18217 for (const auto &e : messageParserResult.first) { scope[e.messageIdentifier()] = e; }
18218
18219 constexpr const bool AUTOREWIND{false};
18220 constexpr const bool THREADING{false};
18221 cluon::Player player(commandlineArguments["rec"], AUTOREWIND, THREADING);
18222
18223 constexpr const size_t TEN_MB{10*1024*1024};
18224 uint32_t envelopeCounter{0};
18225 int32_t oldPercentage = -1;
18226 while (player.hasMoreData()) {
18227 auto next = player.getNextEnvelopeToBeReplayed();
18228 if (next.first) {
18229 {
18230 envelopeCounter++;
18231 const int32_t percentage = static_cast<int32_t>((static_cast<float>(envelopeCounter)*100.0f)/static_cast<float>(player.totalNumberOfEnvelopesInRecFile()));
18232 if ( (percentage % 5 == 0) && (percentage != oldPercentage) ) {
18233 std::cerr << argv[0] << ": Processed " << percentage << "%." << std::endl;
18234 oldPercentage = percentage;
18235 }
18236 }
18237 cluon::data::Envelope env{std::move(next.second)};
18238 if (scope.count(env.dataType()) > 0) {
18239 cluon::FromProtoVisitor protoDecoder;
18240 std::stringstream sstr(env.serializedData());
18241 protoDecoder.decodeFrom(sstr);
18242
18243 cluon::MetaMessage m = scope[env.dataType()];
18244 cluon::GenericMessage gm;
18245 gm.createFrom(m, messageParserResult.first);
18246 gm.accept(protoDecoder);
18247
18248 std::stringstream sstrKey;
18249 sstrKey << env.dataType() << "/" << env.senderStamp();
18250 const std::string KEY = sstrKey.str();
18251
18252 std::stringstream sstrFilename;
18253 sstrFilename << m.messageName() << "-" << env.senderStamp();
18254 const std::string __FILENAME = sstrFilename.str();
18255 mapOfFilenames[KEY] = __FILENAME;
18256
18257 if (mapOfEntries.count(KEY) > 0) {
18258 // Extract timestamps.
18259 std::string timeStamps;
18260 {
18261 cluon::ToCSVVisitor csv(';', false, { {1,false}, {2,false}, {3,true}, {4,true}, {5,true}, {6,false} });
18262 env.accept(csv);
18263 timeStamps = csv.csv();
18264 }
18265
18266 cluon::ToCSVVisitor csv(';', false);
18267 gm.accept(csv);
18268
18269 std::string entry{stringtoolbox::split(timeStamps, '\n')[0] + csv.csv()};
18270 mapOfEntries[KEY] += entry;
18271 mapOfEntriesSizes[KEY] += entry.size();
18272 }
18273 else {
18274 // Extract timestamps.
18275 std::vector<std::string> timeStampsWithHeader;
18276 {
18277 // Skip senderStamp (as it is in file name) and serializedData.
18278 cluon::ToCSVVisitor csv(';', true, { {1,false}, {2,false}, {3,true}, {4,true}, {5,true}, {6,false} });
18279 env.accept(csv);
18280 timeStampsWithHeader = stringtoolbox::split(csv.csv(), '\n');
18281 }
18282
18283 cluon::ToCSVVisitor csv(';', true);
18284 gm.accept(csv);
18285
18286 std::vector<std::string> valuesWithHeader = stringtoolbox::split(csv.csv(), '\n');
18287 std::string entry{timeStampsWithHeader.at(0) + valuesWithHeader.at(0) + '\n' + timeStampsWithHeader.at(1) + valuesWithHeader.at(1) + '\n'};
18288 mapOfEntries[KEY] += entry;
18289 mapOfEntriesSizes[KEY] += entry.size();
18290 }
18291
18292 // Keep track of buffer sizes.
18293 if (mapOfEntriesSizes[KEY] > TEN_MB) {
18294 std::cerr << argv[0] << ": Buffer for '" << KEY << "' has consumed " << mapOfEntriesSizes[KEY] << "/" << TEN_MB << " bytes; dumping data to disk."<< std::endl; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
18295 fileWriter(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
18296 }
18297 }
18298 }
18299 }
18300 // Clear buffer at the end.
18301 fileWriter();
18302 }
18303 else {
18304 std::cerr << argv[0] << ": Recording '" << commandlineArguments["rec"] << "' not found." << std::endl;
18305 retCode = 1;
18306 }
18307 }
18308 return retCode;
18309}
18310
18311#endif
18312/*
18313 * Copyright (C) 2017-2018 Christian Berger
18314 *
18315 * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
18316 * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
18317 * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
18318 */
18319
18320// This test for a compiler definition is necessary to preserve single-file, header-only compability.
18321#ifndef HAVE_CLUON_REC2CSV
18322#include "cluon-rec2csv.hpp"
18323#endif
18324
18325#include <cstdint>
18326
18327int32_t main(int32_t argc, char **argv) {
18328 return cluon_rec2csv(argc, argv);
18329}
18330#endif
